About: I welcome guests from all walks of life and every culture.

I am a therapist/innkeeper.I know my city well and am know as a fab concierge. I love art, the outdoors, books, music and dogs. 
 fav activities? thrifting, museums, spending time at my yurt.

I am a visual artist who is  the  director of a community  Arts and Cultural Center, art studios and original art line the hallways of our space, which is a restored Hotel and we welcome all for Airbnb dream services. We have a large space but very clean and magical ( built as a hotel in 1904) our historical building has been lovingly restored .
We are committed to enhanced cleaning practices all cleaning standards suggested by CDC and respectfully ask that you do as well. If you are sick please do not travel.  I'm a fairly warm person, i like to give hugs but currently I am keeping social distancing and ask that if you visit us that you do also.  I spend time with my dogs and enjoy walking around the city with them.  Our vintage / restored guest rooms are located in the Centers lovely (Phone number hidden by Airbnb) building and we share the building with professional artist studios (mine included). The building is truly a magical charmer and  I think you will enjoy your stay here

Special things to be aware of
* I follow Airbnb’s enhanced cleaning protocol, which was developed with expert guidance. Here are a few highlights:

I sanitize high-touch surfaces, down to the doorknob
I use cleaners and disinfectants approved by global health agencies, and I wear protective gear to help prevent cross-contamination
I clean each room using extensive cleaning checklists
I provide extra cleaning supplies, so you can clean as you stay
I comply with local laws, including any additional safety or cleaning guidelines

***Please note that the rooms are on the second floor and we unfortunatly are not ADA accesible. 

***Also of note our space is in the city so it's active and not always cricket quiet some noise from events , street or airplanes may happen, if you need a super quiet space book a hotel in the country. Most of the time the building itself is quiet but we have planes that fly overhead and a hopping building with fun restaurants and a pool hall downstairs. I have two small elder Jack Russel's who may greet you but do not  stay in the space at night. I enjoy animals,art, gardening and meeting humans from all over the world. 
Although our building was built as a hotel but is now a creative and clean ( see our new cleaning protocols) place for you to stay, I only have one staff member and do all cleaning,booking and greeting (except evening arrivals) myself so it is appreciated that you let me know your arrival time (as close as possible) and communicate this When you book if possible. I greet you in person or our evening manager if your arrival is after 6 pm 
***After 10 pm arrivals \late arrivals will require a $20 hr surcharge**. Late arrivals  with prior arrangement may be accepted) please inform me of your arrival time at the time of your booking request. Of course we know that emergencies happen ( delayed flights are real) and will work with you to make sure you are safe and respected

I am an easy going person and  always try to keep our space filled with good energy. We welcome all here, this is a safe space. 
* please be vaccinated and provide your v card so we may keep everyone safe. Currently we are masking or social distancing in shared spaces
****NO SMOKING of anything inside BUILDING / NO VAPING/ …you can do all these things in our Smoking area outside. I  am easily accessible if you need anything, I am happy to oblige most requests and strive to make every traveler feel welcome  but I also will give you your space. I try to take Sundays off to rest and have time with my dogs. (Dogs live off site )
I am also happy to  help you plan a fun day here in Seattle.  I have allot of travel info and happy to give you any recommendations . We also have a wedding chapel on our property called Shotgun ceremonies ( you can find on (Hidden by Airbnb) ) if ya wanna get hitched while your here. You can also rent out ALL our rooms for your best people or just the brick room suite for the betrothed. The lovely officiant of Shotgun ceremonies can work with you on a wedding package ( and yes Elvis can be present ) believe it!!
We look forward to meeting youI cant wait to meet you!

To earn more about our community of Just (Hidden by Airbnb) Georgetown Seattle
My life motto
"Life is short, art is long"

The Sweet Orange reflects my passion and zest for life:  colorful, creative self expression;  well-cared for and clean;  lovable and loved!    I am forever tweaking, improving, learning and expanding in my creative endeavors and personal growth.  

Things I love:  The gardens at The Sweet Orange, and The Tangerine Dream, are my ever-evolving work in progress.  When I am designing, time stands still!  I am a world traveler and frequently on the go.  Dogs and kitty's!  My beloved Chessie, makes my heart sing!  Food and wine, for goodness sake.  I cherish good health and am a steward for a healthy planet.

I invite guests who travel as I do, with respect and regard for the gifts each place has to offer.  I welcome connection, as well as respect privacy.   Enjoy life and savor the color Orange!

Laura & Joe Ross - Having both owned houses before we married in February of 2009, we decided to try the vacation rental business rather than sell either.  Our first guests were Laura's family, in town for the wedding.  Since then, with Joe's work as a musician and dancer and our joint project of raising three kids, we are plenty busy!  However, we take pride in putting our visitors first and have really enjoyed meeting our guests and sharing the city we love with them.

I am an elementary ESL teacher in Seattle. 
  We love to travel and are happy to have the space in our house to have created a private apartment for  out of town guests. We are happy to help you navigate Seattle and discover its charm!
Daughter and Dad are busy with work and school and are offering upper floor of cozy home. We can steer you in the direction of fun and interesting sights in Seattle.
Medina Properties has been providing furnished accommodations fo 20 years. Reviews provided upon request. Situated in a boutique triplex with 2 short-term rentals and a 1-chair salon.

Hi! I am Danni. I love to travel, to meet other travelers and to share my Seattle apartment. I take pride in keeping it clean and comfortable.

I grew up in Sofia, Bulgaria and have lived more than half of my life in the US, of which 16 years in Seattle. I have also lived in Minneapolis, MN; Ft. Worth, TX; Maastricht, the Netherlands; Brussels, Belgium; and Barcelona, Spain. I am an adventure seeker, a bike commuter, a hiker/backpacker/climber, an avid traveler, a nutrition professor, a vegetarian, and most recently, a single parent by choice of two lovely little girls. 

Life is better with my daughters, mountains, good homemade food, music, a bicycle, poetry, and engaging conversations. I thrive on human connections, new experiences and ideas. 

When I travel, I love connecting with locals, going off the beaten path (and learning some of the local language) because these all give me a much richer experience. When I host, I care about my guests' comfort and try to help them experience the unique beauty of Seattle and the Pacific Northwest.
If I had to find one word to describe myself I wouldn't...

Hello my name is Ralph.  I'm a full-time photographer/graphic design with a life long fascination with Seattle.  You can see my (Email hidden by Airbnb)  You will also see some of my Seattle work on the walls of the apartment.  If you are interested in turning a portion of your visit into a photography workshop that results in artwork you create please let me know.  I can definitely help you if you are interested in the Seattle Art scene.

For 30 years Ralph specialized in community-based tropical agriculture. His job took him all over the world. One of the benefits was that he got to meet all kinds of interesting people, something he enjoys. So he can help you find the best, reasonably price ethnic food in Seattle. 

 I hope we get to meet during one of your stays.

I'm a school psychologist serving public elementary schools. Along with my husband's support, I have rented our home on Airbnb since 2011. We have had such a wonderful experience with Airbnb guests from around the world and have made many new friendships. We love our house and our "Utopian" neighborhood of Green Lake, and we're excited to share them with you. Recently we began renting our family cabin on Lake Nahwatzel as well.

Hi, I'm Tara. Hosting guests from around the world since 2010. Hopefully, we'll have the opportunity to host you as well! :) 

One of my favorite quotes:

“ Travel makes one modest. You see what a tiny place you occupy in the world.” - Gustav Flaubert.

Mark & Nadine split their time between their home on the Washington coast and the lower level apartment of the Seattle house.  When we're in town we are always available for guests that have any questions or need any recommendations. 

We have two grown children and two dogs that keep us filled with love. We try to travel as much as possible and love exploring wineries in France, spending time in Sayulita, Mexico and anywhere else our wanderlust points us.
We have 2 terrific boys age 5 and 1 and a pair of dogs. We love travelling, dining out, independent films and documentaries, a wide range of music and art and living the do it yourself lifestyle.

I'am Hispanic woman from Peru.  I have been living in the USA for last 37 years. 
I worked as Registered Nurse for 30 years and loves to be a great hostess for my  family and friends. 
  I love cooking, swimming, walking, exercising, dancing and karaoke, and traveling.
My house is well known by the counsel of Peru in Seattle W.A., honorable Mr. Miguel Angel Velasquez as "THE 5-STAR HOUSE" "LA CASA DE LAS 5 ESTRELLAS", because only  VIP people from Peru had come for different occasions and receptions or just to visit Seattle:  From Politicians, congressman, commanders from the Peruvian military, Doctors, Engineers, Mayors of different cities, Directors of Hospital and Universities,  top musicians from Peru and even the presidents of Peru, I had also been invited to Presidential Inaugurations which has been such great experience be able to not only see them but be close to all presidents of the US as well from Peru.  My house has gain a great respect among all my friends, family and friends from around my community. 
I hope you like art and paints because I have some beautiful murals in my house and colorful. Even the family room has sky with 1/4 of a moon, the sunset, and the stars at night that you can feel outdoors all the time day and night. It is exited, as  well as quiet, friendly and spotless for you. 
I will be waiting for you at any time or day. If you are interesting in trying some Peruvian food I can cook it for you, prepare sack lunches to take to your seminars, classes or tours, I can be your guide, driver, laundry needs, dry cleaner services and what ever you need count with my help.
As a Registered Nurse I specialized being a good therapist listening and advising people with their problems, specially those that has been experiencing a bad divorces, death in the family.  I am here to hear you and listen to you at free of charge.  Also if you need to practice your Spanish I can do this at free of charge.

Thank you,

Flor Cruz

Hi
Our names are Glen and Rose Marie we are a retired couple from Seattle.  We have a home in Montezuma and have lived the "pura vida" 6 to 7 months in Costa Rica every year since 2007.  We also love the north west US and have our home of 28 years  in Seattle in the Fremont neighborhood and  a duplex  in the Ballard neighborhood as well as well as a townhouse in the James Bay neighborhood of Victoria, BC which we just cannot give up so we have  turned them  into vacation rentals so we can enjoy them when we are around.   Since  we have vacation rentals you can be assured that we will  treat your place with respect and leave it in clean condition.  
I love to garden, cook, travel, getting to know interesting people form all over the world,  and also enjoying  the beauty of the places were we live!  Hope you will enjoy our homes as much as we do!

Sewing Pattern Designer & Instructor  I love fabric piles & gardening & the Pacific Northwest.  I hope you enjoy Seattle as it really is a great city!!
I am happy to assist you with anything.  I work at home most of the time except when I travel to teach sewing on national & international levels. 
Be warned the Zoo (Jackx, the yellow lab & Bobbin, the kitty will greet you!!

I hope you get a chance to discover Discovery Park, the largest park in Seattle where you can walk to the water or to the look-out over the bluff.  Pike's Place Market is not to be missed along with Seattle Art Museum, Gas Works Park, Kayaking in the Arboretum, & the chance to day-trip to small towns along the coast.

Just remember that "Life" is what we choose to make of it!!

I am an artist, interior designer, and run a small landscape business. My life revolves around beauty wherever I find it or create it. I grew up in Seattle and love this city for the people, it's natural beauty and don't know anywhere else I would rather call home. I love to travel and try to do so as much as possible and am excited to be a part of the airbnb community!

My roots are in Alaska, with many family members still living and working up there. I love to hike, ski, mountain bike, kayak, dig in the dirt, eat good food, and travel.  My husband is a furniture designer  whose workshop is located in the "Center of the Universe" (Fremont!) and is now the designated grill master with his specialty; wild Alaskan Salmon caught by our son!  Our other son was instrumental in getting this apartment up and running. Both occasionally come by for a few days at a time. 

We also have a karelian bear dog  that is now older than me in dog years. She is sweet, mellow, and loves a hello. She lives outside during the days and when we are home joins us upstairs. She often takes doggy vacations with our son for a few days or longer that she absolutely loves.
  
I spend my winter months surrounded by sweet, loving 6, 7, and 8 year olds teaching them to read and love books! 

We're happy to share our knowledge of Seattle and surroundings. We can send you off on some great trips culled from our many years of exploring the Northwest!
Native Seattlites who love travelling like locals and would gladly help you do the same. We strive to go above & beyond for our guests!
Hi, I  love to collect experiences.  I enjoy food, vintage finds, travel experiences and culture.

Hello fellow travelers and guests!

I love to adventure, meet people, create beautiful spaces, and share my home with guests. I live on Vashon Island, but have a cute little "pied a terre" in Seattle; The Nest in the Heart of the City. I've also opened up my family's longtime country home in Cornish, NH for guests to come stay in the heart of New England.

I'm a sign language interpreter by profession, and love what I do. When I'm not doing that, I'm usually on Vashon Island, working on my house there, or off exploring the outdoors; skiing, hiking, or biking. I love to travel, and want to try out Airbnb all over the planet!

I love to interact with people, so feel free to ask me anything about myself, and tell me a bit about you!

Happily hosting homes on Airbnb since 2011,  I also enjoy being a Airbnb guest around the world.  Love new experiences and travel, Seattle is a fabulous place to visit and call home.  Come visit!!! 

This is my one of favorite neighborhoods because of my beautiful tree lined street, with a mix of old family homes and condo buildings.  Many chic restaurants, boutiques and coffee houses are within walking distance.
We are a family of four and are passionate about life and all the little things it has to offer. We live on the same property which is detached from the vacation cottage.

Hi, we're a married couple living and working in downtown Seattle. We started hosting on airbnb about 9 years ago and we love it! We travel and use airbnb just like you, so we understand what it's like to be a guest. As you can see from our many reviews, we'll do our best to make your stay easy & comfortable. If you have any questions just get in touch!

Welcome to our Emerald City! Bagley Place is a vacation property, as we live nearby so it's easy should you need anything. I leave my guests to enjoy their visit in Seattle. There's a guest manual describing the home, the Green Lake neighborhood, and some recommendations for restaurants and activities. You'll find the Northwest is a wonderful place to visit and explore for all ages. We have several vacation properties nearby should you need additional accommodation. You'll find Bagley Place to be very comfortable (and kid friendly), as we also enjoy using Airbnb for all our travels. We hope to have the pleasure to accommodate you at Bagley Place soon, happy travels!

Hello travellers. I know that many people are concerned about Covid. I certainly was and have not been hosting during the pandemic. I am now resuming! I have been fully vaccinated and have created a self check-in so that you do not need to come into contact with me if that is what you prefer. I remain open to an in person greeting if the guest requests it and is willing to join me in masking.

I have been hosting on Airbnb for 10 years and have had wonderful guests from all across the U.S. and the world: Canada, China, Malaysia, Singapore, Norway, England, Korea, Australia and Germany to name a few. I have truly enjoyed these wonderful people and look forward to meeting  more of the Airbnb community and hosting you in my beautiful private studio. I recently added an additional option for guests. I now have a private bed and bath available on the 3rd floor!

Should you choose to stay in my private guest studio, you will find a private area  for your use. I live above the ground floor studio that is listed. If you choose to stay in the 3rd floor guestroom, that guest shares space with the host.

I am very well travelled- 21 National Parks in the US, several in other countries. I justed returned from my first trip after vaccination. I visited Redwoods National Park in May of 2021.  
I love hiking, backpacking, and generally being outdoors. I have river rafted the Grand Canyon and also in Alaska. If you are coming to Seattle and hope to visit Olympic, Mt Rainier, or North Cascades National parks, I can provide a little local insight. 

I love living in a vibrant urban village. My area has all amenities within walking distance, and this is important to me. I try to drive as little as possible, and for the past 5 years, I have driven less than 3,000 miles per year!

I am an avid tomato grower, so in the summer months, you will see dozens of varieties growing in my very small urban farm. I also grow garlic, onions, potatoes, and some years I grow peppers.

I am a good cook (using all my great organic veggies) but I will not be providing breakfast except in very special circumstances.


As your host, I want to provide a good quality night of sleep in comfortable surroundings.

I am a friendly and helpful Seattle resident working in property management.  I'm easy going but meticulous and committed to providing exceptional service.  I take pride in making people feel welcome when they stay at one one of my properties. It is always a pleasure to share this fantastic city with visitors. I look forward to meeting you!

I am a self-employed contractor currently transitioning into health care.  I have lived in Seattle and the Tinhouse for 20 years.  I am originally from southern Louisiana which I am eternally grateful for, but the Pacific Northwest climate and nature is the place for me these days.  My delights are hiking, learning languages, rock climbing, yoga, mushroom gathering, meditation, and pretending to play accordion.  I start each day with a cup of tea, usually black, sometimes green, so know that there's plenty at your finger tips if you come to the Tinhouse.  I look forward to meeting you if your travels bring you to Tinhouse on Beacon Hill. (P.S.) The references to Leah in the reviews are for my neighbor Leah, who managed the Tinhouse while I was away for 5 weeks.  Please pardon any confusion

My husband Tushar and I have lived in Seattle for 14 years. I was born and raised in London, England, and Tushar was born in Gujarat, India. We have 2 little daughters who are amazing bubbles of happiness.

We love this earthy laid back city and take a lot of pride in our 1930 home we have owned for 9 years and renovated with love. We were inspired to rent out our 1st floor apartment after traveling the world and staying in Airbnb rentals. We love sharing our home with travelers looking for a clean comfortable place to stay in the most convenient & chill neighborhood. We love it here!

In our free time we make all our favorite world cuisines, listen to records, ride our bikes, and work on our home.

We consider ourselves future thinking world citizens who love good design and continuous learning. 

We take pride in all that we do and are happy to open up this amazing part of our home to people who will appreciate the love that goes into it.

Bon Voyage!

Hello people! Samantha and Peter here. We have lived in Seattle since 2007 and love it. We met at Seattle Pacific University in 2003 when we were just teenagers, hit it off the first day, and got married over spring break in CA (don't worry, it was planned and had parental approval). Our interests include volunteering (and managing operations!) at The Giving Room food bank nearby, art, design, puppets, comedy, adoption, hiking, baking cupcakes, running, hiking, learning, and visiting as many beaches and parks in Seattle as we can. We are the proud parents of Rory and Rhys. We also have two lively Senegal parrots named Sunny and Ned. And we have two brother cats named Sammy and Davis. Peter shares his design expertise with businesses. Sam is in a career transition, back to school, and now working part-time directing the food bank! We started hosting guests at our Airbnb “Greenwood Studio” in 2012. Between 2018-2020 we welcomed au pairs to live in the studio long-term. Since 2021 we’ve been hosting guests again. We love meeting new people and helping everyone get the most out of staying in the Emerald City. We also look forward to being guests with other hosts as our lives permit those fun experiences.

Seth Gordon, owner of SeattleStays, has owned and managed Airbnb rentals in Seattle since 2009.   He and his team have hosted 100s of guest groups, providing comfortable short and long term accommodations.  In addition to providing a home base to vacation travelers, he frequently hosts people in town for medical treatments, work assignments, or locals that need a place to stay during insurance claims or home remodels. 

Seth is a global traveler with an appreciation for architectural details and delicious street foods.   He's had the good fortune of being one of the first hosts in Seattle, and was an early Airbnb employee focused on improving the product for hosts and guests.

 If you're considering coming as a guest without a full itinerary, he can give you the local scoop on a lot of great activities that you won't read about online or in your guide books.  Or, if you know the area or have it all figured out, just check yourself into the home and enjoy our stay.

If you are a property owner in Seattle that is looking for professional property management and marketing services on Airbnb, please reach me here, as we are growing our portfolio and looking to make new quality listings available to travelers in Seattle.  We provide a full range of services ranging from making your home guest-ready to accept your first guest, professional cleaning, property maintenance, and guest stay management.  You can sit back and collect checks - we handle the rest.

Retired, both artists, writers, and Cynthia messes with investments.  She used
to have a cabin on Orcas, which she and her husband built themselves.,We want
to ferry over to San Juan one day while we're there too.  It will be great to catch
up with all the changes since we've been there three years ago.
Also, we are airbnb hosts too!

I love art and "creation." I love to travel.  I look forward to winter snowshoeing, some US travel, hosting on airbnb and a trip to Germany (Autumn 2019).  2020 will be my 8th year as an airbnb host.   I speak French and Spanish (much better French) and I have worked in education, real estate, video, and parade art ensemble builds. 

My home is in the "center of the Universe" in the artsy and eclectic Fremont area - where you find the Troll under Aurora bridge, a great PCC coop, banks, shops, cafes, and a great night life as well.  

2020 Holiday Season
Holiday events in and around Fremont include the lighting of the Lenin Statue (for real), a parade of caroling boats creating truly heavenly sounds, the annual Winter Feast on or close to Dec 21, great shopping for unique gifts at all the local shops, First Friday art walk, New Years Eve spectacular fire works on Lake Union, and access to all the Seattle 2020 holiday excitement including the Nutcracker with the Pacific Northwest Ballet, and Seattle Symphony's New Years Eve Party!  

Summer Solstice
The famous Fremont Solstice Parade happens every June close to summer solstice.  Creator of the Ice Queenistas 2009-2012  I was an Ice Queen Clown in 2014  and accompanied a 7 foot articulated wolf/dog made from reed and white papier machee created by local artist, Sarah Lovett. In 2015 I was a banner carrier with the lead Samba ensemble group Girasol.  

The Neighborhood
As to the Fremont neighborhood, I moved here years ago thinking I'd stay a couple of years but many lattes, parades  and  3 homes later, I'm still here.  We have a smaller community of artsy, smart and creative people with heart, in the middle of the big city.  I live on a hill and have a great view of Mt Rainier on a sunny / clear day from one of the rooms and the back deck.  And it's always great to come home to this charming and awesome neighborhood.

FOODIE w/o gluten!!
After years, and maybe more years, I'm pretty much gluten and heavy carb free.  My cooking includes salads, chicken, veggies both raw and cooked, broths and soups, coffee, tea, coconut and chocolate desserts.  Love coconut oil and fresh salmon.
But I taste just about everything and never turn my nose up my guests regional cooking shares.

MORE...
For myself living without the open road, great friends, dream time, and my favorite shoes including some well seasoned ostrich boots from the Boot Lady in Seattle, is not an option.  

AND along with 2 treetop rooms upstairs, the cute and lovable 1 bedroom apartment is available for you too.  With a full kitchen and bath, and a great 40" Vizio flat screen that works with your chrome cast service,  you will love it. If you want extra privacy, your own fridge and cooking space,  and/or room for a couple of friends to travel with you, pick this option.  If you want 100% remodeled please continue your search.  If you love the unique and artistic life, clean, well supplied and situated on a country lane in the city do check out "Super cool in artsy Fremont"!     

Favorite coffee - Lighthouse Roaster from right up the street at 43rd and Phinney.
Favorite view - from the sun dial at the top of Gas Works Park hill.
Favorite Seattle park - Discovery Park
What I think about Eastern WA - it's an excellent secret - with wide open valleys, rolling hills, rivers, wheat fields and when the rain is over the top in Seattle, there's nearly always SUN!

How I feel about Puget Sound - big love - have to hop a ferry at least a few times a year to visit an Island or the Olympic Penninsula; have to walk on a gravel beach and skip a few rocks to remember the incomparable beauty of the place; seagulls make me happy.  Mt. Rainier is my sacred mountain - it calls me each year at least once to hike or snowshoe and feel the awesome presence of its magnetic core.  

I love traveling in France and Europe in general, Mexico, the American West and Southwest, and now, South America.  My favorite way to travel is to friends or family who live there.  Or with a group of like minded people on a small group tour.  Or by car locally and in the Southwest where the wide open spaces bring freedom to my soul.

Hello! I am Jay. My family, Colleen, Evan, Mica, four-legged and furry Gigi, and I, operate a cozy one bedroom vacation rental in a one-of-a-kind and recently called “One of the hottest neighborhoods in Seattle’s,” Columbia City. Just like you, we understand the need to stretch those travel legs and explore something new by yourself or with your family. Collectively, our family has travelled and lived all over the world (and very familiar with the finest in outdoor life and destinations of the Pacific Northwest and Seattle Area). We know the importance and challenge of after a day(s) of upset children and TSA personal-bubble attacks, you arrive and your destination is exactly as you expected. In hopes of earning the privilege and trust to share the Columbia City Treehouse Airbnb in one of your life’s memories, I will surmise with this… We are serious about the PNW, our city, our community, our friends and family and our business of providing a home-away-from-home for you and yours. We look forward to meeting and hosting you.

I'm a busy mom of three, two are teens now.  When I'm not keeping up with the kids and my husband I'm usually busy as a property manager for 20 units.  My newest passion is hot yoga.  I love the mountains and hiking with the family as well as visiting our many wonderful parks and beaches.  I also love to travel over seas, some of the places I've visited are Europe, Morocco, Singapore, Mexico and Taiwan.   I enjoy cooking Chinese food for my family and friends and love to entertain.  I use to be a ballroom dance instructor and still love going out dancing although admittedly I don't get out as often as I would like.  I also enjoy drawing and painting and playing the flute with my kids as they play their instruments.  

I really want to present a clean and comfortable living space for people to come and stay and get to know the city.  My goal was to not clutter the apartment with too many personal items so that you have plenty of space to spread out and make the space your own.  I hope you decide to stay with us.  Warm regards, Serina

We live and work in Seattle.  I am an attorney (mostly retired) and Mike manages University of Washington Physicians (UWP) health clinic processes.  I have a profile on AirBNB under (Email hidden by Airbnb) as well as information on (Website hidden by Airbnb)
I want you to enjoy all the culture and beauty Seattle has to offer while experiencing them in the most comfortable way possible!
Hi everyone!! I am a bay area native and I love to travel and meet new people.  I have enjoyed my experience so far with this site. I hope to hear from you :)

Nature loving, independent, busy conference and court interpreter, non-practicing mental health counselor, language access advocate, teacher and translator, each and every day of my life is different from the previous one. After 30 years in France, only vibrant and forward-looking Seattle and the magnificent Pacific Northwest could ease the culture shock of returning to North America. From my early years in the NY Metropolitan Area, I've had the best in everything. Multi-cultural musician and avid arts fan, I'm happy to share the beauty of my city and the peacefulness of my house and neighborhood with foreign guests as well as US people. In fact, my former renter has recently returned to her home country after graduating from a prestigious local university and living for 2 happy years in the space that I am offering. 

Can't live without? Music!
Life motto: Keep on walking.

Hosts Laura and Karl are multilingual (French, Italian, Spanish, German and a little Korean), progressive, conscious world travelers and eager to welcome you. They have traveled to more than 50 countries between them, are an inter-racial couple, and have a broad world outlook. We know what it's like need your own space and be able to ask locals for tips!

I'm a native Northwesterner and love to travel!  My husband and I have lived in our house in Fremont for 30 years with many pets and raising our daughter.  I especially love traveling in Europe, reading, cycling (my Dutch bike's name is Gladys!) and drinking tea- our house blend is Yorkshire Gold mixed with Vanilla Coconut Black!  I really like people and find airbnb a wonderful way meet and host other people in our sweet cottage.
   I love Thornton Wilder's quote: 
        WE ARE ONLY TRULY ALIVE IN THOSE MOMENTS 
 WHEN OUR HEARTS ARE CONSCIOUS OF OUR TREASURES.

I'm Product Manager who enjoys martial arts, running, cooking and doing home improvement projects in my spare time.  I like to host and really enjoy all the interesting people that stay in my home.  I love Seattle and am happy to share all the wonderful places I've discovered while living here.  As a host, I'm happy to give you lots of space or bring you in as part of my daily life (just let me know what you prefer).

Used to be a professor (Ph.D. in Political Economy), then a homeschooling mom and  a religious non profit organization founder, now like to travel, read / review books and manage properties. The best cities I like are Seattle, Florence, Sanya and Taipei.  (Taipei is chosen as the #1 out of 26 Remarkable Places For Solo Travel by BuzzFeed!  (Website hidden by Airbnb) We have  a few nicely furnished studios and one bedrooms condo apt conveniently located near University of Washington in Seattle with your own private kitchen and bathroom.  You will enjoy the convenient locations and quietness of all these buildings. You will also be surprised how quickly we respond to your requests as long as I am in town.  My motto is Providing Quality Places at Fair Prices and my life motto is in Philippians 4:13. 
BTW, I am praised for responsiveness. But I usually do not answer the phone calls on Sundays due to church meetings unless it is emergency , if not emergent but need to let me know prefer you just text me on Sunday afternoon .  Thank you.
My Belltown condo is now being managed by Sea to Sky Rentals, a professional vacation rental management company with over 15 years' experience!

I'm a musical Seattle-slicker with a type B personality.  A trans-plant from the Old East, I like the warm zone and a welcoming open mind.  I value work and enjoy adventure, slumbery mornings and lively nights, travel & exploration, friendship & family.  I enjoy meeting travelers, and facilitating experiences, striking a comfortable balance between privacy and community.  This people-to-people-connection is a sweet deal.  I offer guests a clean, spacious, private space to adapt as home while visiting wonderful Seattle.

We are a mother and daughter team who have lived in Seattle for 10+ years and we love it here.

We enjoy trying new restaurants, relaxing while drinking a great cup of coffee at one of the many wonderful cafés here, and Rachel knows all the best breweries, hiking spots, and cocktail bars.

There are so many fun things to do and see in Seattle and we can't wait to share our city with you!

Former Pan American Airline/United Airline Flight Attendant who has traveled extensively in Europe, Asia, South America, and the Caribbean.  I have lived in
Spain, Italy, St Kitts (Caribbean) and speak spanish, italian, and some french.
Enjoy meeting people from abroad and other places in the USA and Canada.  I
love to share places to go, restaurants, shopping in my city and was  a guide in the Seattle area.  Look forward to meeting new people and maybe making new friends.  I will always respect your privacy, but I am happy to help you plan a great holiday in a city I was born in and know well.
We love to travel as a family. We love hosting people around the world and love sharing the beautiful city of Seattle.
From Seattle. Loves to travel and experience new cultures
Quality driven and a high sense of integrity. Strive to give my guest(s) a nice environment to relax.

Born near San Francisco, but have lived in Seattle, Washington for 50 years. Have owned a business consulting company for many years which has funded leisure travel for several decades. Molly and I have a home in Seattle and Buenos Aires, Argentina, but still enjoy travel to other spots in the world. I'm an experienced traveler who enjoys red wine, cats, engaging conversations, and real people.

I  love to cook, travel, garden, hike, loaf around with my husband and our cats... On a typical night you'd find me trying out a new recipe,  playing scrabble with friends, or reading a book.  We maintain a large garden for our cats enjoyment as well as producing some staples such as tomatoes, chard, leeks and apples. I collect local cookbooks and we regularly check out the Seattle restaurant scene.  My husband Marc loves photography and collects antique cameras. we've travelled extensively, and are happy to have called Seattle home for over 30 years.
I love to travel! I like to meet new people and am friendly and helpful. I enjoy being on the water, yoga, skiing, reading, movies, and food.

Originally from San Francisco native, I have been calling Seattle home for over three decades. I enjoy coffee, boating, and beautiful design. I've spent most of my life working with architects and designers around the world. My wife and I have raised three girls here in Seattle. We love this city and constantly revel in its beauty. Weather permitting, we enjoy entertaining on our old wooden boat.
Peaceful , Love exploring and creating!  Love to travel meet people world wide. Positive
Wife, mom, Physical Therapist, volunteer, neighbor, friend, sister, host.   We're a quiet, bookish, musical, outdoorsy family.
Born and raised in Seattle I've seen the city change and have enjoyed it along the way.  I'm a business owner with a passion for people, travel and baked goods.

Hi, my name is Becky and I'd be delighted to host you in Seattle. Queen Anne is a great neighborhood for travelers with tree-lined streets, beautifully maintained homes, tons of neighborhood restaurants and shops, and close to downtown.

I'm from Chicago, but fell in love with the Pacific Northwest 20 years ago.  I'm a bit of a foodie, into gardening, brick-oven cooking, coffee roasting; an avid snowboarder, hiker and runner; and an enthusiastic fellow traveler.  I look forward to meeting you!
when presented with an opportunity to do something, and this thing is not morally hazardous, unlawful nor will it put anyone's life in danger - then do it

Hi there! I'm a Canadian healthcare provider and am married to Martin, an Austrian who works for a European institution.  We love Seattle and our friendly, community-oriented neighbourhood of North Beacon Hill where this little house was our first family home.  We enjoy travel, good food and music, gatherings with our friends and recently...kids.  We've outgrown our cheery little house with the addition of two little ones and have moved to Luxembourg for Martin's job and to be closer to his family.  We hope you enjoy Seattle and the wonderful experiences it has to offer!  Some of our favourites are: Silent-Movie Mondays at the Paramount, SIFF (Seattle International Film Festival), the Seattle Symphony, kayaking on Lake Union, mornings at the Market, ferry rides to the islands and and quick day-trips into the beautiful nature all around the Puget Sound.  Thank you for considering our home for your visit; guests like you make it possible for us to keep our little place and stay connected to our friends and neighbours in Seattle, so we appreciate it very much!

A resident of Washington since mid 70s and in Seattle for 35 years.  Now retired with time to travel and play. This home custom built for us in 2008 when goats became legalized as pets in Seattle made perfect timing. Our blackberry managers do their jobs beautifully and keep the chickens in line too. Goat Hill house is a delightful urban farm from which  to launch your pacific northwest stay.

My husband and I are travel aficionados! We love Barcelona, France, the Bahamas (Harbor Island), you name it. We have two amazing young daughters, which means we know what it means to travel with kids.

Our condos are modern, comfortable, and fully loaded with everything you'll need all the way down to the coffee beans! Secured parking and WIFI are included as well as a new 40" LCD TV.

We strive to provide a personal and unique experience for every guest, and take pride in quick responses and attention to detail. We look forward to hearing from you!

I am a working professional, yet I forget that I am an adult. Most days I still feel like an innocent child, just wanting to laugh and play my day away.  I consider myself to be adventuresome and curious.  
I think the city in which I live is one of the most remarkable places.  So many ways to connect with nature. I can ride my bike pretty much anywhere.  Each neighborhood as it's own quirky vibe, and amazing food.
Over the years I have travelled as far as New Zealand, Taiwan, Thailand, Vietnam and Japan. As well as Spain, Peru, Ireland, Slovenia, Croatia, The Netherlands, Belgium, France, Italy, Sweden, Norway, India, Sri Lanka and Bali. Next destination? Waiting for the Universe to disclose that :-)

Hi everyone,

my husband and I are from Germany originally but have lived in Seattle for many years. We love our life here in this beautiful city.

In our free time we love traveling, the outdoors, hanging out with friends , good food and conversation. If you need any help finding your way around the city, let us know, we'll be happy to point you in the right direction..

We consider ourselves respectful and easygoing people and would hope for the same in our "airbnb" guests. 

Happy Traveling!

I was a social worker. I am interested in people and cultures willing to share my home in Seattle with travelers wanting to have a clean, safe, and inexpensive accomodation.
UPDATE: Now, I have a dog, Cisco, a xoloitzcuintle (hairless Mexican) who I started babysitting (grand puppy) from my son and now he is a permament dweller. Because he does not have hair, there is not problem with perople with allergies. He is an excellent watch dog that protect us all!

Hi, my name is Fabi, I’m originally from Italy. I am an easy going, laid back person. I enjoy traveling, discovering new cultures and meeting new people. I speak fluent Italian and English.
I work for myself, running an Italian food distribution company. During my free time, I enjoy hiking, biking, watching movies, play soccer, cooking and dining. I also enjoy hanging out with friends & family. 
I moved to Seattle a few years ago. So I’m quite familiar with the cool local places in Seattle. When you’re at my place, feel free to ask me about the local stuff , activities & anything in general.
Looking forward to meeting you! 
 
A presto/See you soon
Baci&Abbracci 
Fabio

Hi!  

I am a Pacific Northwest native living and working in Ballard.  Originally from Olympia, I have lived in Seattle for over 33 years, 22 of which have been in Ballard.  I have a background in international business development working in French speaking developing countries.   

In addition, I own and operate two small restaurants and a catering business here in Seattle.

I have been a part of the Airbnb community for many years now and have enjoyed it quite a bit. I enjoy meeting people from all around the country and the world!  I also love being a hostess and it makes me very happy to see my guests enjoying their time in this lovely city.  :)

Please feel free to contact me should any questions arise.  I am very open to your inquiries and will do my very best to make your stay in Seattle fun, easy and comfortable!  
Best,
Errin, Dermot & OJ

Hi!
I am an active, happy and fun person. I teach Kindergarten in a local school. I share my home with a wonderful man, Seth and occasionally my adult children may stop by for a visit.

Live each day as a gift!

Hello! I am a Seattle Native. In 2000 I moved to New York and then Washington, D.C. and eventually decided to return to Seattle in 2008. I love fussing over details relating to this vacation rental, when I am not working at my day job as a freelance photographer/residential real estate broker with Windermere Real Estate. I enjoy biking, skiing, fishing and trading notes with pretty much anyone on the vibrant restaurant scenes in Seattle, Portland and Vancouver B.C. I also love renovating homes,  (six in 11 years), There's just something addictive about the process of creating something personal, beautiful and functional, for friends and guests to enjoy. The highest compliment was when one of our contractors asked if he could bring his wife to stay at the cottage for their anniversary.

I live in Seattle with 8-year-old daughter. Gardens, art, music and cooking are some of my passions, and I love to explore new places. I'm lucky to merge my love of art and gardens with my work making innovative artwork for the public.

We are Larry and Suzi Hettick.  We are both from Oregon and have lived and traveled to many US and overseas locations but moved to Seattle in 1992 to make this our forever home.  This home has been our focus and passion for the last 20 plus years to help restore it to its original condition while remodeling and upgrading it to accommodate modern features.  Our basement has been our latest project – over a year in the making we have transformed over 500 square feet of space into an apartment that hopefully provides all the comforts of home.  We selected this Capitol Hill location for its historical heritage, its convenient access to all that Seattle has to offer and its friendly neighborhood atmosphere.  You will definitely feel welcome here.

I enjoy hiking, running and yoga. I am a Professional Coach, Trainer and world-traveler. I enjoy meeting people from new places and learning about different cultures. I look forward to welcoming you and meeting you!

I am a photographer and designer (architectural/interior) who loves urban homesteading, cooking everything from scratch, and has one too many restoration projects in the works. I am a thrift and antique store JUNKIE.

I love creating spaces and experiences that surprise and delight people. I actively work to surround myself with things and experiences that look good, smell good, feel good, taste good and sound good -- and I love sharing the very best of what I find and learn in that pursuit with others!

My life motto: Life is short and I want to do it ALL!

We are a Danish American couple living in Seattle with our soon to be grown children. Lene is the Dane, Johnny is the American. We like music, art, food, and fun. As hosts we will stay out of your way but can also provide information on the city, neighborhood and happenings around town.

In the middle of my third lifetime and best yet.  We have lived all over the world but will always have a home in Seattle.  And now we have two!  We use this home as our getaway place and live downtown to enjoying the vibrancy that is Seattle.

I love anything and anywhere in Italy.  Long for much more time to spend in Paris.  It's a great city to just hang.  Have lived in Sydney and London for several years.  Enjoyed many trips to New Zealand.  Travel all over Europe.  Have been to 48 of the United States.  Enjoyed trips to Bangkok and Hong Kong.  I'm spending my honeymoon in The Maldives, Singapore, and back to Hong Kong,  I have a wanderlust in me!

My name is Amaris. I am friendly and outgoing and love to travel. I love the outdoors and exploring new places. 

My style of hosting. We are both relatively busy people so we are pretty hands off but we are happy to give you plenty of recommendations of places to check out on your stay and answer any questions you may have. 

My favorite travel destinations have been Kauai, the Philippines, Thailand, Greece and Italy. Can you tell I like warm places? ;)

We're easy-going couple on Capitol Hill in Seattle.  We love hosting on Airbnb, driving our MINI Coopers and experiencing new travel adventures.

Our mini-dachshund, Rash, keeps us busy and will want to welcome you if you stay with us.  He's excitable and friendly.  Many guests have commented on his ability to make you smile. 

We love to show people around our fair city; open to giving you ideas of places to go, restaurants to eat and attractions to see.  

If you're staying with us, we'd to happy to extend some ideas for exploring Seattle and surrounding areas.   We tend to leave you to your space when you stay with us, but we are happy to answer any questions.  We expect guest to be respectful of our home.

If we're visiting you, we would love to hear your tips on getting to know your city. Quaint shops, good and cheap eats.  

When we respond to your requests, Chad (Left, in the photo), tends to communicate with you.

I am a fun-loving world traveler, cook, gardener, artist and reader. One of my biggest pleasures in life is learning about a new place, new people, new food- both through my own travels and as a host.  My friends would describe me as active, open, engaging, funny and liberal. I was raised in the deep South of the USA (Georgia), the youngest of 5 siblings, but have lived in Seattle for 25+ years. Seattle is a hot bed of music talent, and I take advantage of it by staying updated on emerging talent and attending as many live performances as I can. I am often the oldest person there, but so what! You could not ask for a better city to live in if you are a foodie, as I am.  The variety here is unbelievable. My profession is Interior Design, so of course, design and art are an important part of my life. Books, and more books- don't even try to talk to me if I have a book in my hand!

I have three absolutely gorgeous and brilliant daughters who no longer live with me, which naturally makes them even more attractive! They live in Los Angeles and San Francisco and I visit them often.

My travels have included, but are not restricted to: most of the states within the USA, Canada, Mexico, Guatemala, Argentina, Cuba, France, Spain, Portugal, Italy, Croatia, Slovenia, Morocco, South Africa, Viet Nam, Cambodia, Laos, Thailand, and China. I love hiking, camping, and staying places off the beaten tourist path. I will always choose a host over a hotel- how better to really learn something about the place you bothered to travel?

Once upon a time, I spoke pretty decent Italian, but am rusty and out of practice. I would love some Italian guests to practice with (or rather, "with whom to practice", as I will claim to be a grammar expert). My French is even rustier. I have begun to study Spanish recently. I have a great love of the English language and grammar- yes, I was that person in school who loved diagramming sentences, and always had my hand in the air to answer the grammar questions while everyone else's eyes were rolling back in their heads! I am TESOL certified (Teacher of English as a Second Language), and hope to live abroad and teach at some point in my future. In the meantime, I have volunteered to teach English to refugees here in Seattle. Combining hosting and teaching have great appeal to me.

I can't live without: Spicy food, friends and family, some crafty project, music, art, fertile soil, books, travel, and my boyfriend.

Seattle, Washington.  U.S.  I am a physician.  Peter is a teacher/painter and we have 2 teenagers.  We love Seattle and can help you know the area and decide what to do.   We also backpack and camp.  We like to walk and bike around cities. We enjoy water, lakes, kayaking, canoeing, and swimming.   We love art, museums, music  and cafes.  Within 3 hours in all directions from Seattle is Canada, islands, mountains, volcano, water, ocean, whales, Oregon, desert, the biggest trees you'll ever see and more.

My husband Christian is an executive for a financial software company and I am a writer. We love Seattle, but because our work is mobile we like to jump up and go as often as we can.

Our son Xavier (8) and daughter Georgia (6) have plenty of kid gear, toys and books for your children to use. If you don't have anyone who wants to play LEGO, we just put them away. 

Before kids, I was a travel guide in Antarctica, the Arctic and Alaska.  Christian and I have lived in Turkey, Argentina, Korea, England, Canada and around the US at different points and we love to explore new regions as well as revisiting favorite locales.

I was a Rotary Exchange student in high school, as were my three siblings, and we love our international extended family.  We have been shown such warm and generous hospitality throughout our travels over the years that we look forward to giving you the same feeling when you stay in our home. 

We love to read, cook, entertain and keep up on culture as much as we can.  We snowshoe and ski in the winter, hike and bike in the summers. We also love to play tour guide if there is anything particular you want to do in Seattle - just ask!

We hope you make wonderful memories during your stay in Seattle!

We are both triple vaccinated and give you plenty of social distancing.
Phil moved to Seattle in 1995, drawn by the music scene and great outdoors.  He travels 3 months out of the year for pleasure.  Andrea is a native of Italy and moved to Seattle in 1995, also drawn to the music scene and the splendor of the USA.  He was worked in tech, owned a coffee shop, and now is a translator.  We share the same motto:  treat others the way we want to be treated (making our american and italian catholic school nuns proud).

I have been an art teacher for 22 years and we like to travel and see new places during the summer.  We also like to create an affordable and relaxing place for people like ourselves who want to travel on a budget.   We love our home and hope you will too.

I'm a Seattle native who loves to travel and experience cities from a local's perspective. I'm well-versed in my own city, so I can tell you where to go and how to get there if you tell me what you're interested in doing or seeing. I also love to cook, so if you come at the right time there may be a homemade feast available.

April: vegetariancatladyblackthumbsgardenerbadkneesarthritichandslovesmusicwishIcoulddanceproudmomof4

Mike:  journalist, handyman, history major, big into cycling

Margaret:  college student, double major in Chinese and science, loves highland dance, the violin, and roller skating (quads!)

I was born and raised in Seattle.  I am a business professional who loves to cook, garden, make soap, enjoy our family, friends and of course our dog Daisy Mae.  We're looking forward to sharing our place in a great neighborhood with you.

I love to travel, but I also love my hometown.  I try to live simply and not surround myself with too much clutter, and I find that sometimes life in the city can be a bit overwhelming so I enjoy coming home to a quiet and relaxing space.   I can't live without mountains and being near water, I'm outside about 90% of the time, yes, even in the rain.  My hosting style is very hands-off; I will leave you with all the info you need and am happy to answer any questions, provide suggestions, etc. - but I just want you to make yourself at home!

I am a chef & culinary arts instructor. I am an award-winning advocate for sustainable food systems, a cookbook author and a mom.  I love lard, goat cheese, farmers, fishers, cooks, poets and being an earthling. 
I adore travel, meeting people, exploring other cultures and history. Our family enjoys sharing stories and good food with our friends.

Hello!

In addition to being hosts, we are frequent Airbnb guests. We first stayed at an Airbnb location in Sydney, Australia, while honeymooning in January 2012, and were so impressed with our experience that we are now hooked! Not only are the Airbnb properties a good value, but more importantly, we have had amazing interactions with each of the hosts at locations where we've stayed, which now have expanded beyond Sydney, Australia, to include a handful of locations in our home state of Washington as well as cities throughout the U.S. and also other countries including Tanzania, France, Canada, England, The Netherlands, and Germany. We've been a guest in more than 40 different Airbnb locations over the past 9 years. In fact, I can't remember the last time we stayed at a conventional hotel!

Since we had such great experiences as guests, we decided to start hosting in the summer of 2012 and listed our guest room on Airbnb. Hosting has proven to be a fantastic experience since we are both seasoned travelers and enjoy chatting with others about their travels, etc.

We are avid travelers and are also are very tidy and respectful. Beyond travelling, we like listening to live music, exploring neighborhoods, having fun with our dogs, gardening and cooking great food, spending time near the water/beach, and meeting new people.

Bill is an entrepreneur and Huong is a philanthropy advisor. 

In the past seven years, we have hosted 300+ terrific Airbnb guests from around the world. Our guests have stayed in the backyard guest cottage for vacation, hospital rotations, technology assignments, work trips, university visits, and relocation searches.

My roommate and I host guests at our house in seattle and have second house that I am the manager of. The bookings are all through my roommates profile so the reviews aren't visible here. Our listings are a series of "Capitol Hill Excursion" and "Crayola Home" in the Seattle Capitol Hill neighborhood. 

I am excited to travel with airbnb and meet hosts from around the world! I am using airbnb currently to find places to stay on my first international trip! 

I'm a recovering social worker and have been taking time away from that line of work to enjoy the brighter things in life!
Author, chef, consultant, coach, freelance writer.
I'm originally from Rockford, Il. Spent many years in the Chicago area where I owned an art gallery.  I moved to Seattle about 15 years ago and just love this area.

We are young parents who love each other, our daughters, and living in Seattle. We travel, host friends and family, love the beach and being outdoors, and exercise of many kinds. We started sharing our home on Airbnb in 2013 and haven't looked back since. Having purchased a vacation home and a small apartment, we feel blessed to share our small handful of homes with others so that they can enjoy a special experience when traveling.  We have consistently earned Airbnb's Superhost status since the program first started, and pay our housekeepers very well after every guest which attributes to our very high cleaning and overall satisfaction ratings by guests.

I am an international traveler residing in Seattle.  As a mother of three I enjoy spending time with my family and taking in everything Seattle and our neighboring areas have to offer.  The Pacific Northwest is a great place for to have fun all year long; from our great outdoors to our fabulous dining and entertainment.  I enjoy clean and simple spaces with the convenience of being in the city, yet near parks and recreation and that's what you'll find with me as your host!  Live, Laugh and Love what you do!

Hello, I've lived in Seattle on-and-off since 1996. I run my business from home, but travel quite a bit. Always interested in meeting people from around the country and globe and sharing my home with them.
A mom, an engineer and a wife that likes to travel with my family and friends. We like to travel and experience tourism like locals and always stay in Airbnb when possible.

I love to travel and experience new places. Air BNB is my favorite way to stay in a new city or country. The unique stays and experiences cannot be beat. My home base is Seattle and I enjoy sharing my knowledge and love of the city with visitors.

A Pacific Northwest native, I work in advertising and spend my weekends hiking, gardening and traveling. I've been lucky enough to have traveled to over 30 countries from Nepal to New Zealand. I love seeing the world and meeting new people.

My husband and I both love to travel and visit new places.  Often times when we are traveling it is theatre related.  We work with several local theatres in Seattle and Portland.  Additionally we work with individual theatre artists to help them tour their shows to fringe theatre festivals.  In the past this has taken us to Vancouver BC, Portland, Fresno and New Orleans.  We hope to continue to expand our list...  When we travel we prefer to stay someplace that we can have a kitchen so we can save a bit on food and make our own snacks and breakfast.  This worked great for us on our honeymoon that we took to Prague and Krakow in 2010 and have continued the practice ever since.  We are non smokers, animal lovers, respectful of others property (and neighbors), wine drinkers, history buffs, and happy world explorers.

Retired pirate/college professor, world traveled, Jack of all trades and teller of great tales.
Jill is a flight attendant for Delta and speaks Italian and French.
We are normally on board and available to assist with transportation and things to see and do.

I freelance in a creative profession, love to travel worldwide for my clients and for fun. Enjoy life to the fullest and finally feel like I'm living the life I've worked so hard for! Couldn't be happier!!

"Hostess with the Mostess"........ Your 5-star Hostess, whose main concern is the comfort and happiness of her Guests!  Hospitality at its best!  Providing comfortable and exceptionally clean accommodations. I have been providing hotel alternative accommodations at this location since 2007.  I very much enjoy doing this and have met all types of travelers from all over the USA, Asia, and  Europe. I provide my Guests with everything needed upon arrival . I have found that providing housing with the emphasis on hospitality to be very rewarding as well as very busy - as there is never a dull moment!   I also take pride in providing very clean and well kept accommodations that are constantly being updated and refined. My main objective in this business is to provide the best accommodations possible and hospitality to all!

I have lived in Seattle, WA for over 40 years.  I have two adult children in the Seattle area and four grandsons.
I grew up in a small town in eastern Washington State, USA.
I am an environmental planner.  I have practiced in this field for over 40 years with counties, and cities in Washington State and with several consulting firms.  My specialties are project management of environmental review and preparation environmental codes.  I have worked on a range of public infrastructure and private development projects.  My specialties include land use, visual quality, noise, light and glare impacts.
I have travelled extensively in the US, and less extensively in Europe.  I have visited New Zealand, Australia and Peru.

I've called Seattle home for the last 20 years and have always loved living on Queen Anne.  I'm a business owner but most importantly a mom to my kids. My vintage Queen Anne Home is the perfect location for your Seattle stays and I  love sharing  it with visitors from around the globe.
Born in D.C, but essentially a Seattlite through and through. I travel often for work, and am a pretty organized/punctual dude.

Pacific Northwest Native that loves helping travelers find high quality, luxury, alternative accommodations. I have a variety of fully furnished vacation rental homes around the Seattle, Puget Sound, and Lake Chelan areas.

I’m Candace, an original Seattlelite!  Love the outdoors, cooking, and good friends! I know where many staircases  in Seattle are, if you ever are curious!  I know about Seattle's bascule bridges, Chinese food, city parks, International district/Chinatown, dim sum, walks in the city,  'postage sized' parks, farmer's markets, jogging routes, great bike rides, and other odd things.  
Love Jazz,  Seattle and it's surrounding towns are the homes of many an outstanding high school jazz programs!  
Love cooking for friends and enjoying the ephemeral nature of a well spent evening of laughter and fun with family and friends, nothing better! 
Enjoying communicating in different languages, languages are so rich with the subtleties of culture, values, and character.  I speak Toisan dialect, Mandarin, having studied Russian for 8 years, a little Japanese, Italian and wish I was a polyglot!
 
My motto is to live in a way, that “I have no regrets whatsoever, my heart is as deep as the clear blue skies."  (Daisaku Ikeda)

I'm a multimedia artist working with light, sound, sculpture and other media to illuminate ideals of eco-consciousness, respect, peace and love.  Vegetarian and avid cook, with a love for the garden and all that comes out of it. Hungarian-born traveler, currently residing in Seattle.

I dig many parts of the world and some of my favorite cities are Vancouver BC, San Francisco, Portland, NYC, Frankfurt, Berlin, Vienna, Prague, Budapest, Istanbul.

As a guest I would be respectful of you and your space. I would leave the place clean and play with your cat or dog if you have one.  I would not snore or sleepwalk or levitate above the bed. 

As a host I will provide a relaxing atmosphere with great amenities in a superb location. I'm down-to-Earth, easy-going and accommodating.  Mutual respect makes for great relationships.

I have lived in many states. I moved to Seattle in 1980 and fell in love with it. I am self employed and a lover of life and adventure! 
 I live in an amazing location in a beautiful home....I love my home and even though I am a  world traveler I am always so grateful to come home to this sweet spot of heaven. 
I love sharing this special space and I have hosted friends from all around the world.  I have enjoyed opening my home to host women's retreats, workshops,  satsangs and other community gatherings.
I am a lover of the arts & creation, I celebrate the diverse experiences that life has brought me.    I love to travel be it in plush style or car camping on long road trips. I've been to India, Columbia, Peruvian Amazon, Mexico, Canada, Costa Rica, Jamaica, and most US States. I love meeting people from all over the world. 
I am very fortunate that my daughter lives near by and has been a wonderful help in looking out after my beautiful home while I have traveled and when I need her assistance. 
 I share my home with my 5year old grandson and our little furry boy named Noah.  He is my very well behaved 11 year old, super sweet, little, hypoallergenic, Habanese dog. He knows how to put a smile on every ones face! Happy is his middle name!
 Jayden, Noah and I are all thoughtful hosts. I once was told I must of been a tour guide in a past life, and so if you would like suggestions, I can help you make the most of your time here in Seattle.

Hi there! My name is Shel and I am in the beautiful Pacific Northwest I heard about Airbnb through many of my friends and all of there experiences have been positive, so I figured I would jump on the band wagon.

I will be travelling to different parts of the world (Italy, Ireland, New York City and Hawaii) with my job over the next year and our beautiful apartment, one block from UW in Seattle, will be empty. We felt like it was such a shame to see it empty and none of our friends and family were available to use our space, so we figured we would try Airbnb!

I absolutely love what Seattle has to offer. I love the hikes, consistent fresh air and unbelievable scenery.

I play softball, and do so competitively nationwide, I am very active and love exploring new places in the city and surroundings.

Personally, 5 things I can't live without... sunshine, friends, community, great food and sports. I actually hold activities for the #2 food group (Seattle True Foodies) in the nation. I am also the secretary of the Seahawks Tailgate Crew. Rent my place and you will be my guest at our party.  Help up save for a place of our own.  I absolutely love life!

Well, that's me!

I have recently retired as Head of School for a small Seattle independent  elementary day school. Forty-six years in the field of independent elementary and secondary education have been truly rewarding ones.  My wife, a recently retired Seattle City Planner, and I are excited about this next phase in our life's journey. Between hosting Airbnb guests since 2014,  gardening in our home's "urban oasis", and actively discovering this exciting next phase in our lives together fills us with such joy.  We've lived in this 1906 Dutch Colonial home for 33 years and love to recommend to our guests the local treasure chest of world-class dining, city neighborhood walks and sites to enjoy in our local Pacific Northwest's Puget Sound.
Musician Teacher

Patrick and I moved to Seattle 10 years ago and fell in love with Queen Anne!  We have 1 kitty,  Blue.  We enjoy travelling, entertaining in our home and going to the theater!

Our home has been our passion over the last 8 years and we are excited to share our amazing bottom floor with guests.  

We look forward to having you enjoy our Highland Hideaway!

I am a dedicated host with a lovely duplex apartment available for long term stays for business travelers, or others looking for housing for a month or longer.

Five things I can't live without: good food, my health, open space to run, my Mac, and good people in my life!

I love travel and part of any great travel experience, for me, is connecting with 'the locals'. My philosophy of Airbnb hosting is to provide a lovely, hassle-free place to stay. 

I am quiet and professional, and I invite like-minded travelers to have a wonderful stay in a clean, bright, freshly refinished apartment close to Green Lake Park, downtown, UW and much more!

Welcome to my home! Let's get to the fun part:

I have to say one thing first: I love pork. There's nothing better than roasted pork tenderloin, perhaps wrapped in bacon with a honey, balsamic vinegar, and red wine sauce. I could eat pork for breakfast, lunch, and dinner. Sometimes, I feel bad about that because my grandma was Jewish, but she served ham on holidays sooooo. But I sometimes try to be a vegetarian for the environment, and it's so haaaard.

I'm from California, so I'm not a typical Northwestern person. I like recycling, but composting is the absolute worst. (Update: I now compost!) I also like saving the world and being green friendly, but I'm very cheap and hate buying more expensive green products. 

I love to travel and experience new things. I'm always looking for an inexpensive getaway for a week or weekend. (We may have that in common?) I'm also an introvert, which makes me a bit of a contradiction since I'm really loud and sometimes obnoxious. 

My life motto: Don't be an a-hole. And that is the truth. (My therapist said I had to choose a more positive mantra. Eh) I also believe you should live your damn life as much as you can. It's short. Be who you are, not who you think others want you to be. 

People tell me I'm funny. It's true. I am funny. Someone told me I'm captivating once too. That just made me roll my eyes.

I am a fanboy for Jurassic Park. It's my favorite movie, and I will not tolerate anyone disliking it! 

I'm also a ridiculous fan of Game of Thrones/A Song of Ice and Fire. Maybe you'll see my tattoo from the novels. MAYBE NOT.

My favorite all time place to travel is South Lake Tahoe. I grew up going there every year, and it just doesn't get any better than that. There is something particularly magnificent about its smell. Pine trees are my favorite. You might notice that in my tree-themed library/entryway. I love trees. I just got a pine-tree tattoo. PNW and Lake Tahoe love for life.

Places I've traveled to: Caribbean, France, Spain, Italy, Monaco, Israel, England, Scotland, Wales, Northern Ireland, Ireland, Sweden, Norway, Hawaii, Grand Canyon, Disneyland, Disney World, Chicago, Boston, Vancouver, BC, Portland, OR, Ukraine, Austria, Hungary, Thailand, Lithuania, Latvia, Estonia, Poland, Netherlands, Belgium, Germany, New Zealand, Iceland, South Africa (I visited a past Airbnb guest! Spoiler: He broke my heart. Fun game: Guess who it was based on the reviews.), Samoa, Vanuatu, Fiji, Tonga, Bali, Malaysia, Singapore, Australia, Vietnam, Laos, Cambodia, Thailand, Myanmar, Sri Lanka, Egypt, Greece, Portugal, Slovenia, Bosnia, Serbia, Macedonia, Croatia, Bulgaria, Czech Republic, Romania, Turkey, and Denmark. --phew! That took a lot of typing.

Places I've lived: Sacramento, CA, Salt Lake City, UT, Maui (3 months counts, right?), and Seattle, WA.

I don't have five things I can't live without. I have one. And that is my smart phone. I will die before I give it up. It is always within a foot of me, and I feel lost without it.

As a host, I hope I'm welcoming and provide a few laughs and fantastic food recommendations. Or we might not even meet. It all depends on the day! My full-time job is unpredictable. My house may not be the place for you if you depend on having a host there all the time to make you breakfast or turn your bed down at night. I can either be the busiest person or the biggest couch potato in the world. Next week, I'm working 12-14 hours every day. The week after, not so much.

Cool fact: I could say "hello," "goodbye," "thank you," and the number 2 in 5-10 languages. I was that awesome. But now I'm not as awesome and lost this skill. Help me learn again? Julie.365.weekend on insta.

My name is Steve.  I am a civil engineer who works on environmental consulting projects. I enjoy hiking, skiing, playing cards and boardgames, touring the sites and sounds of our city, and listening to live music.  

I love to travel locally and around the northwest.  I enjoy seeing local live music, playing music, brewing beer, and playing disc golf.  

Mi Casa es SU Casa - I want you to feel at home and enjoy our city.  

Being that we live in the northwest, I recycle and compost all of my products and hope you can pitch in too with your waste.

We have lived in the the Queen Anne neighborhood and worked downtown since 1986. We enjoy the outdoors: skiing, biking, hiking and car camping. Gary is a hang glider pilot and Beth is a knitter, sewer and all around craft maven.

I have enjoyed hosting Airbnb guest since 2013. It has been a rewarding experience meeting people from all over the world.  I enjoy hiking during the summer and often go in a group  at least once a week.  Also enjoy gardening, biking, yoga, and swimming. One thing that is important for you to know about me and my family is that we recycle. When you stay with us our written house rules will explain where to put your plastics, glass and paper and where to put your food waste.  Hope you share in the same values of taking care of our Earth.

Long time Ballard resident originally from east coast.  Love the Ballard neighborhood, home to many fine restaurants and bakeries, the colorful Ballard sunday market, shops, spectacular walks and bike routes.

I think we all probably hate to fill these out huh? so, I have an out going personality, though as I get older I also appreciate my down time. I'm a father of a beautiful young lady, the son of awesome parents, the partner to a great guy, and loyal, loving friend to many. My given name is Scott but my friends call me Skip. I have lived in Seattle since 2003 and couldn't imagine living any where else. I love this city, the location, the weather, yes, even the weather, ...just everything about this place sings to my spirit. . I guess, like the most of you reading this profile, I am a guy who likes to think out side the box, adventurous, did I spell that correctly? ;-)   So I have no doubt this will be a work in process but for now this will have to do. ;-)

I'm both a host and frequent user of Airbnb. We moved into the house in fall of 2013 and have been working to finish decorating and furnishing it. My favorite parts of the house are the roof deck and the garden. I look forward to sharing both with you!

Outgoing, cat-lover and sometime foster mom to feral kittens, work in non-profit, and crazy about tiny houses.  [Don't know why - I blame my parent from our time living in a converted school bus (very cool!)]

I traveled on and off for several years, but have been firmly anchored by my home since 1999.  Ready to travel a bit more again, and always enjoy meeting interesting people from far away - and nearby - places.

My family has lived in this house for the past 15+ years.  I, Paul am a fan of all things leisurely, including playing golf and sipping mezcal. My wife Susan is active around the lake and at the kids' schools.  Both of us work at a local aerospace company that is occasionally in the news.  Our mellow and respectful kids are 15 (girl) and 13 (boy).

Our story: we lifted this house over 10 years ago and put a brand new, legal accessory dwelling unit (apartment) under it.  It is an above-ground apartment that has great views and gets great natural light (for Seattle, anyway).  We live in the 2 floors above. The apartment worked great as a long-term rental (4 sets of very satisfied tenants), but now we like using the space at certain times of the year; hence, Airbnb.  While we are relaxed and sociable, we are very conscious of your privacy! 

This place is a great spot for enjoying the lake and is a short jaunt to UW or downtown (and is also on the route of the Microsoft Connector -- feel free to ask about Corporate Housing / extended stays).  Any other questions about us, the place, or the neighborhood -- don't be shy.  Thanks for looking!

I have been living in Seattle for over a decade and I love this city. I have met great friends here and like taking advantage of what this city has to offer. I love to travel to faraway places, play lots of soccer, and dabble in photography. 

I can't live without family/friends, laughter, soccer, adventure, and good health.

I am an optimistic guy and very easy going. I like keeping things simple and treating others the way I would like to be treated. I like helping others and making people laugh.

We are a small family that loves everything Seattle and the Northwest has to offer.  We love to ski, hike, climb, surf.....its all surrounding us here in the beautiful Northwest.  In addition, we enjoy all that the wonderful city of Seattle has to offer!!

I grew up in BC and Washington and after a number of years on the East Coast I am happy to be home. I live in Seattle with my wife and our three kids. When we're not working we like to get out into the mountains, hike, ski, and spend time together, especially at our cabin near Leavenworth.

I'm a Montana farm-raised, Seattle city-dweller who spends time traveling and working remotely.
