Hi, I moved to Seattle in 2005 after living in Portland for 12 years.  My wife is a West Seattle native.  We love to travel and also explore Seattle.  We know a little about everything that goes on in Seattle so can help recommend things to do to fit your interests.  We have an 3 year old and a 6 month old infant and are enjoying parenthood.

We are live in Bainbridge Island, my husband and I have four girls ages 10-19.  I am a clinical herbalist and my husband, Albert is in finance. We love to travel, to cook, be outdoors, drink wine, and be with friends and family.

Lawrence Lofts is a 130 unit property built in 2012 on Capitol Hill. Known for our modern and industrial design, it's a place that many people are happy to call home. To give everyone a taste of the Lawrence lifestyle, we have converted one apartment into a guest suite and book it out for Airbnb whenever possible.

Staying here, you will be within walking distance to the Pike/Pine triangle where you can experience Seattle in it's true form. Bars, Restaurants, boutiques, nightlife, and music. Capitol Hill is where it's at!

We are new to the Airbnb community but would love to make your trip to Seattle flawless. Contact us with any questions or requests! 

- Lawrence Lofts xx

We are natives of the beautiful Pacific Northwest.  Barbara and I both recently retired from interesting careers as attorneys and judges. We've lived in West Seattle for over thirty years and love everything about our little slice of heaven: Puget Sound and its beaches, spectacular views of the Olympic mountains and the Sound, and easy access to all that the city and the region have to offer. We love that Airbnb gives us the opportunity to share this special place with others.
Where the heck am I, and how did I get here?   Aquatic addict, buoyant, waggish, efficacious, sagacious, convivial companion, cancer thriver, good samaritan and an especially gifted napper.

Born and raised in Chicago, Illinois USA, and love all the diversity of big cities via culture, food, architecture, and off the path treasures.  Spent the last 20 years in the Pacific NW outdoors, hiking, kayaking, and skiing.  My world travels involve many of the passions above combined with contemporary/jazz dancing and including my furry children in the worldwide activities.

Hello! My bride, Lynn and I are Seattle natives and former expats who love to travel. Having ‘local’ experiences is always our goal and we’re looking forward to sharing our hometown knowledge with visitors here for both business and pleasure.  Our suggestions for what to do on rainy days, where to find the best craft cocktails and not to missed views are captured in our guest book.

My husband (Andy) and I are frequent travelers and have stayed in Airbnb's in the U.S. and around the world.  I am a cellist and Andy is an architect. We both work from home and are available most of the time. Our goal is to make our guests' visit to Seattle special.  We love being hosts!

I moved from Chicago to Seattle in 2003 to study at Seattle University.  I met Teresa who was also a student at the University of Washington and we have been together in Seattle since.  We love to go on day hikes, explore Seattle's neighborhoods and restaurants, shop the local farmers markets, and cheer on the Seattle Sounders soccer team.  We have developed an insiders knowledge of Seattle and look forward to sharing our insights and experiences with guests.
A world traveler, tennis and volleyball player, get energized by exploring different cultures and meeting people from all over the world.

We love the Chester and making neat old buildings like this very livable.   Over the last 10 years, we have spent considerably time (and money!) restoring it .  And, Spinasse and Artusi, are truly some of the best restaurants in the city and they're downstairs!

You should also love the neighborhood, stroll down to OddFellows Cafe for breakfast or Molly Moons for ice cream, get lost in Elliott Bay Books, it's a very unique piece of the Pacific NW!

I am from Seattle, USA.   I am a retired language school owner for K-8 students and a Spanish immersion preschool - La Casita Feliz.  I love to spend time with my family, travel, and learn languages!  I speak Spanish, some French.  I have been practicing Tai Chi since 1988 and like yoga.  My husband is a civil rights attorney in Seattle.  Our cat, Richie, roams the garden and loves to be pet!

I am a Real Estate Broker/Realtor w/RE/MAX Northwest since 2002.
Specializing in residential real estate, working with sellers and buyers. 
I love what I do for a living.
Meeting new people and building relationships  is a joy to me. Hosting Airbnb is a lot of fun!
When not hanging with family, especially my two new grand babies, I am traveling to warm sunny beaches.

"Change is good, travel is a fabulous change from our daily lives. We learn we grow we experience we meet others, we change".

We are long-time Seattle residents, both migrated here from the mid-west and eastern United States. We love the Seattle market, the water taxi, and living within sight of Puget Sound and the Olympic Mountains.

Hi there! Thank you for checking out my page and I hope you book my place so I can make you feel at home while visiting Seattle! 

How I Host: I try go completely unnoticed during your stay, after all why would you want to be bothered while on vacation! You will hear from me before you check-in, once during your stay and that's it. I'm always available if you ever have any questions or issues before or during your stay. All my contact info is made available to guests. I've done my best to provide absolutley everything you could possibly think of needing on a trip. I typically never hear from guests during their stays, (which is a good thing!). 


About me: I'm an outgoing person, love the outdoors, hiking etc. I enjoy learning new skills, reading and I love competing.  I consider myself friendly, easy-going and I like meeting new people. Currently I work as a Real Estate Agent for Keller Williams and am taking classes to learn more about Data Science, which I am interested in as well! If you have any needs or questions pertaining to real estate or Short-Term Vacation rentals I'm your guy! Contact me anytime 


Rory is an avid fan of the outdoors, and you will often find him exploring beautiful, Pacific Northwest hikes with his girlfriend and his dog. As a former collegiate athlete, Rory is extremely competitive and enjoys playing sports competing in CrossFit, running and biking in long distance races. Seattle has been home to Rory since 2006, and he would be honored to be your go-to resource for information about Puget Sound neighborhoods, Seattle rental investments, and all things real estate.

Where I have Traveled: I've been to Canada, Europe (all over Spain mostly) Africa, Argentina, Australia, The Philippines, Aruba, Jamaica, and most everywhere in the U.S.  The Philippines (Palawan Island was my favorite) and Australia were my favorite!

My Life Motto (right now): Nothing worth having in life comes easy.
I have been hosting international home stay students since 1997. My sons and I speak Japanese.

My family and I moved to this little piece of heaven by the sea nearly 3 years ago. We are still close enough to the city to be downtown in 15-20 minutes and in the hopping, uber hip neighborhood of Ballard in 5. But our home in North Beach has given us the opportunity to experience Seattle in a whole new way. 

My partner is in technology and I teach fitness classes at a nearby athletic club. Our two boys are the love of our lives and we have a little maltese dog named Siobhan. As a family, we love exploring our beach at low tide, going for bike rides, camping in the PNW and travel. Occasionally we will take the resort route but for the most part we prefer to stay in other people's homes for a home away from home experience. We've done home swaps with other families as well.

We often travel to Southeast Asia and love Mexico and other tropical destinations. The PNW is a unique travel destination. To spend time in a progressive, cultured city and still be able to experience such lush and beautiful outdoor recreation is a rare find. We love introducing people to Seattle and the surrounding areas and helping them to experience a little piece of our world.

Hi! I love to travel, cook, garden,  and paint. I've traveled to 40 countries and counting and cooking all cuisines from Vietnamese food to Italian food from fresh ingredients in my garden for my husband and hungry toddler. In the room, there are a couple of my artwork pieces for you to enjoy! I speak fluent Vietnamese, some Spanish, and of course English. I'd love to get to know you and share my best eats in Seattle and all the great places to see! Oh yes, I'm a foodie, too!

I've been an Airbnb host for 7 years. For the last 2 years I lived in Thailand with my wife and our 2 daughters. We loved exploring new places, eating new and exotic foods, and checking locations off the "bucket list" as we traveled the world. 

As for many, the pandemic put a halt to our international plans. We now find ourselves back in Seattle and we're happy to be home. We both work and teach in the neighborhood where we live, and our children attend the neighborhood school. We look forward to continuing our international explorations when the time is right, but for now, we're excited to be in the PNW!

I was born in Seattle and spend much of my time enjoying Puget Sound from my sailboat or kayak. When not on the water, I love to hike and ski in the mountains, play my guitar and work with clay on my potters wheel. I have three great kids, 4 grand kids and a wonderful partner. Life's good!

Kathleen and I both live in Seattle, Washington. I own an aerospace engineering company, and Kathleen is a dentist and owns and operates her own dental practice. We love to travel. Any chance to escape the rainy winters in Seattle, we take. We love summer in Seattle though, and it's the only time we refuse to leave!

We look forward to hosting you! I'm a mom, a musician and a curious consumer of life. I lead the Columbia City Community Chorus (now on Zoom til easier times return), compose, teach, and play in a band called The Go Janes. I love to hike, ski and travel, especially off the beaten path. I've been to some pretty remarkable places (Bolivia, Syria, India) but truthfully my favorite place to explore is the Pacific Northwest. I grew up here, and there's still so much more to see! As a host, I love meeting people and creating a sense of welcome. Airbnb is such a great, affordable way to connect with people and have a unique and authentic travel experience.

I love to travel domestic and international and am open to new experiences all the time.  Cooking, theatre and Seahawks are my passion along with walking my two beautiful black labs.
I cannot live without my friends, music, coffee, red wine, chocolate and exercise.  My favorite destination is Greece but adore all the Mediterranean countries.  I want your visit to be perfect and am available as a resource to ensure a fantastic experience.  My life motto is to stay positive as when life is great it does not last nor when it is bad, it too will improve.  Always find the blessing in everything and be grateful.

Nick & Sharon are temporarily working in San Jose, CA and have decided to share their Seattle house while they are away.  Sharon was born in West Yorkshire England, and then moved to South Africa as a teenager.  She met Nick while they were both working in Mykonos, Greece in 1994, and were married in 1998.  Our home therefore has a wide mix of influences and styles.  We hope you enjoy our eclectic style!

My husband Louis and I are lucky enough to be native to beautiful Seattle, however we love to travel! We have been to over 80 countries and as a result have friends all over the world. We enjoy 'less traveled' places and nature primarily but also enjoy the activities of more urban settings. We also love cooking, entertaining and meeting new people, this is why we feel that offering Airbnb services is perfect for us. Our goal is to make enough from offering Airbnb service to fund our travels well into the future!

I love traveling, especially international, and we enjoy opening our home to other travelers.  When traveling and when hosting, my husband (Narayan) and I appreciate privacy and independence.  We are comfortable almost anywhere and with most people.  As guests, we prefer to be independent, have a good mattress and quiet house/central location, with good access to highways and/or public transportation.  We are both very active former educators (Narayan in elementary school, me in college).  We believe in and value education and learning.

I am an artist, designer, marketer, and socialprenuer. When our family travels we love to connect with locals and immerse ourselves in the culture. We love to host guests and share our beautiful city with visitors. Our house is made for kids with a trampoline and playhouse, we value family time and have a great room with reading corners so we can be together even in quiet times. Two quiet bedrooms upstairs and one bedroom downstairs makes the perfect layout for kids.

I grew up in Seattle and call Oahu as my second home. I am a nurse daytime by profession whereas my partner in crime (husband), Quyen is available to fill in the gaps whenever I am not available. We are just a phone call away so if there is anything you need to make your stay more enjoyable, we are happy to make it possible!
I'm a Superhost and have been happily listing my loft since 2015.

Sculptor/Software developer,  scuba diver. Gay! I've lived in Seattle for 20 + years and love all the outdoor opportunities available in this region.  I love to tinker and make things and I enjoy dabbling in all kinds of art. )'(

vegetarian, animal lover, environmentalist, 
love art, sailing, windsurfing, traveling
I don't text, so please email or call to communicate!!

I've lived in Seattle for nearly 30 years and spent the other half of my life in the Midwest.  I work full time for a landscape architecture firm. For fun I like to cycle and enjoy skiing, backpacking and camping with friends.  Rocky, my dog, is often along for the adventure. One of my all time favorite things to do is travel. I recently explored Paris and Barcelona with my family and before that I bike toured Southern Italy staying at beautiful Airbnb homes and apartments along the way.

I moved back to my house and home in Seattle in late spring of 2015 after three years in the Bay area of California.  I've enjoyed (and still am) getting my yard back in shape and settling back into my wonderful home.  I fixed up my guest suite, so I decided it would be fun to be an Airbnb host.  I listed for a spring / summer season and it was great meeting new people and telling them about Seattle.  After taking a break from hosting so a friend could live with me temporarily, I am ready to open my home to visitors once again.  One of my cats, Pollock, has been especially excited about all the extra attention and is becoming quite the host himself!

I'm a longtime huge music fan and spend a lot of time (and money!) on shows and try to keep up with my 20 year old self.  I enjoy traveling, film, art, gardening, entertaining and drooling over / collecting mid-century modern anything!

My home was built in 1949 and I like to maintain some of that era throughout it.  I have eclectic taste and am constantly evoking and changing my space.  I try to imagine a room where I would comfortable in while staying with a stranger and attempt to create a peaceful, welcoming, private suite for my guests.  Small touches like open windows for fresh air, filtered cool water, fresh flowers and live plants, and things to read, look at and contemplate all add to the feeling and ambiance of the space.

We are eager to welcome you to our cottage and enjoy the benefits of meeting new people from near and far.  We are Washington natives and college sweethearts, who have lived and traveled internationally--pushing 40 countries! Now, we reside in Seattle, working to better our world through an international child-focused relief organization, and engineering for improved energy efficiency of our natural resources.  Our four children were both born to us and adopted from Ethiopia--they are a tremendous privilege to parent!   We hope you will join us soon for an overnight stay or longer!

We live in Seattle because it fits our personalities in so many ways. We love to be close to nature but also enjoy being in a city with great food and events. I am an art therapist and my husband is an architect. Our son likes playing with trains, making forts with the couch, and reading books.  

As a family we love getting outside for a day or weekend of rock climbing and camping, and biking around the city as a family is something that we do regularly.

Seattle native, I absolutely cherish Summers on the water :) I have an Environmental studies degree from University of Washington, and nerd out on energy efficiency. My love of LED lighting is well known in my circle of influence ;) 
I grew up in hospitality, so naturally creating this AirBnB was a slam dunk. I truly enjoy greeting new guests, and doing my best to anticipate their needs!

Originally from Tennessee, I've lived in lots of different places (New York, Washington DC, New England, Brazil, Thailand) and have now been in Seattle for about ten years. I love exploring new places, enjoying the outdoors, cooking, and creating.

As a host, I believe in hospitality and making your stay as comfortable as possible. 

As a guest, I'm quiet, clean, and will treat your home as if it were my own.

I am a Seattlite and a global citizen, I love writing, reading and enjoying friends and family, art and music of all kinds. For my husband Alfredo and I travel, trying new foods,  languages and meeting new people whether coming from across the state or across the world are among our favorite pastimes .  We speak Spanish and English well and some Japanese, some Italian and some German. Social justice, inclusion, progressive spirituality and approaching life with a spirit of curiosity and fun are the basis of our core values.

I am a visual designer, filmmaker and photographer who loves art, music, ultra running and my wife and kids. I thrive on making new things and making some noise. Life is short, let's keep it interesting.

Lisa works in green building, and Steve is an environmental scientist.  We live with our our dog Archie and our cat Oscar, as well as our two teenage daughters when they are home from college.  We love biking, hiking, swimming, and kayaking, all things we can do close to home.  We have traveled extensively with our family, and recently took 8 months off to travel around the world (staying in Airbnb's or course).  Favorite recent destinations:  Sri Lanka, Jordan, Netherlands, Nepal.

Hello, I grew up in the south of England, and moved to the States in 1993, settling in Seattle in 1998. I own a local dog daycare business and have three adult children who run their own lives now :-)

In November 2021, following the pandemic, I find myself in the very fortunate situation of my business running itself under the dedicated eye of a stellar team of dog 'rufferees', so with minimal input from me I now get to do my thing, which is to travel!

When I am home in Seattle I enjoy time in my home and garden, the local small music venue scene, morning swims in Lake Washington, hiking/camping in the mountains, or chilling in one of Seattle's many speakeasies. I am also very adept at bingeing a great tv drama! I have done a lot of traveling in my time from Europe to Brunei, and here I go again!

Hello! My name is Sara and my husband, Jonathan and I live in Seattle with our four children-ages 9, 8, 6 and 2! We are a very laid back family, and enjoy hospitality! We want to share our personal (lived in!) home and love the Seattle area-come visit!

I (Angela) am a New York City native and pleasantly surprised to find myself in love with Seattle. Currently, you will find me in sweats with 3 young girls in tow trying to navigate life as a mom and as a part-time mental health therapist in private practice.

My husband, Herman, is a native Seattleite and is loving his job as a dad and a philanthropy director at a local nonprofit nursing home.

In our past lives, we used to be super cool and traveled around the world. We even lived in Shanghai for the majority of our 20's and early part of our 30's. We both have enjoyed visiting Thailand, Vietnam, New Zealand, Australia, England, Italy, Spain, France, Korea, Belgium, Switzerland, Holland, Croatia, Mexico, Canada, Mongolia, Jamaica, Singapore, Taiwan, and of course, China.

We love being global citizens and value meeting people from all different walks of life. It would bring us much joy to host you and to meet you!

I’ve lived in Seattle for over 20 years—so I’ve seen the city change a lot.   I’m a big fan of the great local food scene and getting outdoors to the nearby mountains and rivers.  In the winter I like to snowboard and in the summer I do a lot of backpacking and camping.  You can’t beat the PNW!   

I was raised mostly in California (Bay Area) but I’ve also lived in Colorado, Nevada, Oregon, Wisconsin, DC, Virginia and New York.   I’ve traveled to over 50 countries for both work and play—so happy we get to start traveling again!    

Flash, the French Bulldog, thinks he runs the place.   Shhh, don’t tell him otherwise.    

See you soon.

Now retired and originally from England, I was a graphic designer, and am a very hands-on creative person.  Art has been a passion of mine since I was a child, and my art studio is above the rental space but completely separate. I enjoy meeting people and want my visitors to love my backyard cottage as much as I do. It's a magic house! I enjoy listening to jazz and classical music and play piano.  I love travelling and visit my family in England and Norway as often as possible. Gardening is a favorite pastime and I work hard to make the backyard a colorful oasis not only for myself but also for my visitors.   Spending time with my grandchildren is a great joy and my animals are much treasured companions.
Retirement is a great time of life!
Love Dogs & Nature - as super hosts we offer clean, fun and unique places to stay. We seek only professional and friendly people. Thank you!

I currently live in Bend, Oregon and spend my time mountain biking, climbing, skiing, ultramarathon running, and oh yeah.... working too!  I am a therapist and performance consultant focusing my energy on helping people tap into their PEAK potential (Website hidden by Airbnb) 

I was born and raised in Seattle.  My family has deep roots in West Seattle, particularly. We are glad to rent our craftsman apartments to Seattle bound travelers as well as our cute river getaway cabin in the cascade mountains.

Seattle native - love to ski, hike, golf, garden and travel.

It is my goal that you have a very comfortable stay. My guests enjoy a quiet and private experience.  Yet I can be reached to offer assistance.
Traveling is my passion. I love both adventure and city travel. I travel as often as I can and love to make friends and meet new people. I like seeing new places and learning about cultures!

Hey! I’m Ruby!

I enjoy scuba diving, snorkeling, snowboarding, dining out, wine tasting, and traveling. 

I look forward to welcoming you to one of my properties! If you have any questions about a listing, the home, neighborhood, or anything else, please don't hesitate to reach out!

Lauren and I love discovering the nuances of a genuine 'locals' experience. Whether we're hosting or on our own adventure, we relish taking in or passing along a hot tip about a truly enjoyable experience.
Hi, I'm Perry. I’m fun, laid back, easy going guy. I absolutely love hosting and also traveling. The world is our oyster, so explore it!

I live in Seattle, WA and I LOVE this beautiful city; I’m excited to share it with you -- Don't believe whatever you've heard about the rain. ;)

I enjoy snowboarding in the winter, mountain biking in the summer, playing strategy board games year-round, and travelling whenever I can.

Hope to see you soon at my place or yours.

My wife and I are both tech entrepreneurs.

We love to host and to stay as guests within the Airbnb community. 
We treat our guests like our friends, and we gain so many friendships around the world. 

We have 3 amazing places with over 300 five starts reviews. Please make sure to read at least a few, we take great pride in them. 

We love Airbnb!

We enjoy sharing our space in the city.  Life-long Northwesterners, we enjoy many of the outdoor activities offered in this part of the world, skiing, hiking, camping, kayaking, sailing.  Andy is a retired plumbing contractor, more recently working as a sailing instructor.  Betty is a nurse and  just retired from  Swedish Cancer Institute.  We have two children and three grandchildren who all live in the area, and a handsome friendly tabby cat named Buchi.  We look forward to more travel in the coming years, some of it in our 1987 Westie.
I recently retired from teaching at the University of Washington. The apartment is located under my house, looking out on my garden, which is beautiful most of the year!

I have been living in Seattle for the past 10 years. I used to be a flight attendant for Northwest Airlines, hence interacting and being nice to people is almost a first nature for me :).


I enjoy traveling and meeting new people. Being a host on AirBNB is another medium for me to meet new and interesting people from all over the world.

Eric & Amy have lived on Capitol Hill for 35 years and have watched Seattle grow through some big changes.  We love to travel and entertain and are thrilled to have visitors in our guest house.  Both of our boomerang sons spent time in the carriage house while easing into independence after college.  We have since been able to make significant improvements to the bungalow while retaining some of its carriage house character for our visitors.  Eric is generally around the house when he is not off skiing or fishing and can be as available as you wish.   Let us know what you need and we will do what we can for you.

We are from Seattle, I (Lisa) teach communication skills to volunteer ministers and do retreat work, Karl is a retired engineer, now starting his second career. Often we travel with our two adult daughters, Sarah and Theresa. We enjoy meeting people from all around the world. We try to be low-impact guests, and engaging hosts!
Love to travel and be at home. Love adventuring in Seattle and the Pacific Northwest. Enjoy swimming, hiking, yoga, eating out, cooking, seeing concerts and shows, and checking out all kinds of art.

I grew up in the Seattle area and graduated from the University of Washington.  I am well versed on things to do and see during your visit.   I am connected to the Seattle community and in my spare time I have served on local non-profit boards - the Pike Place Market Foundation, which helps provide social services to the downtown Seattle community, and the Washington/Alaska American Cancer Society Board of Directors.   I will do all I can to ensure you have a great stay!
Michael and Kelley are born and raised Seattleites. We have been in or near water our entire lives. We both grew up on boats and are love having Sally S as a part of our family.

We are an Ethiopian and German couple who has lived in Seattle for over 20 years. We enjoy the outdoors, exercise and we love to travel to experience different cultures. Our backgrounds are in the computer field and Real Estate and we are intellectually curious people. We look forward to hearing from each of you and giving you the experience to see Seattle through the eyes of a local and not a tourist. We will do all that we can to make your stay an enjoyable and unforgettable one!

Ich bin Rocco der Mann von Mehrit und bin Deutscher. Ich lebe schon seit vielen Jahren in den USA bin aber dennoch oft in Deutschland. 
Aus diesem Grund kenne ich mich mit den USA im Ganzen und speziell mit dem Pazifischen Nord Westen sehr gut aus und bin gerne bereit unseren Besuchern mit Ratschlägen oder Ideen weiterzuhelfen.

Husband, father, writer, musician and book lover. 

Our family is a Seattle rarity. We were actually born and raised here! I've traveled the country many times over and believe this is the greatest place to live. We're just minutes from the urban center, and only a short drive from the beauty of Northwest nature spots. We hope you love your stay at our mother-in-law.
Full time working mom, 2 young kids and youthful husband.  Can't live with out my family, vacation time, good food and exercise.

Hi!  My name is David and I currently live in Seattle, WA with my wife, Sandy.  We are Airbnb Superhosts every year since 2016, exceeding Airbnb's Superhost standards for quality, reviews, communication, and commitment.  We love to travel to experience new cultures and meet new lifelong friends.  When traveling, we love anything outdoors - ecotourism, hiking, adventure tours - and we're learning how to backpack.  We are big foodies so feel free to ask us for our favorite spots around town (David was selected for Yelp Elite status the past 7 years).  We look forward to hosting you.

I love to golf, alpine ski, host parties and enjoy the company of good people. I'm a free spirit that enjoys life each and every day. The house we built was for entertaining, so naturally we love to surround ourselves with fun loving people. We have been hosting students, from all over the world the past many years. They come to Seattle to improve their English skills. Through this program and hosting on Airbnb, we have opened our lives to the world.

I live in beautiful Seattle, I spend lots of time in the backyard when is sunny and the weather is pleasant or fly fishing in the many rivers of the NW. I keep active playing racket ball and watching movies.
I live with my wife Esperanza and our cat Oliver.

Avid traveller and a lover of architecture and most things old.  I am a native to Seattle, some of my favorite places in Washington are the San Juan Islands and Skagit Valley.  I recently got a real estate license.  If you are house hunting and would like a guided tour of  Seattle neighborhoods let me know.

I’m originally from Alaska, and have lived in Seattle for more than 15 years. I have managed our AirBNB for years, and enjoy hosting people from all over the world. In my free time, I enjoy traveling and playing in the outdoors with family.

Gardener, musician, animal lover, tree hugger, good cook. Love to meet people from all parts of the world and hear their stories.  I have traveled a lot but now want to host travelers here in my home. Welcome to my urban farm in South Seattle!
Love to host people visiting this beautiful city. Glad to help you navigate - just ask.

My Family and I live in Seattle's Capitol Hill.  We have a 2 year old daughter, Mattie Simone. I am a full time Mom, part time student and Airbnb host and my wife is a flight attendant.  We love to travel and try to make a trip each month, not as often with the birth of our daughter but we're hoping to take her on a lot of trips this year. Our favorite vacations as of late are Stockholm , France (South or Paris), SF Bay, Hawaii, New York and we love lake front cottages.  We love international food, French bakeries, film, music, beach front lounging, urban nightlife, authentic shops and good coffee.

We are a family of four who has recently returned to Seattle after five years living abroad in the Middle East and Europe. We love to explore the outdoors by hiking and skiing, backpacking and cycling. We are especially fond of Austria after spending four Christmases there.

A Seven Continent Marathon runner and as an avid traveler, I love to try and explore the world as much as possible. I love being outdoors and enjoy making new friends and learning about new cultures.

When I travel, I like to stay with hosts that can help me discover the place as a local would.

I host a few times a year and like to share with my guests my beautiful lakefront property with amazing views and boats for water access and fishing. The Lakefront Oasis is on an acre of well maintained garden. If you are seeking bliss, this is the place for you and your family. Visit the famous Bonsai Gardens (5 mins away) or Shop till you drop (5 mins away) :).
 
If you want a place in downtown, I could also arrange for a stay in my downtown condo with amazing views of the Ocean (Puget Sound) and provide you with the local knowledge to walk to Pike's Place market, Eliot Bay Trail, Cruise Hip Terminal or the Space Needle.

Salut, ich bin Katha und lebe und arbeite in Seattle. Ich habe Wirtschaftspsychologie studiert und arbeite als Analyst. Ich bin ein großer Weinenthusiast und liebe die Verbindung aus gutem Essen mit tollen Weine bevorzugt auf Reisen.
 Zusammen mit meinem Mann bin ich fast jeden Monat unterwegs die Welt zu entdecken. :-)
Wenn du auch am Thema Wein, Bier oder Spirituosen interessiert bist, lass es mich wissen und wir können über einen Entdeckungsausflug in und um Seattle reden.

I was born and raised in Seattle and have had the good fortune to travel and I always seem to come back to this beautiful place. I believe you will love it too and I will do my best to make sure you have a beautiful home away from home to enjoy your vacation.
Thank you for your interest. Enjoy the view.

I'm a 30 year old female, married to my husband, Ryan. We both love Seattle and especially our neighborhood, Columbia City. We enjoy travel, hiking, camping, skiing in the winter, good wine with cheese, and excellent food. Come visit and see how beautiful Seattle truly is!
sales rep for hat and scarf line. self employed.

Rowing coach, jewelry artist project manager/business analyst, and now, hostess! I love providing a secluded, clean, pretty, funky Seattle space for people who are visiting the Pacific Northwest. I've lived here for 20 years and love to share this beautiful place.  

I love Seattle; it has two mountain ranges, many lakes, the ocean, rugged hiking, beautiful sunrises and sunsets, great culture, amazing food, and you can row year round. Perfect for me. 

My hosting style is hands off; you're here to play and enjoy the scene. I'm rarely home anyway (usually out on the water) but I love to be available to help with anything! Just message me on Airbnb.

Welcome! I'm a born and raised Seattleite. I love everything the city has to offer from it's culture and fab restaurants to hiking, boating, skiing and of course coffee! Some of my favorite things are traveling and meeting new people. What better way than to invite other travelers into my own home where they can have fun in the city and at the same time stay in a "Home Away From Home." I also love going to my vacation home in Sedona, AZ for much needed Zen time and the beauty of the Red Rocks.

I am both a guest and a host on AirBnB and love meeting new people and crafting enjoyable experiences.

During the day, I am a marketing consultant working near Seattle. I used to travel regularly for work and love traveling for fun.
Avid cyclist and walker/hiker sometimes runner.  Love to garden and read. Country person for half of my life enjoying the city living lifestyle.
I'm an experience AirBnB manager who loves to travel.

My husband Nicholas and I have lived in the bustling Phinney Ridge neighborhood of Seattle for 18 years and love it!  I'm a Seattle native and he's from Atlanta Georgia, where we recently purchased a historic home in the Ansley Park neighborhood of Midtown.  We split our time between homes and enjoy the best of both coasts.  We work hard, love to travel and hope that our Airbnb spaces will offer guests a wonderful home away from home and perfect place to experience the city.

I love Seattle and would be happy to meet you! I moved here from rural Wisconsin when I was 18, and never left. For the last three decades I have been creating custom art glass for high end architectural projects. You’ll see some of it in evidence here. My studio is on the main floor. Husband Ben and I are in this together but you’re more likely to see me ~ I’m the on-site extrovert.

I have a long-standing fondness for etymology and entomology. I have a larger than average collection of beetles and seed pods. Partner dancing and country duets light me up!

I love exploring outdoors including nearby Ravenna Park; a symphony of sounds and rich aromas.

My husband and I are lifelong residents of Seattle, and I grew up in the Laurelhurst neighborhood.  I hope you enjoy this great city and our lovely neighborhood.  We have a very central location to all you want to do and see in our fantastic city!
We have lived in this home since 1984, and have loved creating our little oasis.  I am happy to share restaurant and sightseeing tips; or you can discover Seattle on your own!

Joel is an attorney and avid skier who also enjoys backpacking, mountaineering, triathlons, golfing, and all things Seattle sports.  Sarah is an attorney and community leader. Sarah enjoys dancing ballet, running, and cooking. We both love the outdoors, traveling, hiking, the arts, great food, politics, entertaining, meeting new people, and of course playing with our toddler daughter.

I am a retired mom traveling between Taiwan and US. Life keeps me pretty busy most of the time but the time I appreciate the most is playing a round a golf with my husband and sons. Since I am traveling a lot I usually rely on my son to help me manage airbnb. I hope you enjoy our place and please let me know if there is anything we can improve.

We are long time residents of West Seattle, where we truly enjoy Alki and Admiral area, as well as weekend trips to the Olympic Peninsula. We are currently hosting a few places in Seattle,  one right on amazing Alki beach and another one in North Admiral area, yet only minutes from downtown Seattle.  
In addition, we are hosting a few small boat house/cabins (naust) in Northern Norway; in beautiful & majestic Vesterålen islands, where you can experience midnight sun during summer months and northern lights during winter months, with beautiful white sandy beaches, steep mountains and fjords. 

We are active members of the local community, with great interests in design, architecture, construction, travel, languages, great espresso, local wines and not at least our children and Bernese Mountain dog.  We travel extensively throughout the world, and we have often enjoined Airbnb/similar ourselves.

I am a Seattle Firefighter and my wife is a make up artist/account manager.  We split our time between Seattle, Bend, OR and Honolulu and try to travel as much as we can.  We are very laid back and outdoorsy folks who enjoy a nice beer in the sun after a hard day of play.

I'm a professional musician and the founder of a Seattle-based non profit organization called First Aid Arts. Our team trains organizations all over the world in how to use creative expression as a tool for recovery from traumatic experiences like human trafficking, war and natural disaster. (Learn more about our work with an internet search of First Aid Arts!)
Having lived in Hawaii, the San Juan Islands, Bellingham and Seattle, I love sailing, surfing, skateboarding, traveling with purpose, and spending time with my wife and two kids. While studying abroad I had the opportunity to be hosted by local families in various parts of Central America and Europe. Our family enjoys being able to extend the same kind of hospitality through Airbnb. We look forward to meeting you!

Maggie and I have been married for 39 years and both have lived in the Seattle area our entire lives. 
 I am semi retired Maggie is a real estate agent. I am an avid golfer and we both love to travel and spend time with our children and friends.

I'm a mindfulness and yoga practitioner with an LMFT private practice established as a small business 10 years ago. Integrated Healing has a small studio and Airbnb room on sidewalk level of our home as well as an urban cottage with its own bathroom and entrance located on our property. We are in an ideal Seattle neighborhood that is a nice blend of quiet, artsy and metropolitan feel within a 5-10 minute walk.  Two teen sons as well as my mom and our pets ( small dog and outdoor kitty) complete our family on site. We are Spanish bilingual & I grew up with a very diverse, alternative background (originally from the mission in SF and spent time in rural northern California) before moving to Seattle 12 years ago. I'm easy going , friendly and enjoy people which is why I'm a super host on air b n b. I'm happy to have discovered this cool business idea and love the building community aspect of it. Coffee, wine, art,  good food, reading, music Mackelmore, Billy Holiday & Michael Franti are a few favorite artists . I love being active (especially urban and rural walking , dancing) and anything that has to do with learning how we can be our best selves (psychology, spirituality, health, relationships, community building, entrepreneurship etc.) bring joy and vibrancy to my life.  My mottos are varied…make the most of every moment, be actively engaged in life while remembering we are human BEing's not human Doings and make a difference in the world even if your contribution is as simple as being kind to yourSelf, others and precious nature.

I'm a Seattle native and, yes, I love this city to bits. I read a ton, and wish I could finish more novels than I do. I enjoy live music, theater and ballet. And I'm a fan of modern board games. I'm more a city guy than an outdoors dude.

Hi, and welcome to our home. 

We have a teenaged son, a cat, a dog, and eclectic tastes in art and music. We're longtime Seattle residents, but we first met in high school in a very different time and place. Our connections to the Beacon Hill neighborhood go back to 1992 when we first lived nearby, and we've owned a home on the hill since just before the beginning of the century. 

Brook works at the intersection of media, communication, and technology and Cat is in the health care industry. Both of us have worked in the non-profit sector, and we believe in helping make strong communities.

We love good food, road trips to remote places where the cell phones don't work, and making each other laugh. 

Our goal as hosts is to give you a space you can feel is yours, while making sure you have what you need to enjoy your visit to Seattle. We'd love to meet you and tell you what we love about this neighborhood, as well as the city we call home.

I'm a Seattle native who returned from many years on the East Coast to settle in Ballard near my friends and family. I love to make people feel at home and enjoy the hosting experience. 

As a frequent traveler for my work I made notes about what hosts did well or not. I hated bad beds, cheap linens, and poorly stocked kitchens. My space is a reflection of comfort and attention to detail.

My husband and I have lived in Wallingford for nearly 20 years.  We can't imagine a better location to raise our kids. Our home has proven to be a fantastic location for schools, community, outdoor activity and city living. We have easy access to the parks, bike trails, downtown, events, and of course fantastic restaurants.  Our family loves to travel. Our most recent adventure was to Japan with our middle daughter's 5th grade class. Closer to home, we enjoy heading to Whistler and Vancouver, Canada.

I left my full-time career to become the CEO of the household and a volunteer crisis counselor. I spend my days trying to keep up with our three busy daughters and being available to others that are experiencing difficulties.  I love our home, this community and I am proud to be from the NW.  We will respect the privacy our guests, however I am always happy to provide recommendations on places to go or places not to be missed.

My favorite things are family, spirituality, natural healthy living, yoga, movies and meeting new people and experiencing new things.

I come from a large family, and I have a large family.  I love them all!  I am a sister to three brothers and two sisters.  I have five children along with their five spouses, who have blessed me with nine grand children.  I guess that means that I identify primarily as a mother and a grandmother.  

I love to learn about and put into practice natural and healthy food and dietary choices, sustainable living choices, natural healing methods, etc.  

I also love to watch movies, but not so much the big box movies as the smaller independent and foreign films.  I have quite a collection of them.

I attend yoga classes two or three times a week and find it a very rewarding system of exercise for my body.

I'm married to a wonderful man, Kirk Jolley.  We have been together for about 20 years.  He is a very talented builder and contractor.  He delights in making older homes beautiful again and he is very good at what he does.  

We often travel to Hawaii, since one son lives there with his family.  We also like to go to Mexico and Canada.  I like staying in homes, apartments or condos because I like having my own kitchen or kitchenette.  An unfortunate natural gas exposure has left me with extreme sensitivity to petroleum products, and consequently many scented products and foods.  This requires me to ask about heating and cooking fuels in homes, as well as cleaning products or strongly scented products used therein.

My father was a Scout Master and took us camping a lot.  He taught us to always leave a place cleaner than we found it.  I still do that!  My husband often tells me that I am doing the maids job when I clean up a place before I leave it, but I can't help it...it is ingrained in me.  My kids thought I was a bit of a neat freak, but I've noticed that they learned well, and they all know how to clean and they keep their homes tidy...even the boys.  Needless to say, I would take good care of anyone's place that I stayed in.
I am a native to the northwest and have lived in Fremont for 26 years. I am an industrial designer by day, craftsman, maker, baker by night, and father of two teenage boys 24/7.

I’m a freelance writer married to a very sweet and funny Australian man named Dave, and we have two great little boys who love dragons above all things. My mom, Aino, lives in the house with us, too. She’s from Finland *and* she used to teach Spanish, so Finnish speakers, Spanish Speakers, and people who battle crocodiles and speak the strange language of Down Under will all find people here who understand them. (The house is divided on whether it’s pronounced ba-NA-na or ba-NAH-na, but however *you* pronounce it, you can relax in the knowledge that somebody here agrees with you.)

I love reading, books, bookstores, more reading, movies, reading books, reality TV to unwind from all that reading, and a nice cup of something warm to sip while I read books. Dave loves surfing, poetry, poker, visual art and meditation. I also love meditation. The boys love dragons. Aino loves Dancing With The Stars.

We have lived in Seattle for over 20 years, 13 of which have been in the Greenlake neighborhood. I made my way up here from Portland, Oregon and my husband is from New York. We met in Seattle through a mutual friend and have never felt like leaving this gorgeous city. I am a hip hop dance instructor/dance studio owner and my husband spends his days as an architect. We love to entertain, eat good food, drink red wine, be active around the lake or in the mountains and to share our home.
I am a world traveler that loves to come home. I like big cities, long beaches and tiny houses. I love my hometowns (Seattle and Neskowin) and my dream job as a Real Estate Broker and Airbnb host.

We are a family of 4. Matt is a cartographer and Amy is a family nurse practitioner.  We have two boys; Liam age 16 and Lochlan age 13. Our hobbies include: hiking, sailing, biking, reading, music and traveling. We lived in Belize for one year followed by a month long backpack trip through Central America.
I'm an avid traveler who has stayed in Airbnbs all over the world so I know what guests are looking for. I strive to provide my guests with the very best experience possible.
We love the Northwest.

We're Christa and Brian, a young active couple with two friendly cats (Hank and Steve). You'll find that we're friendly, socially conscious, and easy-going. We like to enjoy the outdoors as well as a drink on the deck or watching sports/movies. We're big fans of the Seahawks  and Mariners as well as our alma maters, Gonzaga and UW. Feel free to pull up a seat and join us if we're watching a game during your stay!

We love to meet new people and help them have great experiences in our wonderful city, although we are happy to interact with our guests as much or as little as they desire. Our work schedules are pretty flexible which allows us to help our guests get settled and provide local travel advice. We look forward to welcoming you into our home!
Living in gorgeous Seattle, working for an e-commerce empire. Love food, travel and good times.

I love Seattle and I love my house. It's been a great place for many folks headed to Seattle for any number of reasons. Happy to share it with you!   

I'm a big fan of mother nature, our fresh air, water and mountains.  Traveling, meeting new people, cooking and being with friends and family on excursions as simple as a neighborhood walk to a serious adventure are what make me smile.  

If you choose to stay in my apartment, I wish you restful nights and a smooth journey.

We are music and art teachers. When we are not working we enjoy taking long walks along Lake Washington, hiking and traveling. We also like quiet evenings at home and love our neighborhood. Our cat Teddy is our property manager, he lives with us upstairs but is very friendly and welcomes everyone.

I have lived in Seattle now for over 30 years and love this part of the US with the mountains and the water!  In 2013  I had just returned from living in Pretoria, South Africa for 5 months where I was introduced to AirBnB there and loved it!  I LOVE to travel and explore and I am looking forward to seeing even more of this amazing world and trying out more Airbnb properties!

I've lived in the NW for almost 20 years.  Transplant from Chicago.  I love to travel.  I've worked for the owners of the building for almost as long as I've lived in Seattle.  They take great pride in making Hampton Court one of the most well kept and livable historic buildings in the city.  As a bar owner, I've made a point to frequent all the new bars and restaurants in Capitol Hill, and I'm happy to share recommendations.

I am a young mid 60's woman who enjoys travel and meeting new people. I enjoy hiking, new foods, gardening and love museums of all sorts. I have stayed with Airbnb hosts when traveling Argentina and Canada.   I am trustworthy and responsible.
Hairstylist, mother, nature lover, food lover, adventure seeker, photographer, organizer & planner!

I am a physicist and a Calvinist.  I like to cook and go hiking. I believe I cook pretty well for my children and my wife like the food I cook.  I also like to think and solve math problems that is probably why I got a doctorate from an Ivy League University in Physics.  I do not talk much but am very easy going. I keep updating to make sure they are safe, comfortable and updated.  My wife is probably the person who meets you most of time.  She has many positive reviews on airbnb and she is outgoing and detail oriented -- she pays more attention on cleanliness and weather you are comfortable or not. She wants me to take care of this property so this is my new experience on airbnb but she still does the final inspection to make sure the units are clean and satisfactory. I believe you will like it just like other satisfying guests.

I am a Seattle area native, I like to garden, travel, listen to music, and do almost anything active outdoors (skiing is my passion). I enjoy good food (dark chocolate!), foreign films, meeting new people and experiencing new places and adventures. I love sharing with travelers my favorite Seattle and Pacific Northwest experiences and outings. I'm very easy going, positive and accepting of all lifestyles. I try to provide a space that is inviting, comfortable and clean.

easy going social and I  enjoy family friends travel wine and festivals of all sorts! Like the idea of meeting others through travel to their homes and giving others a fun safe and inviting place to stay on their travel to Seattle!

Hey!  I'm Irvin and I'm giving this a shot as a host.  I've done my fair share of traveling and have had hosts put up so I think it will be fun to return the favor.  I absolutely love Seattle and West Seattle where I live!  I love to out and run in the park here and love jazz and even throw some records on my record player.  You can't live in the Northwest without some Salmon.  Come see all that Seattle has to offer!

As an avid world and domestic traveler I am THRILLED to be part of the Airbnb network! As a marine biologist I am always looking for excuses to escape to the sea. A native of the Evergreen State I am IN LOVE with Washington. Mountains, trees, islands and ocean? What more do you need!? I have lived in Mexico, Chile, the Dominican Republic and briefly, in China. I'm fluent in Spanish, love to read, hike to the tippy top of mountains and make metal (mainly copper and silver) into jewelry. I am a scientist and love to think and learn about how the world really works. I love to travel light, but stay somewhere the feels nice, comfortable and homey...a touch of eco-chic is always welcome. As an Airbnb host I'm hoping to create the same kind of space and experience that I appreciate when I'm traveling. I love sharing my favorite things about Seattle and providing the "insider" scoop - touristy stuff is always fun, but off the beaten path is where the best travel experiences are found!

Melissa is a seasoned local hospitality professional,  and owner of Madeson Management LLC,  a vacation rental and real estate firm. Her team of dedicated hospitality professionals diligently manage a curated assortment of local properties for short and long-term stays!  We look forward to lending our local experience to your visit, and providing you with an exceptional Seattle experience!

Melissa is a licensed broker in the state of Washington.

I grew up in West Seattle and raised my sons here too! It's a great community of creative and professional people. My cottage in located in one of the most desirable neighborhoods that offers great restaurants and so much more. I love Seattle! And you will love staying at the cottage!

Hi, I'm Eddie.  I just started hosting one of my rental units on Airbnb in May 2016 and it's been a great experience so far.  I love to travel and have been all over Asia, and to several countries in Europe, Latin America, and the Caribbean.  I love using vacation rentals during my travels and have had some fantastic experiences with them so I decided to start my own.  I'm originally from the Tri-Cities in Eastern Washington, the middle of wine country, and love wine tasting when I'm there and on this side of the mountains in Woodinville when I'm home in Seattle.  I'm happy to help my guests with any recommendations or questions and please feel free to ask if you need anything to improve your stay.

Hello fellow travelers!
 
Welcome to Seattle! We’ve always loved the idea of airbnb because who wouldn’t prefer to stay with the locals. We are a semi-retired couple who enjoy getting outdoors for long walks, a trip up to the San Juans, reading and  walking our dog . We hope to cultivate positive experiences in the Pacific Northwest for travelers. We look forward to meeting you and making sure your stay is a smooth and pleasant one. Mostly, we just hope you enjoy yourselves. Seattle is a great city to explore.
Technology professional
Avid traveler. Mother of two. Nonprofit professional. Organized. Fun loving. Volunteer. Can't live without: family, friends and tea w/milk & sugar.

For over 20 years, I traveled for business and pleasure. At the end of my day of traveling, finding a bright, clean, safe, private and comfortable room with a warm (and slightly whimsical) personality was a delight. My goal is to provide that same hospitality to my guests. Most importantly, health and safety is our primary value.  Not only do we follow CDC guidelines of cleaning and disinfecting, we allow for 3 days between guest visits.  

My partner Jeff and I also have a passion for stories (films, books, and good conversations). We will be happy to tell you about the newest indie film which we just saw at Seattle International Film Festival. We are explorers of new places (restaurants, theaters, music venues, bars, beaches, and parks) and fiercely loyal to the tried and true. Again, happy to direct you to both. 

As for the books you will find in The Library, please feel free to take a book and/or leave a book. 

In our spare time, we also run an upcycling business - Barrett Street Upcyclers. I take gently worn men's button down shirts and make them into pillows, tote bags and wine sleeves. Jeff takes broken computers and makes jewelry, clocks and house numbers. Mining the Abandoned and Broken to Discover Beauty is our purpose. 

Yours in Hospitality, 
Susan & Jeff

Hi I'm Leela. I grew up in Seattle among other places, including: the Virgin Islands, Australia and New Zealand. I love to travel and meet people of different cultures. Airbnb has been a great option for me when traveling as well as a way to keep my apartment in Pioneer Square, which I love! Let me know if you have any questions-- I enjoy the curiosity and conversation. :)

I currently work in Finance and my husband is an artist. We are pretty easy going people and very clean. We want our guests to feel comfortable so we make the place based on what we would expect if we were to stay at an Airbnb. If you have any questions, please feel free to reach out.
My husband (Dustin) and I are AirBNB hosts in Seattle. We love to explore new places (especially great less known ones), food and meeting new people.
married middle aged active professionals. often we are not onsite during your stay as we are out on our Classic Chris Craft Fandango at a boat show.

I am the owner of Seatown Suites, a short term vacation and corporate rental company. We specialize in downtown luxury apartments in view buildings with deluxe amenities. I have used airbnb and (Hidden by Airbnb) homes for travel for the last 10 years and I know what to do to make your experience memorable and satisfying. I am a long term resident of Seattle and have a love affair with the city. I enjoy travel, art and good food. I am a generous  host and excellent communicator.
I love to travel and share my experiences with others.  I'm originally from Colorado but have traveled all over the US. and Seattle is one of my favorite cities.  I look forward to hosting you!
I moved to Seattle about six years ago from the Kansas City area.  Biggest hobbies are gardening, socializing, and art.  I'm totally enjoying my AirBnB guests!
I'm a Registered Dietitian turned stay at home mom. I love good food, hiking, and the beautiful Pacific Northwest. I'm excited to welcome you to my little West Seattle retreat!

I've been part of Seattle's renowned glass culture for many years. Columbia City has been my home where we raised our kids. I've been a supportive part of the neighborhoods vibrant and diverse cultural life for over 30 years.
I'm a happy person with a positive outlook on life who loves adventures, travel and good vibes.
I am friendly and outgoing and pretty quiet

I am a happy traveler myself and I love the way travel lets us meet new people and see new places. I am also a transplanted northwesterner - moved here in 1984 from my home state of Alabama.  Seattle quickly became home as we raised my daughter here and other family members moved to follow us. My husband is retired and was a journalist. I am a non-profit manager and a social worker by training and currently lead a wonderful national organization that helps strengthen families and prevent child abuse and neglect.  I am an avid movie fan and love reading.  I'm looking forward to serving as host to many other travelers, like you!

Neil and I have both lived in Seattle for over 20 years.  Neil is originally from London, England and I grew up in New Jersey moving out here after going to college in Rhode Island.  There is so much to love about Seattle - the beauty, culture, people, even the rain.  We just spent the last 2 years designing and building our new energy efficient home and look forward to sharing it.
Polish expat living in Seattle, exploring the world one trip at a time.

I am Debra, the owner of Picture Properties Vacation Rentals.  We have 11 wonderful options at Harbor Steps for your stay in our great city of Seattle, plus a few more great vacation homes in the Puget Sound area.  We are all about making your trip the best it can possibly be.  We pride ourselves on prompt and courteous guest service.  It's our priority.  Don't hesitate to contact us with any questions.  Thanks and happy traveling!

I've been living in the Seattle area for over 20 years and I absolutely love this city!!  I enjoy traveling, running especially on Alki beach. I am fun, loving, I love spending time with my FAMILY.  Love my two boys and two dogs and so blessed to be on this beautiful beach!! My goal is to create an amazing experience for you and loved ones.

I like movies, reading, lazing on the beach or in the park.
Favorite cities are New York, Munich, Montreal.
I am a quiet guest and prefer to keep out of the way and do my own thing.
Relaxed and fun.

I am a Management Consultant working in the M&A deals space living in Seattle.  I love the outdoors and being as active as possible.  I enjoy traveling internationally (backpacking and staying in hostels) and spending time with my friends, and picking up new things. Whether I'm travelling for either work or pleasure, I always enjoy the chance to share my wonderful studio with fellow travelers.

I'm a visual artist and enjoy making things and places look aesthetically pleasing with the resources that are readily available. I enjoy recycling used items to create a new context. I enjoy traveling and hosting travelers...our communities are so global these days, traveling is the bridge that brings our online world face to face.

I'm a struggling filmmaker and single dad. I like meeting new people, making new friends and hearing people's stories. Not to worry though, nothing that you do or say will ever end up in one of my films... or will it!?

I host guests who need month-to-month furnished rentals.  My guests are professionals who work remotely while traveling or need a place for one month while looking for an apartment as well as guests who stay for school, training and internships.  Different room types include homes shared with 1-4 people as well as private rooms with separate entrances as well as entire homes (one space of a duplex unit).  Click on my profile to see available room and home listings.

I work out of my home & spend my free time walking the city streets or hiking in the mountains. I'm a native Seattlite. I love sharing space & seeing my city through the eyes of my guests. I feel lucky to be able provide a quiet reprieve from the hustle of the city.

My wife and I moved to the Ballard neighborhood two years ago and absolutely love it. We are constantly on the go, whether we are taking our daughter to local parks, going on bike rides on the Burke-Gilman, or visiting one of the many breweries, we love our location. 

We are new hosts, but as frequent AirBNB guests, we feel we know what is important to travelers.
Traveler, writer, mom. Lives in Seattle (Queen Anne). Likes good food, good books and good people.

I've traveled to many places.  Indonesia and Italy are my favorites.  I lived in Indonesia for a year-and-a-half.  The first year was as an exchange student in 1993.  I am still very close with my host family.  I've visited them in Jakarta a number of times and they have visited me in the United States.

My baby daughter and my girlfriend are the most important people in my life.  My daughter makes me laugh all the time.  Being a dad is one of the greatest gifts.

I don't read books often.  Law school sadly took away my love of reading books.  I think this is true of many lawyers.  Now I am a real estate broker and, hopefully, as a recovering lawyer I will read more frequently.

My yard was a big project.  I took a landscape class as continuing education.  I hired my instructor, who helped me prepare a planting plan and hardscape plan.  I hired a landscaping company to plant and build the plans.  It took 2 summers to complete.  I hope you like the yard -- it was a labor of love!

I was born and raised in Seattle. In fact, I grew up in Madrona and Madison Park. My husband is from Eugene, Oregon. We have lived in our house since 1999 with our two boys. As a family we love to travel to the Oregon Coast, San Juan Islands and Mexico.
Designer/Educator/Founder- Aardvark Design Labs

We are a family of four who loves adventure. We enjoy traveling and exploring new destinations and meeting new people. Hiking, biking, swimming, skiing are all part of the fun. We are very respectful of our surroundings and other people's property. 

"Why not go out on a limb? That's where the fruit is!"  Mark Twain
I’m pretty easy going and fun loving person that likes to enjoy life.  I work full time as a district Manager. I treat others as I would like to be treated. I love meeting and hosting new friends.

Hi I am Susan and my husband is Chris!  Both Chris and I love to travel and assist others who love the same. We have hosted and toured visiting international ESL Learners or students, around this great state, since 1995.  We are typical outdoor enthusiasts, biking, hiking and kayaking whenever we can. Years ago we bought this lake cabin, and magically transformed it into a modern home with a living area for guests in mind.  The lake, privacy, and gardens drew us here but so did the convenience- walking to the mall, bus transit center, restaurants, groceries, recreation and a 5 minute drive to the beach, city hiking parks, and really everything! We want to share this urban city area, while you stay in your own apartment/suite, from which you can also explore it!

Hello travelers,
I live in the expensive part of Seattle and am trying to makeup the downtown living by sharing my house with you. I have all the basics taken care of and strive to provide my guests with a clean and comfortable place to sleep. Please don't expect it to be a hotel service and please don't expect that I am the only person in the house, opening up the entire house up for you.
By nature I am kind, responsible, quiet, friendly and easy going. I love to be around people. I am looking to host kind and friendly females and friends. Will do my best to accomodate your requests!
If you are booking an airbnb for the first time use my link https://abnb.me/e/booGPTKIB0 to get $40 credit
www.airbnb.com/r/amys369

We love walking and exploring, enjoying nature and following history. When traveling, we really appreciate beauty, attention to detail, and enjoy cozy out of the way places, unique finds, and special romantic accommodations.  We are quiet, clean and respectful, yet friendly and curious about the world around us. We have a lot of experience hosting and visiting others around the world, so have just recently signed up to host with Airbnb. When you stay with us, we hope you'll be as comfortable and happy here as we have been in our travels.
Working artist based in Seattle, have been an Airbnb host for about four years.  Quiet and respectful.

We are your hosts, long time Seattleites and professionals who love excellent food and modern design. John is a master gardener and beginner mandolin player and Michael is a real estate broker and leather artisan who loves all things design. We both enjoy entertaining friends, beautifying our yard, and r&r time with our furry friends.

Architect with past stints in community development, politics and hi-tech. Also design and sell modular European kitchens. Former Peace Corps volunteer in the Sultanate of Oman where I worked in archaeology and historic preservation. Love cooking and baking. Love art,  artists, poets, writers, filmmakers and other people who make the world beautiful. Enjoy writing about design and politics. Read widely.  Extroverted, except when I am introverted.

I am an executive coach and OD consultant. My spouse is from Canada and runs a nonprofit. Our 2 sons are from Ethiopia. We've lived internationally a lot and still like to venture out; Washington is a wonderful state to call home. 

We live right next to the Pioneer House so we can help you with your stay if needed, but we are private and not into being in your way.

In terms of the Alaska Junction Townhouse in West Seattle, you are on your own. We are a phone call away if you want to touch base, and have a liaison in West Seattle should something really come up.

We welcome people from all walks of life, faiths, perspectives, and from all over the world. We are LGBTQ+ and BLM.

Hi! I've been a member since 2013 and a Superhost for 3 years straight! I love hosting guests and sharing the Airbnb experience.  
I am a professional spiritual & life coach with my own practice for the last several years.  Prior to that I had a very successful career in the tech & media industry for 15 years and served in executive leadership roles. 

I am married to Jon and we have two beautiful little girls.  Currently we are lucky enough to live at our "happy place" in San Luis Obispo and are 10 min from the beach and snuggled right in the heart of Edna Valley Wine Country.

When I'm not hosting Airbnb guests I enjoy working with my clients in my coaching business, or traveling, leading retreats, riding horses, spending time with my family, or out wine tasting.  

I've been been doing yoga for more than 20 years and am also a certified LAGREE Fitness instructor.
I love to travel and help others fulfill all of their traveling needs!

Traveling the world these last seven years and staying with locals via AirBnB, I've gained a deep knowledge of both the world and myself. This experience has inspired me to share my home with travelers, curious minds and outdoor sport enthusiasts!!

Park City is an incredible destination on its own and I’m aiming to provide a destination within a destination, welcoming all guests who are open to sharing the space they are staying in as well as their ideas, experiences and dreams.
I am a native Seattleite living in Australia.  I love to travel and have tried to create a place that has all the comforts of home with a luxurious and modern feel.
I'm open-minded with a variety of interests. Love traveling, the outdoors, modern dance and performance art, mountain biking, politics, languages, and Scrabble.
I'm from Seattle, WA. I enjoy running, tennis, reading, and cooking.
Born and raised in Seattle, WA. Full-time RN. Daily yogi.

Hey,  We are Fred and Jennifer!

Thanks for checking out our home.  Fred remodeled it several years ago and we are excited to have you stay here.

We have lived in Seattle our entire lives and while we love to travel the world, we would never want to call any anyplace else home.  If you like, we are happy to direct you to some of the most amazing places Seattle and its surrounding areas have to offer.  You will love our city!

We look forward to hearing from you.

Fred and Jennifer
We are a 50 something couple who have lived in their forever home for the past 20 plus years.  We are both photographers and love what we do.

Friendly, people person guy who has lived in Seattle almost all his life. Like meeting new people, Art, animals, and Baking. Other hobbies: tennis and occasional social drinking with friends or hosting dinners. Day job in Medical/Radiology. Pretty simple guy! ;)

We are a happy couple and we love hosting travelers - ( as long as they are non smokers ). The apt.in Montlake is within blocks of the beautiful Arboretum .This location is great for walking through the parks and is central to all of Seattle by bus or lightrail. We love neighborhood and we think you will too.
Our second property is near the Mt. Baker ski area and is part of a nature reserve and is a historic cabin built by the co - founder and physician of Mountain Rescue in the U.S.A. It is a really great cabin on a large tract of wilderness that is really tranquil and lovely.
Welcome!

I am so proud to have converted the first floor of our duplex into a beautiful short term rental space.  Hosting with Airbnb has been very rewarding, and such a great way to meet inspiring people from around the world.  We love living in Fremont because it is so close to the water and it is full of restaurants and fun spaces to check out.
We are busy professionals and parents of two school age children.

My family enjoys traveling.  Usually we plan around water sports or skiing.  We have also started hosting on Airbnb.  We first rented our house in Seattle for a summer break in 2015 while we traveled abroad for 2 months.  It worked out great and we made some new friends in the process.   I work for a small investment firm and my wife is a public school teacher.
A native to the Seattle area, I enjoy providing a comfortable space and great experience for guests at my Greenlake home while spending time with my dogs and horses on Whidbey Island.
older and wiser

I'm a graphic designer with 2 teens and 2 small dogs (an old muppet mutt and a younger Dr. Seuss mutt). We live upstairs above the mother-in-law suite we are renting for our Air BnB. 

We love music (especially guitar and piano and practice during the day), the arts and the outdoors. We love meeting new people. We've hosted dozens of college exchange students (mostly from Japan and China) and look forward to this new adventure. We welcome diversity.

I enjoy travel, languages and am curious of cultures. I love nature and the outdoors including hiking, biking, skiing, snow shoeing, SCUBA diving, snorkeling, swimming or simply working in the garden. Good books, live music and film all peak my interest. Good friends, family and good conversation are important to me.

We are a family of 5 that live in the heart of Seattle in the Queen Anne Neighborhood, with our dog, 3 chickens and betta fish named Romeo. We love the walkability of our neighborhood and enjoy all the coffee shops, parks, and being able to see people we know out and about. We are active hikers, skiers and sports players and our favorite summer time dinner is at the Queen Anne Farmers market on Thursday nights. We hope you enjoy staying in our home! We only rent it out occasionally when we travel, so it will feel like a home when you are here.

We love West Seattle and our neighborhood.  It is beautiful here and we feel lucky to live here.  That is one of the reasons we wanted to share it with visitors.
Taking our family to France and staying in small villages and getting to know the "neighbors" was transforming.  Our kids have never forgotten it and now love traveling.
We love good food and enjoy cooking. We both enjoy house projects.  I get lost in gardening and Ian is an avid flyfisherman.

Oops, forgot to tell you a little bit about myself. I'm relatively new to hosting but have been a guest many times and have always had memorable experiences all over the world. Haven't traveled as much as I would like but by hosting I'm bringing the travelers to me. It's a win, win. And your host is not a 4 year old, although that could be interesting...but heck it's the best picture I could find. I am actually a "mature" adult, most of the time, mother of three grown children and graphic designer. Design creeps into everything I do whether it's cooking, baking, gardening or designing this little jewel you see in front of you.  I've also lived in Seattle most of my life and have seen this town grow into a vibrant and culturally significant city with endless places to explore. Since I live upstairs I'm usually available for recommendations or questions but I also understand the need for your privacy. No hovering here...although my kids may beg to differ.

We are Seattle based furniture and lighting designers and manufacturers.
We work with interior designers, architects and anyone interested in owning bespoke furnishings.
Our backgrounds include architecture and metal fabrication.
Our shop is in the Georgetown area.
We have two sons and a daughter.
My Mother and brother live in this home when it is not being rented out.
We feel deeply grateful to be able to offer our home to travelers from all walks of life and especially to artists and students who come here for teaching or learning opportunities.

Our life motto is: Do amazing work and surround yourself with loving people who inspire you!

Mature professional woman, mother, artist, adventurer.  I will be kind and respectful and expect you to be as well.   We are a pretty quiet but playful family.  So if you are coming to party in Seattle, this is not your place.  But if you like art, beauty, nature, the outdoors, good conversation, and are self reliant, introspective, mature, and respectful, then you should be a good fit here.  

We love to travel!!  We love Europe and have stayed on farms and in homes and B&Bs, and hostels.  The world is a beautiful place!

 No assholes allowed, you will be dealt with swiftly.  I am a mother bear about my home and family.  But if you are considerate, and mature and respectful, you should have a good experience.

Hi, I'm Andrew! I live in Seattle, WA and work in UX design. I love taking road trips and exploring unusual places and attractions off the beaten path. I’m always open to recommendations of new places to see where you're from and I'll tell you all the fun things to do in my city.

I enjoy traveling and witnessing the beauty of nature and of the world around me. I have a passion for cooking, gardening in the spring and summer and raising four lovely chickens (just for the eggs and great companionship) they are the best! I do not have much time for television but do enjoy watching movies occasionally with friends.

I've spent my life living and working right here in Seattle. Having taken advantage of what this area offers with a plethora of outdoor activities, moderate 4 seasons, and urban amenities, I'm constantly surprised that there is so much that I've yet done/discovered. I've put my heart and soul into this little piece of property (literally), custom designing it to take full advantage of the site. I hope it will become an important part of your Seattle experience, allowing you to enjoy the great Northwest the way the big guy upstairs intended it to be experience.
We have lived in Seattle since 2011.  We love good music, good food, and spending time with good friends.  We travel less than we would like, and revel in the opportunities we get.
