Founder of a video game company in Seattle, designing and building games for social good!  Interested in all things tech and travel.  Hoping to host some interesting travelers in Seattle and share this amazing city with them.

Marketing professional, Francophile, music/arts enthusiast from the Pacific Northwest, have lived many other places including Paris and NYC. Love to travel, ski, play pickleball, and all things water. I enjoy meeting interesting people from around the world and sharing my home with fellow travelers.

We are are professional couple and have listed spare bedrooms on airbnb in order to meet some interesting people. We happen to have a lot of extra space in the places we own. Airbnb was recommended to us by friends and so far our experience has been fantastic.  

We will be more than happy to help you get the most of your stay by sharing information and tips. All you need to do is ask. :-)

I purchased this home from my father's estate a few years ago and totally remodeled it to use as a second home for myself, as I live and work in Central Washington.  I so enjoy getting away to enjoy the many delights of Seattle.  When I am not there, I like to make it available for guests to enjoy the comforts of home during their Seattle adventures.

I am semi-retired,    67  years old,  single,  with  5 god-daughters that I help out with  by picking them up from school, sporting events.      I play squash, tennis, and ride a bicycle so fitness activities are a big part of my life.   I have  a very close and connected family of sisters, my mom, and cousins.   I still work overseas for a SIngapore based company that does work at civilian and military airports in  South Asia.   I work overseas  twice a year for  6-7 week time periods.
I do volunteer work for Catholic Community Services and  I like to Serve  Others.  I want guests to enjoy my house, I am flexible and and would like to adapt to your needs to make your Seattle visit one to remember.   I would like my personal home to be used by  guests that are visiting Seattle for tourism,  summer wedding,  family/friends gathering,  graduation from college of a family member, or for holiday seasons.     I am flexible on arrival times, departure times and dates that will help you plan your visit to Seattle.   Tell me about yourself and reasons for  visiting Seattle so I can make your stay in my home more enjoyable.  Babies/children are Welcome in my personal home.   Please send me an inquiry
telling me about yourselves and your mission/purpose on visiting Seattle and staying in my personal home.
   My motivation for hosting is to help multi-generational families be together in my personal home while they are attending an event in  Seattle.   Yes, the payments do help decrease my property taxes but at the same time I enjoy communicating with you to see if my home is a good fit for your family.   I can adapt to your schedule.    My rules are simple,  treat my home as if it is your grandparents/aunt and uncles home.   This is my personal home so I host approximately 10  times annually.    If you have friends in Seattle that would like to review my home to see if it is a good fit for your family prior to making a decision,  I welcome their visit to my home.   Please send email  INQUIRIES to me and I will respond promptly to see if my home  is a good fit for your family.
Again,  I am flexible on the arrival and departure dates,  let me adapt to your schedule.   I do my own enhanced cleaning protocols to keep your family safe,
all surfaces, linens, floors are sanitized by myself as I am a "compulsive on cleaning." 
I do not outsource to a cleaning service.   Thanks for your inquiry.  I would like
to continue answering your questions so you will feel comfortable with your 
decision-making process in selecting a home for your visit to Seattle.

Doug

I have been an Airbnb host in seattle since June 2016. It has been a great experience for my family and I. My husband and I live upstairs with our dog Theo. We just took our daughter to college so we are empty nesters and plan to travel and experience other Airbnb's. I have enjoyed meeting people from all over the world, this has been one of my favorite parts of being a host.

I have lived in Seattle for 25 years, raised two children, sent them on their ways and completely remodeled my house. I am now ready to travel and to take in travelers. I have built a beautiful one-bedroom apartment with kitchenette, private bath, and a private entrance to accommodate world travelers and people seeking housing for visiting relatives. 

I am worldly and educated but also fun and down-to-earth. For me humor (and love) makes the world go 'round. I have had a variety of careers including working in international trade and as an elementary school teacher. Currently when I'm not performing in amateur theatre, writing comedy, or doing a voiceover gig, I am a consultant working from home. 

I love going on local gastronomic adventures both budget and otherwise, especially anything ethnic.  On any night of the week you might find me out hearing music: jazz, classical, rock, funk and blues.  

I can be very engaging or unobtrusive. When I travel, my first choice is to stay in Airbnbs because I enjoy a more local experience and the possibility of making new friends. When I host, I would be happy to get to know you or leave you to your privacy as you wish.

Don and I love to travel, explore different cultures, and meet new people.  I'm a High School Spanish teacher and he works for the City of Seattle  We have two daughters in Texas and California and we spent the year living in Cuenca, Ecuador in 2009.  Our favorite way to spend a day?  Bike, ski, roller blade, picnic at the beach, and grill some Northwest salmon!
  I recently added 2 listings in Pompano Beach, Florida.  Now owned by the third generation, my grandfather purchased this property in the sixties.  The home has since been updated several times but still retains old Florida charm.

Robert - I'm originally from Boise, Idaho, but have lived in Seattle, Washington for over 20 years. I spend a lot of my time working on a fishing boat out of Seattle that takes me to Alaska and the Oregon Coast. In my free time I spend time traveling and photographing people and places. Some of my favorite destinations have been Thailand, Guatemala and Turkey. There are many more places I long to see for sure! 
Julia - I also love to travel. I was born in Hamburg, Germany and grew up in Portland, Oregon. After living on the East Coast and in France, Germany and Italy for 12+ years I returned to the lovely Northwest where I work as a full-time visual artist and jewelry designer.

I heart travel! I spend almost all my time dreaming of, saving for, and planning my next trip. Unfortunately I can't always travel, but hosting on AirBnB offers another way for me to "travel" with you bringing the world to me. I love music (fave band is The Smiths), books (fave author is Gabriel Garcia Marquez), and great conversation. Oh, and food. ALL FOOD.

Hello and thank you for visiting my page! Here's a little about me:

I grew up in the Seattle area and will always call this beautiful city my home. I love to travel and am always seeking out new ways to enjoy life at every turn. I'm warm hearted and energetic. Spending time with people keeps my blood flowing. 

When I'm in Seattle I engage in the following activities:
Snowboard Mountaineering (Splitboarding), Snowboarding (on the local lifts), Hiking, Road Cycling, Mountain Biking, Surfing (2.5 hour drive to the coast), Paddle Boarding, Climbing, Yoga, Boating, Photography, Brewing (Beer & Kombucha), Cooking. 

If you have any questions about any of the activities mentioned, or any activity you're seeking in the Seattle area so please ask! Most of all I love helping people get to know the beautiful city of Seattle.

Thanks for visiting our Pacific Northwest gem!

I'm a Seattle local of 20 years. An Upper Midwest native, I’ve lived on both coasts and have enjoyed extended stays in Europe and South America.  My folks (who were teachers) gave me the travel bug when I was three.

I love my little craftsman and I'm happy to share my slice of paradise with fellow travelers.  

Love watching a good foreign film over a domestic one, and enjoy coffees and wines with old and new friends. 

My next chapter in life is to be an amateur videographer. 

My life motto would be “Let’s go!"

World travelers. Curious by nature. Love to enjoy great food and drinks with friends and family. Social distancing while maintaining connection in our global community. Canadian born and raised, and the Pacific Northwest is where I now call home.

I enjoy learning about the world through my own travels and by meeting people traveling to Seattle.  I love telling people about my home town and making recommendations for sights, restaurants, and for experiencing the outdoors.  Seattle is a great city with endless possibilities for exploration.

We spent a lot of time traveling when we were younger- New Zealand, East Africa, Southeast Asia, Europe. Since we've gotten older and had kids we've still managed to make it to places like France, Italy, Spain, Alaska, Hawaii, and of course lots of places in the US. 

We really believe in the value of travel as a transformational experience and a way of making sense of the world. We have also learned a lot about what makes a good travel experience, and as hosts we want to contribute to those experiences for others.

We love music (both of us are acoustic musicians) and good food made with integrity (Greg used to cook professionally). We are very casual people, and value relationships and experiences.
Busy professional and mom of young adults. Seattle is a great place to live or visit for its magnificent outdoors and rich cultural life.

I'm a freelance cameraman, working on independent movies, documentaries and commercials. I was born in Essen, Germany and now live in Seattle, WA and Los Angeles, CA.  My partner is also a documentary filmmaker and is a Seattle native.

I lived in the northwest since childhood and feel very fortunate to be able to call this beautiful area of the world home. I'm a mother of two and I have been working in Real estate here for the last two and a half decades. In 2005 I became interested in vacation and short-term rentals. In 2007 we begin hosting in our downtown Seattle condo. The love of hosting turned into a second business and in 2011 we expanded we host now in various locations around Washington State. We understand what it takes to ensure that my spaces provide all the comforts of home while offering a unique experience. I look forward to hosting you in our beautiful rentals.

I love art, music, architecture, the outdoors, and great food -- and although raising our son has kept us closer to home for the past few years, my husband and I absolutely love to travel. We have had unforgettable experiences at airbnbs in Sweden, Iceland, Israel, Turkey, the Netherlands, Spain, Germany, France, Brazil, Poland and beyond -- it is our favorite way to get to know new people and places. I'm a responsible and respectful person and look forward to meeting each of you, in my home or abroad!

We're Pacific Northwest Natives and long-time Seattle residents (graduates from UW and Seattle U).  We love hiking and backpacking, biking, visiting new restaurants, great wine and beer and travel.  We're big readers and every trip we combine outdoor activities and reading.   We love our MLS soccer and football too... you'll find us at many Seahawk games during the season.

We're quiet hosts, but are also outgoing and social. We love our city and state and helping guests with suggestions of things to do and see.

I am an avid traveller who has spent over 20 years in Seattle.  Capitol Hill is one of my favourite neighborhoods!
I have high standards for accommodations when I travel.  I've created a space that is tastefully designed, CLEAN, clutter free and comfortable.  I'm excited to share it with you!

I am an avid outdoorsman and provide planned trips such as mushroom hunting and skiing as well as hiking trips both in the woods and the city.
I am a very open and accepting guy so don't hesitate to say hi or ask a question.

We're a family of four who loves to travel and adventure together. We also love welcoming people to Seattle, our adopted home. All money earned from Airbnb is going toward our kids' college fund, so you can feel great about staying with us!
Born in Honolulu and living in Seattle. Love exploring new places and being by the water. We have 3 little ones who are always down for the adventure as well.
I am a retired educator who loves to garden, walk, play with my grandchildren and rearrange furniture in my home.

Thank you for taking the time to read about us! Corporate Condo was established in 2014, providing short term luxury accommodations throughout the DT area.

Whether you're traveling for business reasons or relocating your family,Corporate Condo has the place that meets all of your short-term housing needs. Our corporate housing offers:

All the Amenities of Home
Our corporate housing comes with all the conveniences of home: fully equipped kitchens, high-speed internet access and local cable. Special requests? Just ask!

Pet-Friendly Communities
Home wouldn't be home without your best friend. Most options allow for pets but please make sure to inquire ahead of time.

On-Call Service
Our properties feature professional management and maintenance should you need something during your stay.

One Point of Contact
With Corporate Condo, you'll have a single point of contact that can help you with all of your questions and short-term rental needs.

Born and raised in the Pacific NW, I can help direct you in any direction you are hoping to go while in Seattle! I love snow in the mountains and water activities in the summer - All that Seattle has to offer!

I am a Puget Sound area native, I LOVE my city and guarantee you will too! I created the Corporate Condo Collection in 2014 and have already anticipate your expectations and are committed to providing you with an exceptional level of comfort, quality, service and simplicity.





Whether traveling for business or just between homes, I offer a seamless solution for your short-term housing needs for stays between 3 to 365 nights.

I am a 40 year old mother of 3 and part time mental health counselor in a middle school.  I have lived in this house for 16 years.  I love reading, time with family and friends, and travel.  My family and I are more than happy to provide any advice or feedback on things to do in Seattle!

My husband is an architect and built this eco studio 3 years ago with the idea of hosting guests and possibly using it as his work space.  Turns out we don't have as many guests as we'd thought so we figured we'd try opening it up to others. We have 3 wonderful kids ages 9, 6, and 3.

Welcome to our home! We love Seattle and want to share it with others. We converted our 450 sq./ft. garage into a stylish and relaxing urban retreat. We are a family of three with a wandering cat named Scout and our rescue dogs Kumo and Striker. 
Debra is a Creative Director and adjunct professor. Graham is a photographer. Our 17 year old son is active, curious and our favorite person to spend time with. 

We are welcoming, inclusive, relaxed, and busy. You may not see us much, but we are happy to provide recommendations to ensure your visit to Seattle is enjoyable.

I love traveling, food, health, tech and music.  Seattle-born, Bay Area-raised, East Coast-educated.

As a host, my ultimate goal is for you to enjoy your Seattle stay and make yourself feel at home. Tadaima! ただいま! I’m Home!
A Seattle native, filmmaker and climber. I am a filmmaker with a passion for telling stories and traveling the world.
Addicted renovator of old homes.  All of my properties have undergone "This Old House" like renovations which I personally oversaw.  Its been a 20 year journey and still going....
I have been a Seattle native all my life. My husband and I love to travel and explore new places. We like to eat and hike when we travel.

Welcome!...Seattle residents since 1990, we are semi retired, and enjoying “Life”

Although we've traveled the US, Asia, Europe, Mexico, and lived in Hawaii many years, we consider ourselves "Seattleites.” We love the Pacific Northwest, and enjoy sharing our home, and experiences with our guests. 

Stay at one of our two spots located on historic Queen Anne Hill, and enjoy close proximity to “Everything”
Wendy and John love to travel and meet new people.  John is an amateur baker and sometimes will offer his guests a freshly baked bagel or a slice of Cheddar Onion bread right out of the oven.

We completed building our home in 2016 and included a private apartment intended for short-term and vacation rentals. We love to travel ourselves and have been guests in many places. Those experiences and our great taste informed the design and functionality of our home and guest apartment. We extend open-hearted hospitality to all our guests, friends, and visitors.

Travel, good ethnic food, waterfalls, hot springs, a nice book, and a glass of red wine.  I have traveled a lot internationally, and locally--so please let me know if you have an interest for Seattle, and I can point you in the right direction.

As to the place, I prefer clean and somewhat minimalist--yet still homey and functional.  The kitchen has a big movable island that begs for chopping vegetables, and I like creating conversational arrangements with furniture to encourage people to share their stories.

As a host, I tend to be hands off as oftentimes at work or running around, so texting via Airbnb is the best way to contact me if you need something.

My theme in life is 'appreciate the moment.' I try to live life to the fullest. I just bought this house and I enjoy traveling and appreciate hosting guests from all over. I have been very fortunate in my own travels and have been hosted by amazing people all over the world who have shown me the real life of the places I've visited. I'm excited to pay it forward and do the same with my new home.
I am a photographer and love to capture the moments as they go by. My house is a part of my studio.

I grew up in Seattle & love the diversity of my city. I enjoy all the typical activities the Northwest has to offer.  Day hiking, sailing, I love all the local food & sense of community. I love dogs & Seattle loves dogs, so having my companion dog to go everywhere with me is another Seattle plus!!  I so enjoy having guests share my space.  I take pride in my properties & want my guests to be safe & comfortable.  Come & enjoy all Seattle has to offer.  

Anna
My husband, two boys and I live in Seattle, WA. We love the outdoors, travel and cooking. We are clean and respectful and love traveling with airbnb!

My girlfriend/cohost and I enjoy city living, travelling, meeting new people, and live music. We love our home and in the spirit of shared living, design it for both you and us.

When having visitors to Seattle, we can provide tips for a truly local experience - what to do, places to eat, and where to find music - especially places that you won't find online or in travel books. To us, these experiences create the most enjoyable and memorable adventures and this is what I look for when traveling to other places!

I'm a retired Amtrak conductor and my husband, Phil, is still working as an Amtrak engineer. We love our old house and spend a lot of time in the garden trying to keep our chickens from eating our vegetables and flowers. We love to travel near and far, and do Home Exchange as well as AirBnB.

I am a music teacher and photographer.  I love creating, cooking, and spending time with my husband, and son.  I love experiencing new places, meeting new people, and especially doing both around a table and over a good meal.

As an AirBNB host, I love the opportunity to welcome guests and make you feel at home.  My family loves the opportunity to connect with and host people from around the world.

If you're interested in family or couple photos while you're in Seattle, I'd love the chance to photograph you.  You can find my portfolio online at Sparkfly Photography.

Hair and Makeup Artist

I am a native of Washington and have lived in Seattle most of my life. There is no place like Seattle and I love it here! Sailing and being on the water have always been one of my passions. 
Beside being a freelance hair and makeup artist, I have a hair salon on the property. I take clients by appointment only. Many of my guest have gotten their hair and color done while staying at Portage Bay Guest Cottage. Also, the guys who didn't have time for that last minute haircut on their way out of town. In addition, I have done wedding consultation for hair and makeup and completed their look on location.

Abram is a tech geek and works downtown Seattle.  Lived in Seattle for more than 18 years.  Moved from eastern Washington.  Spends a lot of time playing video games, catching up on TV shows and movies and loves eating out.

Arthur works in mental health. He's lived in Seattle for around 18 years as well.  He loves hiking and being outdoors.

We love living in Seattle. Tanya is a native Northwesterner and Tom is from Ireland.  We like the urban feel of Capitol Hill and feel very lucky to live here. Stay at one of our two spots (in March 2019 we  added a two bedroom apartment) and access the central proximity to coffee shops, restaurants, pubs, downtown theater, music, shops, parks, bakeries, universities and more!

I am from Seattle, and work as an accountant, IT guy, and property manager.  Love to build stuff, tinker, travel, explore, and take pictures

I was raised in the hospitality industry and have been helping with rental properties most of my life--I respect the responsibilities of both the owner and tenant, and treat all places as if they are my own.

things I like:
- Travel
- Argentine tango
- Cooking
- Burning man (Ranger)

I am a mom, real estate agent, bookkeeper for my husband's concrete finishing business and the Airbnb manager (just since July 2016).  We love hosting people in our home.  For that last three years, we have hosted exchanges with people through (Website hidden by Airbnb) (Website hidden by Airbnb) and we have hosted people from all over the world.  We have three boys so they keep us active with soccer games and school functions.  We love to eat good, healthy food and enjoying the terrific Pacific Northwest.  Our goal is to treat everyone like we would want to be treated and to foster goodwill to all.
Seattle native

Semi-Retired. Often Out and About.
I like people who are independent and politely social.
I just tried AirBnb when travelling and loved the adventure
A hiker, yoga enthusiast, travel-loving woman excited about offering her home up so that others have the opportunity of enjoying and exploring the beauty of Seattle.

Welcome to Seattle! 
My husband Tom and I love to meet others through hosting! Our goal is to provide comfortable and affordable accomodation for those staying in Seattle for longer periods of time (i.e. professionals/students here in Seattle for internships/rotations). Hope to meet you along the way!

Laurie and Tom

Hi,  I love gardening and working on my house.  Over the past 15 years, I've restored just about everything in my 1908 home.  I also love to travel, and decided to try hosting on Airbnb after some great experiences of my own. I'm a teacher in a Developmental Preschool program, and love what I do.  I also love my summer vacations and choosing an exciting travel destination.
Living in Seattle and love to eat well, drink well, and travel.... Ed is a psychotherapist and Korland is an opera singer….

I'm originally from Holland and emigrated to the US in 1985 ( fluent in Dutch and English).  My husband Kurt is from Northern California and moved to Seattle in 1987. We love living here in Seattle because of everything the beautiful Northwest has to offer from boating, hiking, skiing, sightseeing, dining, fishing, music venues and more. I own a wonderful home decor shop in the heart of Ballard and adore the old world charm Ballard offers with it's historic charm. My husband and I enjoyed creating and preparing the unit for our guest. We are avid AirBnB travelers and hope that we have provided anything and everything for you that we look for ourselves in a rental for a comfortable and relaxed stay at our apartment. We look forward to meeting you :)

We are Seattle natives and have properties in Kauai, Arizona, Seattle.  We love Seattle and our condo for it's amazing access to the very best of Seattle, and the great sunset views. We live primarily on Vashon Island where we are raising two little girls. We hope you enjoy our place!

I first moved to Seattle from Michigan in 1993, and my wife, Nadia, moved out from NYC in 2006.  We have lived in several of Seattle's neighborhoods, and chose the north-end of Seattle as our favorite area, and the place where we wanted to raise our family.  In addition to the two of us, we have twin 9 year-old daughters (Mia & Zoe), a Golden Retriever (Django), two orange cats (Mango & Elmo), and a Bearded Dragon (Draco).
Nadia and I have both traveled extensively (as backpackers and on business), and between us we have visited over 50 countries and 6 continents.  All of this travel has allowed us to stay in hundreds of hotels, pensions, B&B's, homestays, and hostels, and we borrowed their best ideas for our own Airbnb properties.

Hi. My name is Jeff and I moved to Seattle after graduating from the University of Wisconsin-Madison in the mid 90's. I knew that Seattle was the place for me after visiting friends here during a 5 month long road trip I was on. 
I have lived in the Madison Valley area for the past 5 years. I spent many years in West Seattle before that. 
This neighborhood is close to several hospitals on Pill Hill; where my wife works as a physician. We have a 2 year old girl that keeps us busy! 
It is close to the Arboretum, Madrona Park, Volunteer Park, Cal Anderson Park, and many other parks and play areas. The access to Downtown Seattle, Capitol Hill, Madison Park, and many other places makes me want to stay right in this neighborhood. I live about 4 blocks from The Walden.
My wife and I have done plenty of traveling over the years. Never enough!
I have been to many cool places, but always look forward to coming back to Seattle, the North West, and all it has to offer. Just two days ago I was out boating with friends and relatives visiting from Wisconsin and we got very close to a pod of Orca Whales. Another day in Seattle...
Come for a visit and experience Seattle. 
I look forward to hosting you and your friends and family.
My wife Holly and I are new empty nesters (sort of). We love to travel and spend time with our family and friends whenever we can.

I am a retired elementary teacher, and love to share my beautiful Craftsman home and gardens with others! As an artist, gardener, and former beekeeper, I am an advocate of living with nature in a low- impact way!  I love to travel, read, cook, hear live music, sing, and dance!. I am a volunteer at the Woodland Park Zoo and at my neighborhood P-Patch!  Yesterday is history, tomorrow’s a mystery, today is a gift! That’s why it’s called the present!
We live in the Montlake neighborhood of Seattle.  We love to be outdoors with our family.

I'm a father of one.  I am an entrepreneur.  I enjoy eating out in Seattle.  My favorite thing to do recreationally: anything on two wheels.  Most frequently that is mountain biking, which is top notch in the Pacific Northwest.  I believe in smiling at strangers.

I have received three covid vaccines, including the booster, and I will only allow guests into my home who are fully vaccinated. I am retired, and am usually home, so if there is anything you need, I’m always happy to assist. I can also help you navigate the area, and discuss your itinerary with suggestions and ideas, to make the most of your time in Seattle. 

I have been told numerous times from guests that “this is not your normal or ordinary Airbnb,” which I consider to be a compliment. If you are an art appreciator, have an artistic flair, or simply want to engage your senses, you just may enjoy staying here. I have lived in Seattle over 42 years; all of which were in Queen Anne, which is unmistakably the finest, and most highly sought after location in Seattle. It’s a very quiet neighborhood, filled with charming turn of the century homes, (except for mine which is contemporary) and there are no apartment buildings, or developments, which adds to the serenity of the area. Bigelow Ave is a historical street, lined with huge trees, and a viewpoint one block from me that is a major viewing area for the 4th of July fireworks, and is a primary stop for tour buses. It overlooks Lake Union, which is filled with boats, houseboats, Cascade mountain view’s, and is where the houseboat that was instrumental in the movie “Sleepless in Seattle” was filmed. 

If you stroll down Bigelow Ave, you will find many city views.  I’m located one mile from Seattle Center and two miles from downtown. The bus which takes you directly to both locations, and is one block from my home. The majority of the attractions are very close to my home, so unless you plan day trips, you won’t need a car. I can direct you how to get to my home from the airport by public transportation which is simple; one train and one bus ride, and it’ll be less than $6 per person. 

Queen Anne Avenue is eight blocks away, which has dozens of dining choices, bars, shops, banks, Trader Joe’s, Safeway, a drug store, and many restaurants offer outdoor dining. In the colder months, the outside secluded personal booths have heaters. 

If you prefer a sparse, refined, buttoned-down, or minimalistic setting, this is not the home for you, and it would be best for you to secure other lodging. This home is the embodiment of a modern, cool, and trendy abode, in combination with a chill and relaxed attitude. 

However, if you want to visit Seattle, and stay at my home; there is virtually nothing that you need to bring, except your clothes, and if you need robes, coats, or jackets, I have plenty of them available. The bedroom and bathroom are filled with absolutely everything that you may need, or not even realize that you may need, and every possible convenience is contained within your space, as well as the coziness and comforts that will contribute to ensuring that you have the best experience possible. 

I am a world traveler and I understand the importance of a quiet, comfortable, cozy, and inviting atmosphere after a day of traveling, driving, flying, touring, sightseeing, visiting with family and friends, and dealing with crowds, traffic, and lines during high tourist season. 
If you are arriving by car, there is always ample free parking on my block; one of the last neighborhoods in Seattle with this luxury. If you need your laundry done, before, during, or when you depart, I will do it for you. 

If you stay at my home, you will be welcomed with gracious hospitality, elegant sheets, goose down and multiple Tempurpedic pillows, a large closet, an aromatherapy diffuser, and a sound machine with many possible water choices; rain, two surf modes, thunderstorm, pond, white noise, and it can also be customized to add the sound of frogs, owls, birds, etc. 

The room is fully inclusive, and you will find, robes, a heated towel warmer, an abundance of emollients for both men and women, a blow dryer, a flat iron, a curling iron, an assortment of hair products, toothpaste, toothbrushes, dental floss, Q-tips, cotton balls, toothpicks, pain relievers, and a private bathrooms stocked with everything you could possibly need. There is a large assortment of body washes, shampoos, conditioners, lotions, and potions. Also, an assortment of skin care products for men. I’ve been told many times by guests after they have arrived home, that now their husbands, partners, boyfriends, or male friends, are hooked, and are now indulging in self care skin and body care products. A weighted blanket and a relaxing foot massager is also available. 

It also has several dimmable steampunk fixtures, a Keurig coffee machine with a huge assortment of coffee. I always make sure the room has snacks, chocolate, candy, a mini fridge, a microwave, and an antique ice chest which is full of dishes, utensils, glasses, wine glasses, a corkscrew, dozens of tea choices, napkins, go cups, and basically anything you may need. The room also has a leather love seat, a desk, and a large Samsung HD TV with Netflix, HBO, Showtime and many other choices. I will welcome you with wine or beer upon your arrival if you choose to indulge. 

The bedroom will pamper you with soothing comforts, a king size Temperpedic bed whcih adjusted for both your bed and your feet, a heated mattress pad to ensure you’ll be toasty when you crawl in bed in the cooler climates, which is dual controlled and has three heating zones, so you can customize where you want heat to be distributed. For the warmer months, the house has a brand new air conditioning system, and a Dyson tower fan for the room. I’ve been told so many times that the space is like a spa, and that I have comforts that the guests didn’t realize even existed. 
I have volunteered at the Seattle Animal Shelter for over 14 years as their official mascot at sporting, fundraising, and adoption events. It's always a thrill giving hugs and high-fives to kids and adults alike, not to mention hundreds of selfies as Fido the bloodhound.

I have a 15 year old yorkie, and a six year old Lhasa Apso. I also have a 22 year old African Grey parrot, who speaks and mimics, however she is on the main floor, and your space is on the 2nd floor. Your pets are always welcome in my home.

Seattle was the first state in 2014 to legalize both pot and gay marriage, and is extremely liberal.  If you choose to smoke, I simply ask that you do it outside on my porch, or you can walk one block to the amazing viewpoint where there is seating.
My wife and I have been in Queen Anne for 17 years. We have enjoyed raising our kids in the great community.

I love to ski and waterski.  I am pretty active - I swim, bike and run regularly.  

I've been living in Seattle for over a decade and I love this gorgeous part of the country! I also love to travel and explore the world.

I work in software and am a generally happy, optimistic person.

We enjoy being retired & hosting on Airbnb and helping friends host by acting as their co-hosts.
We are Fully vaccinated.

We have traveled thru most of Europe related to work and seen plenty thru jet-lagged eyes.
Love to share our love for the Pacific NorthWest as well as Arizona.

As a world traveler and Airbnb user myself, we built a space to hostbut when we moved I was so sad to lose the beautiful new space. So we bought a house with a tiny house on it,  which we can extend to other travelers! Both my husband and I have lived in other countries and love meeting people and sharing our city with them. We have 4 children in our home which is on the same property. 

My husband and I love to dance, go to festivals, cook and be with our kids and friends. My husband works in technology and I am a kids music and yoga teacher. 

We have traveled to Thailand multiple times and often visit Europe. 

We are fairly relaxed people, but always like clean spaces, good communication and chill/adventurous people. 

We hope you have fun visiting Seattle!

Hello everyone!
I am excited to be part of the Airbnb community and to host people from around the world. I aspire to make everyone feel right at home!
I love traveling the world and my goal is to visit at least 2 new cities every year. I'm a big foodie so I always take a culinary journey as I explore new cities. Feel free to ask me for some recommendations when you come visit.
Luckily, I'm also a big soccer player and fan to help me burn some of the calories. I love traveling around Europe as I fulfill both my passions, food and soccer.
Look forward to meeting you soon.

I'm an instructional designer. I'm originally from the Northeast, but have been a Seattle resident for a long time. I love music, enjoy cooking, travel, reading, and exercise classes (which help to offset my interest in food).  My husband is a marine biologist and enjoys  building and creating new spaces.

Hi,  we are Ana & Saša
We love spending time with friends and family, and being outdoors. We enjoy traveling locally and globally, and we always stay in airbnbs!

I've enjoyed hosting independent and diverse AirBnB travelers from all over the world. They’ve been visiting Seattle for all variety of reasons: site-seeing, family members living or studying at school nearby, business trips, sporting events, relocating here—everything!

I’m a scientist and university professor. My wife and I are raising two young children. Our lives are filled up with many family and work activities. 

I have traveled the world since I was a child. Recent trips include China, Spain, Australia, and New York City. Travel has shaped my appreciation of diverse values and ways of living. 

My style of hosting is to give you complete freedom and independence.  Staying in the apartment is a 100% self-serve experience: the AirBnB app will provide you step-by-step check in instructions and everything you need to know about staying at the apartment.  And if you ever need me, just send me a text and I will respond right away.
Hello I am a life long Seattleite.  Lived on Queen Anne for over 15 years

Seattle is a beautiful and fantastic city to live in, or to explore as traveller. It will bring you wonderful experiences from its beautiful natural scenes, historical architects, high-tech features to artful culture diversity. I feel gratefully to call it home. Welcome to Seattle!
I'm a mama of two beautiful pre-school children who fill ALL of my time when I'm not at work here in this wonderful city Seattle.
Adventurer, traveler, reader, musician, songster, joker, all around silly goose.
High school science teacher married with 14-year-old twins who loves to ski, sail, travel, and spend time with family.
Saysha is a Seattle Native while I am from England. We work in marketing and communications. We enjoy the outdoors and are lucky to live in an area that is incredibly walkable through the year.

I love to garden and travel. I love good food. I love living in Seattle. All my life I've worked very long and hard hours...This year I am trying a new kind of life! I'd like to travel more and 'work' less. 
I have an amazing son who just starting rowing! I am married to an extremely talented and hard working husband.
I was raised in Seattle and have called this city home for over thirty years. I'm familiar with many of the city's neighborhoods and eateries, so don't hesitate to ask for recommendations.  (She/her)
I love adventures, travelling, and exploring! Cycling, walking, sailing...
I live in Seattle with my husband Matt. We love to travel together and experience new places!

We are a super happy couple that enjoy doing just about everything together. Our top 5 favorite things together are spending time with our kids, finding new places to eat, travelling, visiting friends and family, and playing with our pup.

After staying in a California AirBnB we got inspired to become hosts ourselves and poured our energy into making it happen. We are super excited to be part of the hosting community and have enjoyed the process of creating a truly beautiful and relaxing place for guests to stay and enjoy the Seattle area.

We love this city and love to help others experience the beauty and everything that Seattle has to offer. To make that happen, we put extra effort into making our guests' stay as comfortable as possible and we are happy to share it with you.

I'm an entrepreneur/technologist working on my own business, currently having a development team in China as well as a local team in the US. We build websites and mobile apps, so if you're into technology, we have a lot to talk about! ;)

I'm also a frequent traveler who loves traveling whenever I get to. I'm a gym rat, very much into cardio workouts especially like boxing! Also love the outdoors. I enjoy meeting new people, attending local events, networking with professionals, reaching out to nightlife, etc.

I am from Seattle, WA and work for a technology company as an Product Manager.  I love to travel and experience other parts of the world and wish I had more time to do it!

I have been hosting for 5 now and am excited to be a part of both sides of the AirBnB community.
I was born on the East Coast, but I have lived in Seattle for almost 50 years. I like to travel and when I'm home I enjoy meeting new people from all over!

My husband, Charley, and I are in our mid-70s and have traveled around the world several times and continue to love travel.  Charley is a retired psychiatrist.  I was the executive director to a professional nursing organization and taught in the University of Washington medical school.  We have had many guests from all over the world and enjoy all kinds of culture, food and music.       We do have a cat so we are unable to accommodate other pets.

Originally from Scotland, we became Ballardites 12 years ago and can't think of a better place in Seattle to live. Having friends and family visit from afar, our backyard cottage was created to provide a comfortable stay where they could come and go as they please and have all the amenities they have at home. Now we want to share our cottage with others, so they too can have the space and comfort while staying in Ballard.

I live in Alki Beach, West Seattle with my two daughters, Gabriela and Gina. We love Alki as it’s the closest thing to a beach boardwalk you can get in Seattle. 

Another place we love is Vashon Island (short ferry ride) where we lived for 10 years.  We also enjoy all the many parks, and spectacular water and mountains nearby. 

I started hosting on Airbnb in 2017 and immediately knew this was for me. Guests kept raving about their stays and I loved every minute of it. I became a Superhost since first eligible, and haven’t looked back.  I wanted to do more.

In 2018 I started my company, HOST JEEVES, to manage investment/vacation properties for other owners. It’s been great so far.

As your host, I will do everything to ensure you have an amazing experience. Please come and be my guest for a truly memorable stay!

I own RSJ Management and I am an Insurance professional with Farmers Insurance/Maureen Healy Agency. I have been managing vacation rentals since 2012.  I have high standards regarding customer service. I enjoy working with our guest for any occasion.  This is my favorite work.

Hey I'm Matt!

I live and work in Seattle as a freelance creative and digital marketer. I grew up here, but recently moved back after 7 years away because I missed the Pacific Northwest way too much! 

As you can probably tell, I love Seattle and everything it has to offer. It's a world class city within a hour or two of some of the most amazing nature America has to offer. As a host, it's my goal to make sure you're not only comfortable and enjoying your time, but also making sure you're seeing the best that Seattle and the Pacific Northwest has to offer! 

Some of my favorite activities are biking, hiking, swimming, and snowboarding. I'm also a big fan of cold brew coffee and Thai food, of which you can find plenty on Capitol Hill. I also enjoy seeing live music and getting my steps in on my Fitbit. I also have a super cool juicer which I'm pretty stoked on.

We live in Seattle and primarily intend to use airbnb to find vacation places.  We have gone similar routes in the past and have been extremely happy with the outcome.  

We also host a unit in Green Lake, Seattle, WA. We stay here often and love sharing this special place with others.

We love the great Pacific Northwest!
Hiking/biking/camping/kayaking/rafting/travel
Loves to travel

My wife is a Seattle area native and I have been here for over 30 years.  We have been in our current house for over 20 years, and love our location.  We have four kids, all of which are either in college or beyond.  Family and friends are very important to us.  Let us show you our beautiful city.

I'm an architectural designer originally from Anchorage, Alaska, but lived and studied in New England (New Hampshire, Vermont, and Rhode Island) for 9 years. It's been great being back in the Pacific NW! I love to travel, to get to know places by happening upon them, meet people with different perspectives, and just have a little adventure.

I was originally born in England but grew up on the East Coast. Seattle has been my home for 30 years. I love the mountains of the great Northwest, right on my doorstep, the weather (even when it rains), our museums, plays and musicals, wine tasting, the always-interesting Green Lake park, and the Seahawks. I welcome guests of all kinds and from all walks of life to come and play in beautiful Seattle!
Married and retired. Love to travel in India mumbai.  Originally from Colaba Mumbai . Settle in Seattle since 40 yrs

Occasionally travel for business.  Airbnb host in Seattle - Fremont district:  One of the best locations in the city.  Amazing restaurants within a few blocks.  Quirky shops, grocery stores, coffee shops, entertainment and night spots with live music.

I enjoy being outdoors in the Great Pacific Northwest, fly fishing, hiking and skiing and am always happy to assist with adventure plans and restaurant choices. Welcome to Seattle. 

- Tony

We have lived in Seattle for 30 years.  I am an executive recruiter for a global advertising & marketing company and Ken manages a boat rigging company.  We love sailing, cooking, eating, traveling and spending time with family and friends We love the Ballard area and are excited to share our home and neighborhood with visitors. We provide a binder with recommendations around Seattle and are happy to and answer any questions you have for your visit.

My family takes full advantage of living in the PNW! We hike, bike, enjoy the vast choice of restaurants and all of the great parks. 
When we do leave the PNW we prefer to stay in  Airbnbs and we are excited to share our private guest suite with visitors traveling to Seattle. Rain or shine it is a fun city to explore and easy travel by car or train to Portland, OR and Vancouver, BC.

After my husband passed away, my daughter and I renovated our Queen Anne home. We renovated with the intentions of creating a Four Seasons Airbnb, hosting guests from all over the world, while we travel all over the world.  We added an additional floor, putting all the bedrooms on one floor. We opened up the main floor and built an amazing kitchen and living room. The dining room table seats eight, with kids seating for 6 close by! We turned the downstairs into a private Guest Suite. Our house was inspired by all the fabulous hotels we've stayed and ships we've sailed. We're calling our home the Queen Anne Oasis. Everything from the heated floors, towel warmers, and swim spa is the best. We want your visit to Queen Anne to be five stars all the way. 

The Queen Anne Oasis is for everyone, especially kids. My daughter created a game closet will all our favorite games. We've also left our bikes, scooters, and unicycles for our guests to use. 

My daughter and I are currently traveling, Queen Anne Oasis makes that possible. Throughout the house, you will see art that we've collected around the world and personal photos that tell our story. 

We'd love to host you on your visit to the Emerald City.

I am an Engineer by profession and work at South Lake Union. Outside work, I love traveling, outdoor activities and meeting new people. I try to travel to a new country at least twice a year. Japan, Mexico, Bolivia, Peru are among my favorite travel destinations. A few in my bucket lists are deserts of Morocco, trek through Patagonia, safari in Tanzania, hike in Nepal.
While indoors, I am either reading a book, being productive (whatever that means). I also like watching interesting TV shows or movies and sometimes play games with friends.
User experience designer, social entrepreneur, hiker, biker, skate-skier & Jack Russell Terrier fanatic.

I grew up abroad in a multicultural world. I love diversity. I think it makes the world a better place. Naturally, meeting new interesting people is very exciting to me. There is so much to learn from each other.

After finishing college I began working as a software engineer on video editing software and have been doing that for the past 10+ years. In the intersection between science and art, I am most at home when form meets function in the most elegant ways. It is so exciting to be able to watch a movie and know exactly how it is made, right down the each pixel. If you're interested in this sort of thing, I love chatting about it-- but be forewarned, you may never be able to watch a movie the same way. The magic of film-making can sometimes go away when you know how it works.

As an engineer, I absolutely love fixing things and tinkering. Naturally, I spent the past several years upgrading our home. I decided it would be great to share all the upgrades and hard work I've done and list it on Airbnb. It really has been a labor of love for me. My wife and I live nearby, so we're always close by if something breaks. I know the home inside and out and will do everything I can to make sure your stay is amazing. 

I love adventure! My wife and I met at a Lindy Hop dance, we've been scuba diving, skydiving, and I even have my very own paraglider. If you're an adventurous type too, I'd be happy to give you some ideas for things to do while you're visiting Seattle. I look forward to hosting you and chatting about interesting topics!

It's actually Giovanna and Robert Duque. We are a husband and wife hairdressing team that is in love with Seattle. We love good food, good company and good coffee! I love books and Robert loves movies, and we both love music. We have been married 26 years and we are still in love! 
In fact, that's our motto: 
“All you need is love!”

I am an actress and a mother of two girls. I got an mfa from the University of Washington (go Huskies). If anyone has any questions about theatre in town or kid friendly activities or places to go,  feel free to ask.

I'm a Seattleite and love our Emerald City.  Love to travel, explore the outdoors and meeting people.  When it comes to food, will try (most) anything.....once.  

Excited and honored to be hosting your stay!  If this is your first time to Seattle, you're in for a very nice treat!  If this is a return visit for you, welcome back!

I grew up in the Midwest and came to Seattle after college 30 years ago. I can't imagine living anywhere else and pinch myself everytime I wake up in this beautiful place. West Seattle is such a special and unique neighborhood with its abundance of parks and views. I have had a great career here as a real estate broker and love our variety of architectural styles. My husband and I love to travel and try to make our studio everything we would expect.

Lets see... five things I can't live without would be: (1) playing and writing music, (2) epic breakfasts, (3) freedom to travel, (4) good coffee, (5) my friends and family. Obviously, that's in no specific order, but you get the gist of it. I visit Tokyo somewhat regularly and I'll be joining my buddy's band out there in a little while. I'll take the opportunity in my off times to visit my friends in KL Malaysia, Busan South Korea, and cousin lives in Da Nang Vietnam, so I might as well visit him too. 

I used to run Airbnb very frequently, but the room was needed for a family member for the last year and half. Now, it's vacant again and back to Airbnb. 

My style of hosting is a pragmatic reflection of my guest - I'm there if you need me and not there if you don't need me. I don't mind telling you everything about the town. I did grow up in Seattle, so that has to be worth something. I make great breakfast and I value quality, light roast coffee beans. My style of traveling is to travel lightly and go with the flow, eat the good food, see the sights, make friends, find a bicycle, and not to spend a shit ton of money. I also cuss like a sailor.

I don't have a life motto. 

Joe

I am a Seattle native married to a Seattle transplant. We love Seattle and all that it has to offer. We are passionate about healthy living and value eating local, sustainable, organic foods. We also love biking, especially on our tandem bike. We have enjoyed several bike tours throughout the NW and recently one on the East Coast. We hope to go on a bike tour in Croatia or Cuba soon. You will notice the bike theme throughout our rental. 

I love to travel, both domestic and international, Eric loves staying home and doing home projects. Somehow we manage to both get our needs met. 

I work from home so I will be pretty available to greet you, get you settled and share my favorite Seattle restaurants and attractions. And if you prefer to be left alone I'm fine with that too.

As guests, we are independent and very respectful of the property. We do like getting to know other hosts and their cities if that's possible. We've always been the b and b type of travelers.

I've lived my entire life in the Seattle area:  Grew up in Bellevue, WA; graduated from the University of Washington with a degree in Economics and International Studies.  I've worked in online retail for much of the past 8 years, mostly as an accounts manager.  I have returned to school off and on in order to pursue different interests.  I have also coached distance runners at both the collegiate and high school levels.  A distance runner myself, I find that running is a great way to see and get to know a new city.

I have taken opportunities to travel in the recent past, visiting Australia and New Zealand in January of 2015; Switzerland and Nice, France in the summer of 2014 [and completing an Ironman there:) ]; Iceland, Norway Sweden, and Denmark in the summer of 2011, Barcelona and Switzerland in the summer of 2010; and Dubai, Jordan, Syria, Lebanon, Turkey, and other points in the UAE, in the winter of 2010.  All of these excursions have been very rewarding, in different and yet also very similar ways.  I've utilized airbnb for a hefty portion of my trips, always a rewarding experience.  My travel blogs are available by visiting "mikesbigtriptoscandinavia," "mikesbigtriptodubaiandelsewhere" as well as "mikesbigtriptobarcelonaandswitzerland," both on the blogspot website (evidently I'm not allowed to write the link).  Several photographs, as well as a lot of rambling descriptions and insights are available to be viewed, or ignored. :)

I enjoy reading and writing; music; TV, and movies.

If it has anything to do with traveling or being outside - I'm your guy! Though Seattle is what I call "home" I travel a lot and love it. 

I can't live without: my family, my vintage vehicles & my passport. 

As a host, you won't see me unless you're looking for a restaurant recommendation, a good hike to go on. 

Welcome to the Alki Lookout!

My husband and I raised our family in this beautiful neighborhood and we never want to leave. I love books, music, theatre, horses, dogs, movies. I love exploring neighborhoods and local haunts. My husband and I love to return to the same places. I have a wonderful big family. I love traveling with them and without them!

Hi, we're Abe & Dave and we are professional Airbnb Superhosts and social entrepreneurs.  

A portion of your reservation goes into supporting our efforts that help disabled children in San Diego, Seattle, & Miami succeed in school. 

Our goal is to help local charities (and at the same time) give you an amazing, fun, upscale, comfortable, & local experience in which you, your friends, and family will never forget. 

Since March 2020, we have added more targeted deep cleaning and enhanced sanitation measures across all of our homes. Also, unlike many places, your interaction with other people is going to be very minimal as this is a residence and not a hotel.  You and your guests can rest assured that our place is a relaxing safe zone.

Our homes are all professionally managed by us (Abe & Dave) and our team of trained greeters, housekeepers, maintenance, and customer service. 

Abe, Dave , and the team will answer your questions, concerns, and requests immediately. We personally read every single message that is sent to us. Dave has personally stayed in, designed, and curated all of the homes that you see. You are in very good hands!

If you're ready for the best of hospitality, please Instant book now. We look forward to opening our doors to you.

Your fellow Airbnb traveling friends! 
Abe & Dave

Follow us on Insta @ thebungalow.seattle for more images of the space! 

A few years ago, I left my job as a corporate litigator looking for something more creative. Easy going with a great sense of humor, I adore travel, interiors, architecture, art and fashion. Mama to one highly opinionated, hilarious and well-traveled preschooler who loves all things sparkles and skateboards. 

My mission is creating a space that feels both sophisticated and comfortable, and where you feel taken care of. 

I've called Seattle home for twenty years , traveled around the world from budget to luxury, with kiddo and without. I know what works and am excited to offer a place created from that experience.

Welcome to Seattle.  A transplant from the East Coast I have lived in Seattle area for almost 15 years now.  I would love to host you and share what I love about Pacific Northwest.  Whether you want to find the closest thing to east coast style deli sandwiches, ideal places to watch fireworks on Lake Union, or simply explore Seattle underground - feel free to ask; I would be happy to share why I chose Seattle as the place to start my family.
Pete is originally from UK, and works in the software industry. He has been in Seattle for 20 years.
Award winning interior designer base in the PNW..

Corey is a Northwest native and Marcia is a Midwest girl.  We love to travel locally, around the US, as well as internationally and enjoy meeting people from around the world.  We try to be travelers rather than tourists which is a huge distinction for us. We feel like we are really on vacation when off the beaten path, doing what the locals do!

We are a very active and outgoing couple that truly loves our city and sharing it with our guests.
We have hosted people from all over the world and this is the first time we are offering our services on this platform. Welcome to one of Seattle's most unique & historic properties surrounded by highly coveted community. We look forward to supporting you and your experience. We offer a view and property that will inspire you to Live Life.

Hello, I am originally from Venezuela. We are a family of four, all bilingual (English and Spanish). I am a Spanish Preschool Teacher and love hosting people in our home. I like to make their stay as comfortable as possible customizing information/snacks and resources based on guests’ ages, interest and purpose of their stay. We love to meet new people but also respect privacy and other people’s space. Hope you visit us soon!

I work in the travel business leading tours to many areas of the world, some are quite popular tourist destinations (Peru, India and Ireland) and many are off the beaten path (Papua New Guinea and Bhutan).

I always enjoy meeting people from around the world and sharing travel stories and information.

While I'm the primary contact for our AirBnB, my husband, Jon, may be the one to greet you depending on my travel schedule.

2nd Generation native to Seattle and Pacific Northwest but world travelers. Nearly 15 years as past B&B owners with lots of experience in providing  comfortable and safe accommodations. We cue off our guest to determine just how much interaction they want from us.
I’m a father of 2 bundles of joy that I enjoy spending every second of the day with!

My name is Michael.  I am a software engineer by trade, and a business owner by occupation.  I am passionate about building things.  

I have a young family and my priority is to make sure I create a warm environment at home.

My husband and I are world travelers who have come to love Airbnb and how great it is to experience places as though you were a local. We are trying to visit beer breweries all around the world. We always love to hear recommendations for great new beers!

As hosts, we want to offer a hassle-free, easy and comfortable place to rest your head after exploring our city. Our place is quirky, but solid. It was custom built and is one-of-a-kind. We want to offer a reliable, private accommodation for people to enjoy.

As guests, we want to treat the places we stay with the same respect we'd hope from the guests who stay with us.
Hi

We're a family with a full and blessed life! We have three kids and love to travel and host. I'm a digital marketer who runs eCommerce for evo.com and Jacque is an accomplished educator who authors and sells curriculum online. We have lived in Seattle for over 20 years and met while attending Seattle Pacific University.

My husband Mahesh and I have moved recently into a new home that we are having lots of fun making our own. We both work in a local tech company. I love cooking and enjoying delicious food, tennis, and Mahesh loves camping, traveling, trying out the new gadgets.
Grad student living in Seattle.

A great stay in Seattle starts with a unique space from which to launch city adventures or to cozy up with good friends and family. Our Airbnbs are the perfect location for travelers to enjoy all that the area has to offer!!  It’s been three years hosting  Airbnbs in Fremont and I am always looking forward to welcoming the next guests!!

My family is where my heart and my time are invested.  Life just doesn't stand still. In addition to managing our Airbnb condos, you will always find me caring for my family, cooking healthy food and hosting guests in our home, lending a hand or and ear to friends and help to the community, doing photography and getting out in nature whenever possible.

Hope to see you soon in Seattle!

Sara

I think. I reflect. I design. I make. This takes good dose of periodic inspiration. As such I love to explore and try new things and meet interesting people which brings me back into the mental space to design buildings for a living - I'm endlessly fascinated by living spaces - stationary or mobile. Come enjoy  a stay at my home.

I am an architect, husband and father of two.  My family and I have lived in West Seattle for over 15 years and love it.  We have been an Airbnb guest at several places around the world and have been impressed with the quality of the App and places we have stayed.  We are excited to join the community of Hosts!

I'm an AirBnb host of a tiny house in Seattle, WA. I'm originally from Pittsburgh, PA but have been in Seattle for the last 12 years. I love the Pacific Northwest, cooking, gardening, and walking. I am an academic and writer working on issues related to animal welfare in the food system. I volunteer for Pigs Peace Sanctuary and Books to Prisoners.

I love the Pacific Northwest and all of the amazing outdoor activities that it has to offer.  As an avid traveler myself, I strive to provide my guests with comfortable, clean, and quiet accommodations so that they can enjoy Seattle to its fullest potential.

Hey guys! My name is Tommy and I grew up in Seattle and consider it home. I love my city. I equally love being a host on Airbnb and sharing my homes with all the travelers from around the world. When I do my traveling, Airbnb is the first place I look for a place to stay. I love the unique experiences that you can get from Airbnb.

My goal is to make sure you have a 5-star experience.
 
Please do not go hesitate to message me for questions.

I am a Seattle native and I live just one block from where I grew up because I think it is the best neighborhood in a great city! My husband, Jeff, and I share the house with a golden retriever and 2 out of 5 kids (the 3 adult children don't live here anymore).  I love to play soccer, ski, hike, read, garden, travel and make stuff.
I am an avid runner, home chef and banker by day. We love the outdoors and our little West Seattle neighborhood which offers great restaurants, shops, hiking and the beach!

I am an avid wine drinker, pool lounger, love watching movies, cooking, and an occasional dinner party. We enjoy eclectic art events such as First Friday, dancing, and going to downtown, watching football/basketball, traveling, and having friends over from time to time.
Mother since 2016 and Airbnb host since 2017. Whether it’s camping in the Pacific Northwest or exploring internationally, we have fun traveling to the maximum of our abilities!
When I'm not hosting visitors to our Seattle Airbnb, I love to travel the world. Together, my husband Eric and I have explored 65 countries and counting.
I am Karin K. from beautiful Seattle Washington.  Married to the same cute guy for 30 years, with 3 daughters.  We enjoy family, art, food, music, vintage, ideas, and all people real.

I am really excited about hosting you during your stay in Seattle. I love the city and want to make your stay here as comfortable as possible. 
Seattle is best explored by walking or with public transportation, so I have selected places which will allow you to reach many of Seattle's major local attractions by foot, light-rail, or bus! 

If you have any questions about the city, want to plan your stay, need any suggestions; I will be glad to help. I look forward to meeting you!

We are a couple of Seattleites who love to travel and explore the world in search of the best guacamole!

We look forward to hosting you and always go above and beyond to make sure that our guests have a great Airbnb experience and feel right at home.

An artistic, friendly couple who have been living in Seattle for more than 10 years, we would like to welcome you to the city and stay with us in our lovely properties. If you need any help and local tips, contact us anytime!
I am a voice over actor, happy to be living back in my native Northwest.  I enjoy cooking, spending time with my husband and two boys, cultural arts and traveling.
I am a born and raised north-westerner and love Seattle!

Native Seattlite but came of age in the San Francisco area in the 60s and still believe in Peace and Love. Razor clams, fresh crab and salmon are my  NW pagan holy trinity. I've resided in Cascadia, from Northern Cal. to BC over many decades and enjoyed west coast travel from Alaska to Patagonia. 
  World events, geography and history fascinate me. Travel and meeting with diverse individuals provide a better understanding of our human experience. Outside of normal travel destinations I've been lucky to visit Turkey, China, Syria and Jordan.
   I dabble in distillation and each summer spit roast a hog with my son (middle Ray) throw a rather wild party for the Fremont Solstice. Glad to host you and available for Seattle guidance.... or not, as you wish. I do not golf.

Hello! We enjoy being a part of your travel and vacation choices. We are thoughtful reliable hosts who maintain the property for tip-top functionality and comfort. I am from Phoenix, my husband from Beaverton, Oregon. Our family of 5 lives in Seattle. We use our two homes (1 in Sunriver, 1 in Seattle) as our own so they are very livable :)

We don't know how they did it, but when the developers saw this prime Art Deco jewel, and the adjacent lots, they managed to preserve the vintage refinement enjoyed in the 1930s and marry it to the clean, elegant designs of our modern additions, all the while maintaining a distinctively Pacific Northwest vibe from the wooden finishes down to the foliage of our beautiful walkways. The Belroy is a quiet place to call home. Just a stroll away from fantastic city views and the happening Broadway scene with its many hip boutiques, cafes, and delicious restaurants.
I am a technical program manager that works a big tech company in San Francisco. I also host at times so I know what it’s like to be a good guest :)
Business traveler, venue low impact, usually there to sleep, but sometimes leisure. I am a foodie, I love sports, movies and country music.

A 5th gen Washingtonian and a 40 year resident of Seattle, I love where I live and enjoy sharing what the region has to offer. 
My partner Joe and I enjoy music, travel, food and people.
We are a family of 5 (plus various pets).  Our kids are 13, 10 and 7. We love our little slice of Seattle and can't wait to share it with you!

I am a medical social worker, and my husband, Josh, is an elementary school teacher. We are both Seattle natives and are enjoying raising our two young children in the area. We love spending time with friends and family, and like to travel when possible. During the summer, we particularly enjoy gardening in our spacious backyard.

Born and raised in Seattle. Love to be active so I can eat and drink all I want.

My assumption is that if you stay with me you have your own plans.  I try to always introduce myself and welcome you if you stay at my home.      

I am a very social person so if you want suggestions/ideas on places to visit or want to chat about some topic, I am happy to chat you up!
tbd

Born and raised in Seattle, and I am excited for you to visit my home town!  I am a self proclaimed foodie and love to travel.  Some of my favorite places to visit are Hawaii, London, Spain, Japan, Vancouver BC, and Disneyland.  Whenever I visit a city, I love to do what the locals do.  So whether you are visiting for work or for pleasure, let me know how I can help make your visit to the Northwest a memorable one!

Hey! Have lived in Seattle for many years. We Airbnb our cottage which is next to our main house near the beach in West Seattle. Love the arts! Our main house is 112 years old and we built the cottage for family members to stay in when they visit Seattle.

I believe that we are all children of God and LOVE is what makes the WORLD goes round! 

Please respect the house rules.

Former expat who loves to travel. Airbnb superhost in  Seattle. High tech marketing exec. Auntie who adores her nephews. Fashionista. Rye old fashion connoisseur. Pacific Northwest Ballet patron. Gardener, recipe-tester, hiker, lover of words.

Hey there! 

I am a former business coach and project manager turned full time Professional AirBnB Host :) I am originally from Illinois but have been absolutely loving living in Seattle since 2016! I am crazy about natural healthcare, rock climbing, salsa dancing, scuba diving and Iphone photography. Some of my favorite travel destinations so far have been Bali, Southern Thailand and the Galapagos. 

AirBnB hosting has made a huge impact on my life. I love to share my space and to help others share their spaces with guests from all over the country and the world! I love learning about the world through the stories of my guests. As a host I am dedicated to creating a safe and comfortable home away from home for my guests! My co-hosts and I are friendly and responsive. También puedo enviar mensajes a los invitados en español, así que siéntete libre de escribirme en español :)

As a guest I am very respectful, clean and communicative. I believe every day is an adventure no matter how big or how small. When traveling, it inspires me to connect with the people and the culture of the places that I visit as well as other travelers I meet along the way.  

I look forward to meeting you!

We will do everything we can to make sure you have a great stay! 

Our style of hosting is give you all the privacy you want while providing all the help you need. 

We accept people of all races, religions, and orientations.  We also believe in science, equality, and true love.  :)

I am a retired public defender and internet developer. I currently work as a life coach specializing in dealing with end of life issues. My wife, Martha, is a practicing physician. We have two children, one just graduated and another is still  in college. We travel to visit them and also try out new places. 

In the summer we love to be at home in Seattle to take advantage of the fantastic weather and all the amazing outdoor opportunities in the nearby mountains and islands. During the rest of the year we enjoy theater and musical performances, museums and lectures.  We also like to hike and cross country ski and are avid sea kayakers. We can spend a week paddling and marine camping in the San Juan and Gulf islands or we can also drive 5 minutes down the hill from our house, plop our boats into Lake Union and paddle along the famous Seattle house boats, under majestic bridges and enjoy breathtaking views of downtown and Mt Rainier with sea planes landing and taking off overhead. 

Martha is passionate about gardening and our 100 year old craftsman home is surrounded by gardens and unique stone work. We believe that we live in paradise and hope that you'll also come and enjoy our beautiful city and Airbnb private suite.

about my family:
We love to travel, try new restaurants, play board games, and watch Broadway.

Justin is a data scientist.
He loves to try different restaurants and new foods. 
In his spare time he loves to visit museums and explore the city.

Vicky works in the pharmaceutical industry.
She loves all things design and also loves to try different restaurants.
In her spare time she loves to make artsy things and read blogs.

They have three children who are complete goofballs, and a dog named Mochi.

We enjoy traveling very much, that's why we enjoy using Airbnb. So glad you're able to visit Seattle as it's a great place to enjoy the outdoors and cultural diversities in music and foods. There are so many beautiful places to explore from the mountains to the sea. It's one of the reason we chose to raise our family here. We hope you have a wonderful time in Seattle!

We were  both born and raised in Washington but have lived and traveled all over the world. We love to learn about and experience other cultures and have incorporated what we have learned over the years in all aspects of our lives. From raising our children, to cooking and gardening and even our design aesthetic, traveling to other countries has made our lives richer. Michael works as a program manager and Lori as an interior stylist and photographer for an interior design firm but we have flexible schedules and are always available for our guests. We enjoy spending time in our garden, visiting with family and friends, and doing our best to experience all that Seattle has to offer. We look forward to welcoming you to our amazing city!

Hello, I'm an avid traveler (55 countries, 49 states) who started listing my home while I was away on travel adventures. In the following years, I've turned my passion and side interest into a career of managing homes for other owners on the west coast.  If you own a home in San Francisco, Seattle, or Portland that you would like to turn into an airbnb rental, let's talk!

We love to travel and recently became Airbnb hosts. Our rental apartment is on our property, but has its own street entrance for as much privacy as you'd like. We're happy to share our love of Seattle and the Pacific Northwest, but are also happy to give you your space. 

We have two active kids who also love to travel, especially to the woods. Our favorite destinations are Denver, to visit family, Hawaii, to escape the Seattle rain, and Europe, for great food and art. 

We have lived in Iowa, Maryland, Florida, Canada, Spain and Japan, and have been committed Seattleites for more than 20 years.

Jim is a civil engineer working on water resource projects.  He has traveled in Central and South America and Asia.  Alice is a expert in native plants and has a background in early childhood education.  They are both interested in cycling, sailing and hiking.
Wherever you are, make it a home.

My husband and I live in Seattle.  We love to travel and explore new areas.  While away we frequently make our home available to other travelers exploring Seattle and the Pacific Northwest.  We have enjoyed living in   the Ballard neighborhood of Seattle for almost 20 years.

I'm your pretty average guy. A tech maven, Architectural Designer & builder for the joy of it, investor, pilot, day sailor and love meeting cool people. I've lived and worked in London, Paris, Seattle and Anna Maria Island and have a brilliant author/chef wife who is way cooler than I am. I also love my amazing little rescue terrier, Maddy.

I designed and remodeled this home myself, so I want to make sure you enjoy your time inside and find all the wonderful places to go just outside the door. 

I go out of my way to please, there is nothing more that I love to do than exceed expectations. My personal motto is "to find the extraordinary in the ordinary." 

You are going to love your stay here!
I am a mother of two grown children, who were raised in the Queen Anne home.  It is a great neighborhood, offering an urban setting with a family feel.

Hello, 
We're Meg & Sean and have lived in Seattle since the early 90's when we met. We enjoy attending concerts, good food and drinks, travel, adventures and boating. We have traveled extensively and have stayed in some great air-bnb accommodations (a vintage yacht in Amsterdam was one of our favorites). We heart Seattle and started hosting so others can see just how lovely the city is. We sincerely want you to enjoy your stay. Please let us know if there's anything we can do to make your visit more enjoyable.

I like walking in my neighborhood in the evening. I start the day with good green tea and two newspapers. I write for a living, but I never write in a coffee shop. I miss my dog, her name was Cricket.  She liked to meditate with me in the morning.

We are a fun loving married couple with a passion for Food, Music, Art, and Design.  Ting is a hotel consultant and broker. Bob is a chef instructor at a local culinary school.  We recently sold our condo on Capitol Hill and bought our home on the backside of the hill a short mile away...close enough to walk or bus, but now in the quieter and eclectic Central District.   We both love Seattle and the choices for different "speeds" of nightlife.  We hope you will fall in love with our city and want to return to our home again!

I am a yoga teacher, editor, writer, photographer, creative, and a public relations professional. My personal mantra is "breathe, create, connect."

I love to meet good people. Absorb art. Practice yoga. Write. Make and live in clean, inspiring spaces. Walk in nature. Touch plants. Be barefoot. Be healthy. Eat well. Find light. Spread joy. Listen with curiosity and heart.

We have lived in a 1905 Victorian Farmhouse on Capitol Hill in Seattle for 27 years.  Our home is an easy ride from the airport to the Capitol Hill stop on the Link light rail.
