We live on the first floor and we have remodeled our second floor to three well-appointed bedroom suites with a common laundry room.    You have your own private outside access to upstairs.  Each room has its own keypad security.  There are many restaurants and night spots on Broadway (a 5 minute walk) and on Pike and Pine (a 15 minute walk).

Welcome and enjoy the natural beauty and history of our Pacific Northwest!  We love new and historic homes, we want to help save the history of these neighborhoods. We believe we can do it, while you enjoy it!

West Coast US and Canada is my home for many years and I have enjoyed watching the cities in this region grow into truly world class destinations.  I believe when we build the new, we also have a responsibility to preserve the old to make our community healthy, diverse and vibrant.

While staying with us, you may meet 3 or 4 members of our team who carry on different roles to ensure your stay is smooth.  We look forward to making your stay as pleasant and memorable as possible.  Please let me know how I can help!

I'm from Seattle where i work in our historic district, Pioneer Square and volunteer at a non-profit to help promote historic preservation and cultural tourism.  I love growing my own food in my urban neighborhood.    I also enjoy farmers markets, traveling, music, restaurants and cooking.  

I've stayed in many great Airbnb apartments all over the world and it's finally my turn to host!

When I travel, I love to get off the beaten path and try to blend in with the locals.  If you would like to do that here, I can point you in the right direction based on your interests.  I've lived in Seattle almost my entire life.   It has changed a lot but mostly for the better. 

The restaurants here are incredible and new ones are opening every month. Coffee shops, pot shops, record shops and book stores are all nearby.  

When visiting Seattle, the Pike Place Market is a must see.  Another special part about visiting Seattle is taking in the water and mountain views.  Getting out on the water and seeing the city from that perspective is something I definitely recommend.   Seattle's neighborhoods have their unique character and it can be an adventure to explore them.

Hello! It's nice to meet you. I love being an Airbnb host and meeting wonderful people from all over the world. We have lived in Seattle for more than 20 years and think it is pretty much the most beautiful place in the world. We love to travel, but haven't been able to do it as much since we had kids, so now we bring the world to us by hosting on Airbnb. 

As a family, we love to travel, cook delicious plant-based food, and spend time with our extended family who also live in the Pacific Northwest. I am an avid crafter, DIYer and knitter. At any given time, our house is covered in fabric, glue, wood scraps and pretty much anything that can be used to create pretty things.

When our family travels, we choose to stay in clean, comfortable, and well designed spaces and - in turn - we strive to bring these qualities to our guests. I fancy myself a real innkeeper and take my job as a host seriously. I want to make sure you have a wonderful trip and be certain that you have everything you need to relax and settle in, especially your privacy. Of course, I am always more then happy to give recommendations and tips whenever requested.

I'm an artist who loves to travel for work and for pleasure —usually a combination of the two. 
My husband and I have lived on this property for 20 years. It was once my Grandmother’s home and some of her flowers and trees remain. 
As a 3rd generation Seattleite, I’ve got plenty of recommendations for your city explorations and day-trips beyond. 

We love our home, garden and neighborhood and think you will too!

My name is Christina, I am from Seattle, Washington, that is the west coast of the United States. I love to read, ski, eat, drink wine, and explore new places. I have a 21 year old, a 13 year old and a 5year old that also love to travel.
My husband and I live in Seattle.  I am a native. We raised our daughter here, and she and her family also live in Seattle. We love it here and love to have guests come to visit our beautiful region.

Born and raised in Seattle and I love to eat and travel.  Feel free to ask me about my hometown, especially your plans while you are in Seattle.  I will do my best to see if I can get a discount for your tourist activities or at least give you some information about it.  I do international travel 2 times a year and love every minute of it. 

I am a pharmacist who currently is on call everyday since I work for a temp agency.

Because my schedule is unpredictable, I'm currently looking for low-maintenance, self-sufficient travelers or roommates.
Working parent. Enjoy exploring new things.
I have a passion for hosting people. I am happy when my guests are happy :).

Born and raised in Seattle, I naturally gravitate to the outdoors. I love running and hiking with my beautiful Heeler mutt Reggie, who I bring everywhere. I'm also a professional poker player and have become really excited about welcoming Airbnb guests, both as an investment and because I love welcoming visitors to my city. I take a lot of pride in hosting, and personally manage everything, so I can stay on top of ensuring a top notch guest experience.

We're a happy couple living in an amazing large estate in Seattle. We visit Hawaii a couple times a year, sometimes with our kids and grandkids. Our beautiful timeshares in Kaanapali, Maui (near Lahaina) are The WESTIN KAANAPALI OCEAN RESORT (STUDIO, 1-BRM or 2-BRM)  and The KAANAPALI BEACH CLUB (1-BRM OCEAN VIEW or 1-BRM OCEAN FRONT). 

We have lifetime 5-Star Elite Platinum status with Starwood/WESTIN (the highest possible) as well as similar lifetime Elite Centum Platinum status  with Diamond Resorts/KAANAPALI BEACH CLUB.  As a result, if you book any of our MAUI timeshares, you share in the many special perks we have as owners at both Resorts including (subject to availability) early check-in, late check-out, best possible room locations plus there are no resort fees and parking is always free.

If you do not find the dates you would like on our MAUI listings, please email us and tell us the dates you would prefer (but try to do so at least 8-13 months in advance to be certain of availability (since West Maui is so much in demand now days).

In addition, in Seattle we have two very popular Airbnb units at our large Estate Home both with sunset views:  
#1 SEATTLE LUXURY ESTATE ROMANTIC SEAVIEW 1-BRM GUESTHOUSE
#2 SEATTLE LUXURY ESTATE ROMANTIC SEAVIEW SUITE
 
Contact me ASAP with any questions or to book!

My husband and I were born and raised in the Pacific Northwest and are excited to welcome visitors to our home and to this city.  We are passionate outdoor enthusiasts and also love enjoying all that this beautiful city has to offer - happy to share recommendations whether you intend to hit the outdoors or to sightsee and dine about Seattle itself.  We are frequent travelers and have explored the word wide staying at AirBnb's. Drop us a note!

I am originally from Albuquerque, New Mexico and now a longtime resident of the PNW. I absolutely love living in the PNW with all its natural beauty and opportunity to indulge my passions. Seattle has so much to offer with events and places to explore. However, I am a desert girl at heart and regularly visit the SW for my Rocky Mountain fix. 

My passions include cooking, foraging, hiking, gardening, sailing, and knitting. I love tending my chickens and hiking with my dogs, Meg and Grady. But, most of all, I love meeting new people, getting to know them, and learning about all their adventures. As a former professional Personal and Executive assistant, I very much enjoy taking care of people and their needs. This is why I love being an Airbnb host. Nothing gives me greater pleasure than making a difference in peoples lives. I love cooking delicious meals for my guests and making sure they are comfortable and cozy in their suite. It is my goal as a host for my guests to leave here feeling more enriched by their experience. 

For my own enrichment I listen to a lot of audio books. I don't have much time to sit and read, so I listen while I work. I enjoy almost all genres, but I particularly enjoy historical fiction (Sharon Kay Penman, Edward Rutherford, Herman Wouk, Ken Follett) fantasy (Diana Gabaldon, Orson Scott Card, Jonathan Renshaw, Neil Gaimon, Dean Koontz, Robert McCammon), mystery (John LeCarre, Rhys Bowen, Jacqueline Winspear) and many others. A couple of my favorite books are "East of Eden" by John Steinbeck and "The Good Earth" by Pearl S. Buck. If you haven't read them, DO! 

I love to travel and a bike trip across France or Italy is in my bucket list. I'm not a "fancy" traveler and prefer the simple life. I love to camp and stay in rustic cabins. One of my favorite vacation spots is Iron Springs Resort. It is not rustic, but the cabins are nostalgic and comfortable. I have many good memories there. Another favorite spot is Lake Ozette in the Olympic National Forest. I had the best canoe camping trip there ever. Many of the campsites at Lake Ozette are only accessible by boat. It is a beautiful place and within hiking distance of ocean beaches. I love adventure and live by the motto "Life is an adventure! Live it!!". I hope you will come share some of your own adventures with me.

My wife Leslie and I have been married for 30 years and love Seattle, but also love to travel. I've just recently retired and can't wait to see the rest of the US and the world. I love to bicycle (STP, anyone?) and hike. We both enjoy spending time with our son and two grandkids. Probably my favorite trip ever (not counting the two months biking thru Europe I spent in my youth) has been our trip to Paris a few years ago. I am a life-long Seattleite (my dad went to Queen Anne High School, long ago in the days before it got converted to a condo!)

My wife Molly & I love to hike, travel, good food and going on frequent walks in the neighborhood. We enjoy sharing our garden apartment and studio space and neighborhood with our guests. We have had people live in our extra spaces for many years and like to create a clean, welcoming and relaxed environment.

Debby and I love to travel and are mostly drawn to Spain (Jeff) and France (Debby).  I am a marketing consultant and my wife is a school teacher. We are from Seattle and love NYC, the North of Spain, and southern France.  We hope that we can continue to travel every summer to Europe and build stronger and deeper connections there.

Living in Seattle we are close to outdoor activities and beautiful nature itself.  Winter brings skiing and summer the bikes come out.  My yard is full of flowers and vegetables, the backyard has a fire pit and smores fixing are always at hand. 

We enjoy the arts scene of Seattle theater and music. 

Traveling to Italy a couple times we learned how to make pasta.  This has only improved our cooking and we spend  time in the kitchen exploring new foods and recipes.

Fully vaccinated and boosted household. We are a gay vegetarian couple who’ve trekked all over the world. We lived for four years in Melbourne, Australia, and several months in Burleigh Heads, Queensland as well as Bombay, India and the Côte d'Azur of France. We love animals, Burning Man, Amazonian shamanism, and camping/hiking adventures. We are nonsmokers. Grant is a software technologist who started his career running rides at Disneyland, and Raymond is a creative who DJs as a hobby and manages a warehouse for a premium A/V installer.
Love seeing and learning new things.

My husband Walter and I love living in Seattle where we raised our family and continue to discover the outdoor treasures of the Pacific Northwest . We enjoy sailing, hiking, running and snow shoeing  as well as travelling and spending time with family and friends. Walter is recently retired and I work as an education consultant.
We are excited about our new adventure as Airbnb hosts and look forward to welcoming you to our lovely apartment.
When I'm away from Seattle, Melissa from Madeson Management LLC provides guest services and takes care of the house for me.
Travelers who enjoy meeting other people.

We've been married 30 years and counting! We share a passion for the sport of soccer, watching more than playing these days...and try to escape into the hills and mountains as much as possible for a quick getaway. Joe is a carpenter by trade and has completed beautiful work on several remodel projects over the years. I’m a mostly retired photographer and currently working as a project manager for a graphic printing company. We enjoy the ritual of a morning paper and coffee, watching movies, going out with friends, cooking, gardening, travel and family time. We feel very fortunate to be living in the beautiful PNW!

Our family has lived in Queen Anne for the past 13 years. We have 3 kids (2 girls, and a  boy). We enjoy camping, hiking and traveling as a family. We also love cooking and eating out at delicious new places.

I'm an Oregon native and mostly live in a small town between Albany and Eugene.  I love my place on Capitol Hill in Seattle and enjoy sharing my place on "the hill" with others.  

I come to Seattle pretty often and when I do I love to meet my guest. When I am not around, I will make sure someone is there to help with your stay.

Hi! My name is Mary and I am excited to have the opportunity to assist you in a fun and comfortable getaway! 

I am a first grade teacher taking time off to be a stay at home mom. I love hosting guests and showing off this amazing city I call home. I enjoy traveling and have visited places like Thailand, Costa Rica, Mexico, and many places in the US and Canada. I love cooking, running, and reading. 

That's a little about me.  But most importantly, I look forward to hearing from you if you are interested in visiting Seattle anytime soon!

I am a PNW native my husband is from England.  My super power is attention to detail while his is telling English jokes nobody gets. We enjoy nature and bird-watching.  Our vacations often include hot spots for birding.  Our recent visit to Equador's cloud-forest in Mindo added some spectacular birds to our list! We travel and use Airbnb just like you, so we understand what it's like to be a guest. If you have questions, get in touch.  We can't wait to host you in our private backyard cottage oasis! We will even share our yard bird list with you!

I'm a freelance web developer with an illustration background and a Seattle native. I love traveling and spent a period of 5 years teaching English in Asia.

Delicious food is one of my great joys, and Seattle is the perfect city for foodies. With all of the local ethnic restaurants, I'm never without new cuisine to try out. 

My mother and I completed renovation of our 1906 home's basement to accommodate two beautiful studio apartments as of summer 2017. Art is the most important thing to us and it inspires our two studio Airbnbs; the Frida Kahlo and the Georgia O'Keefe units!

Hello!  I've  been an international flight attendant for 31 years and still get excited to plan a trip and explore new places!  Always up for an adventure! Airbnb has helped me maintain a home for my kids and now provides us a great and cost effective way to travel together!
Mature married couple (30 years), both Seattle born and raised in Seattle, Washington. Avid backpacker, recreational cyclist, photographer and writer.

Hello, I'm Lily.  When I was growing up, my mom opened our home to friends and strangers, and they became part of the family.  So here I am, welcoming you to my home.  When you live here, you become part of the family.  

I'm a single mother and a loving aunt, sister, and daughter.  My passion is travel so I know how important it is to have a "home away from home".  I'll do my best to make your stay as comfortable as possible.  My next passion is eating as shown in photo  :)

Musician for ballet companies which allowed me to travel all over the world and meet royalty and wonderful dancers. While doing that for 25 years,  I recorded 30 albums which sell worldwide. 
I invested in real estate which allowed me to be creative in decorating.  Seattle became one if the hottest real estate markets so I sold everything but one property to live in a Sprinter van and teach Bikram yoga.  I love working in Sonoma in the winter and there is a wonderful yoga community there.

Hello my name is Corey, my wife is Felie and our two kids keep us VERY busy. :) OH We also have a dog named Hermione. :) We love everything about Seattle, including the overcast weather. We love to travel and strive to expose our girls to as much culture and diversity as we can. Our oldest has already  been to six countries and many of our iconic cities here in the US. :) We also love to eat and are always on the hunt for something new.
Traveller, Seattle Sports Homer, foodie, fun-time seeker.
I live in seattle with my mom and two dogs. I love live music, reality TV, traveling and the DVR! I like meeting new people,  eating good food and spending time with family and friends

I moved to Seattle in 2005 for graduate school at UW, and fell in love with the Pacific Northwest. My husband and I are new hosts on Airbnb, renting out the attached studio in our newly-built townhouse. We enjoy traveling, especially in Asia and Europe. I'm a voracious reader, a green tea drinker, and a bike commuter. Alfred is a runner, a model train enthusiast, and an airplane junkie.

Born former Czechoslovakia, lived in Africa, England and USA
Interests in verity sport activity.
Very much an outdoor person

The AirBNB is my business, Guenther Group. The art you'll see on our walls is mostly created from past client projects in different parts of the globe. I live a few miles away, have two young children and a pretty active lifestyle. Sometimes during the day I may be working in the retail space on street level. The AirBNB space is accessed from the backdoor using a key code.

We are a Full Service Vacation, Corporate and  Short Term Rental Company. We manage and own over $50m+ in real estate, managing quality $1m+  high end vacation rentals in Washington, Idaho and continuously expanding. Our number one priority is for our guests to have an amazing experience so that they stay with us again and again.  

We make sure all of our properties extra clean, well decorated and set up for an unforgettable experience!
I live in Seattle with my husband and two daughters.  We love to travel to see the world, and to meet people from different places and different cultures.

I am a few years retired from a career in data processing, mostly as an instructor.  My goal has always been to move to the Pacific NorthWest, which I did in 2006, purchasing this condo in 2007.  We plan on retiring in it (when we move back to downtown after the better half retires).  

Please do not hesitate to ask questions about anything - especially Belltown and Seattle!

My husband John and I live in Seattle, WA with our 7 year old English Labrador named Sweet "Cleo" Brown. We love windsurfing, SUP, kayaking and hiking.  I am a successful artist and pottery teacher, Mum to two beautiful grown daughters and GrandMum to three awesome grandchildren! I am a positive, adventurous person who seeks out new experiences and loves meeting new people. Airbnb suggested a life motto...this is one of my favorites. " Life should NOT be a journey to the grave with the intention of arriving in an attractive and well preserved body, but rather to skid in sideways, champagne in one hand, strawberries in the other, body thoroughly used up, totally worn out and screaming, 'Woohoo, what a ride!'"

Busy family of 4 and 2 dogs. We love to travel and be outdoors. Originally from the San Francisco Bay Area, we love our adopted hometown of Seattle and are continuing to explore all the wonderful Pacific Northwest has to offer.

Hello I am native to Seattle and love living here and traveling to new places through air bnb. Besides my love for traveling I enjoy hiking in our mountains, skiing, walking Greenlake, sunsets at Golden Gardens and Gas Works park, yoga, and meeting  new people. Welcome to my home and make it yours for your stay in our beautiful city.
I am a Seattle native.  I move away for several years, but came back home in 2015.  My fiancee, Erin, and I live in work in downtown Seattle.  We are avid runners and hikers.

I was born in Seattle, but later went to live in Europe and California for several years.  When I came back home, I met George, who became my wonderful husband!  I've worked in many different fields, and I love meeting people from different cities, countries, and cultures.  Traveling has been a huge part of my life, and one of the things I love the most!

Hello everyone! This is Josh and I'm originally from Chicago but have called many places home, the latest and longest being Seattle. Lynsey, my wife, is a graphic designer originally from Michigan and also loves a good adventure. While not working, we like to stay busy hiking through the incredible natural spaces around Seattle or hit the city streets for a bite to eat. We love all travel, from road-tripping across the US to venturing abroad. Since buying our first home here in the Rainier Beach neighborhood of Seattle, we've been honored to open it up to Airbnb travelers as the kind of place we'd like to stay while away from home.
Love everything beautiful and delicious!
Unrepentant Foodie and Music lover. Aspiring world Traveller!

I am an outgoing and personable Tour Director. In the summer I travel the Southwest United States with groups from Italy and Spain. My wife is a school teacher with the San Francisco Unified School District. She is a wonderful host.
I speak several languages including English, Italian, Spanish and Portuguese.
My wife also speaks Italian fluently. We travelled the world together.

Andrea is a school counselor in the Seattle area. She has lived in Seattle for over 30 years and shares this home (and listing) with her wonderful husband Matt. Matt and Andrea equally enjoy spending time in Seattle at some of their favorite restaurants and bars and time spent in the mountains.

I am a happy person who loves to laugh and I enjoy spending time with my family, friends, and nature. I find peace during my daily walk at the park, the beach or wherever the day takes me. I have a passion for clean environment. I recycle and reuse products as appropriate to keep waste out of our landfills and pollution out of our water. Come enjoy your stay!

I'm a chef. I'm in the process of opening my own restaurant and host pop-ups throughout the city under the name addo ( (Website hidden by Airbnb)  I'm pretty quiet and like listening to music.  I have a pretty extensive cookbook collection so if you like that then feel free to take a look! Looking forward to your stay.

I am the mother of two school aged boys.  My husband and I remodeled our last home and now we're working on this historical farmhouse in Columbia City.  My profile picture shows me with a paint brush in my hand because that's how you'll usually find me!

We are a family of 5 that loves to travel. Our kids are 15, 13 and 8 year old.  We all love to see new places, prefer AirBnBs over hotels (to be in neighborhoods with locals), we are outdoorsy (have to be since we live in Seattle), we enjoying long urban walks.  
We are also Airbnb superhosts that understand and appreciate what it takes to open up your home to travelers.  We always strive to be the best guests.

Fun Loving, good to all people.
We only have one shot at life lets make it the best and not get caught up in selfish details,
Give to others as much as you can with a smile. Trust me it will come back to you later in life the best way.

Веселощі Любий, добре для всіх людей.
Ми маємо лише один постріл у житті, щоб зробити його найкращим і не потрапити в егоїстичні подробиці,
Дайте іншим стільки, скільки ви можете з посмішкою. Довірся, що це повернеться до вас пізніше в житті найкращим чином.
Перрі (Phone number hidden by Airbnb) 
有趣的爱，对所有人都好。

मुस्कुराहट के साथ जितना हो सके उतना दूसरों को दे दो मुझ पर भरोसा करें कि यह आपके जीवन में बाद में सबसे अच्छा तरीका है।

We started hosting people on airbnb because my father is half paralyzed.  We use the money from airbnb to help support him as he cannot support himself. My husband and I love to travel and have always stayed at AIRBNB rentals when we vacationed, so we know what to consider in making our guests feel comfortable. Our goal when traveling was to "live like a local"--shop at the local markets, walk to nearby cafes, restaurants, catch a local live show, and enjoy the nature at each destination we visited. 

When we built our dream home on Alki Beach, we immediately knew we had to allocate a space that would become a future Beach escape for others to enjoy.  We find ourselves enjoying every minute of hosting & one of our favorite aspects of being an AIRBNB host is the ability to meet colorful people from all corners of the world, helping them get acquainted with our communities. It's because of our past travels through AIRBNB that piqued our love for hosting.

In February of 2016, we took a year off work to travel the world, using Paris as our home base and hub to venture off to other parts of Europe, Asia, Australia and New Zealand. We returned home to Alki in February of 2017, and welcomed our daughter that same year. Our second daughter joined our hosting home in 2020, just before the pandemic happened! So we're now on another adventure- hopping between home here in West Seattle and other parts of the world (as Covid will allow). We will be available to you in any manner you please, so just let us know!

I’m not a supporter of the corporate Airbnb businesses that buy up properties as a real estate venture. I host because I always wanted to own a a B&B and realized this was the way for me to fulfill this dream.
