Let me know your favorite local places to eat!

We are Midwest natives, happily living in the Great Northwest for 40 years. Our kids are grown and gone so we've got some room to share! JK is a retired Drama and history teacher and is happy to share about cultural goings on, and local history...but only if you like. We're happy to provide peace and quiet too! We are big Seahawks fans, Theatre lovers, Museum mavens, comfort food connoisseurs and gushing Grandparents. We are entering a new chapter in our story and welcome the chance to meet you and to help make your Seattle stay a great one.
Seattle -> Portland -> Cape Town -> Melbourne -> and back again. Ex baseball player and world traveler with a serious case of wanderlust who loves sharing in the experience.
Seattle Airbnb Host!
We are family medicine physicians working in community health centers.  When we are not working we love to explore new places, particularly the natural beauty of the mountains around Seattle.

I'm an easy going, respectful individual.
Love travel, cooking, reading, playing music.
I like traveling and meeting new people.  My role as a host is to provide you a clean comfortable place to stay.
We're fun-loving folks on the go, and spend much of our time traveling. Hope you like the house as much as we do!

Hi, 
My name is Courtney and often traveling with my husband Eli. We live in Seattle our two aussies Baxter and Bailey and pre-covid we were Airbnb hosts ourselves. 

I love being active and travelling more than anything - hiking, skiing, practicing yoga, adventuring in our converted sprinter van in the PNW to name a few. Travel and work going hand and hand together, Airbnb is one of the best ways I find the greatest places to stay!

Hi, this is Lucky. Our family moved to Seattle few years ago. I love the cultures, history and artifacts here! When I first went to Olympic National Park, it was impressive and I suddenly fall in love with this city. I’m currently live with my dad and brother, we loved to interact with guests, and recommend local restaurants.
We live in Seattle, Washington, where we enjoy raising our two kids, working on our house, and living in the beautiful Northwest.

Hi! We’re Evolve, the hospitality team that helps you rest easy when you rent a private, professionally cleaned home from us.

We promise your rental will be clean, safe, and true to what you saw on Airbnb or we'll make it right. Check-ins are always smooth, and we're here 24/7 to answer any questions or help you find the perfect property.

I was born and raised in the Northwest and have lived in Seattle my entire adult life. My husband and I have raised our kids, work full time and enjoy traveling, entertaining, skiing and paddle boarding.

We enjoy our neighborhood immensely and walk around Green Lake a few times a week as well as enjoy many of the local great restaurants often.

I write historical fiction and love to travel when I can. My husband and I both enjoy discovering the authenticity, history, and hidden gems of a place and live in an old (for Seattle) home ourselves. I love to cook and thus, we also love discovering new flavors and favorites at local restaurants that perhaps the typical tourist wouldn't find. We are fairly tidy, quiet, non-smokers. 
I hope we can stay with you on our next adventure!
You can learn more about me/my writing on my (Email hidden by Airbnb)
I love to travel, and I love hosting fellow travelers

My wife Kaci and I love family, friends and community, traveling, being outside in nature (especially the Pacific Northwest), the sun (when we can find it!), and good food and drink. We became parents in October 2019 to an amazing baby boy, Augustus. I've played rugby all over the world and have become a fan of one of Seattle's newest pro-teams, the Seattle Seawolves Major League Rugby Club! I love cooking and have been working on mastering some Pacific Northwest essentials--grilled cedar plank Pacific Salmon, Dungeness crab, shucked oysters, and pan seared chanterelle mushrooms--Kaci appreciates this!  We love learning, sharing, and traveling/hosting with Airbnb. Look forward to meeting you!

I'm a mum of six, a wife, a friend, a daughter, a laugher, a reader, a music lover and pet parent.  I'm a transplanted Canadian who moved to Seattle for love's sake, and I love my wife, my kids, my pets, my home, my work, and my life.  My vocation is to give courage and hope to exhausted, concerned, frustrated and/or overwhelmed parents, and my daily goal is to get enough sleep.

Adventurous traveler, Karma enthusiast, Coffee aficionado, Bonsaï admirer, Koï lover, Farm to Table evangelist, vinyl record collector.
I am a very independent, relaxed and respectful guest and look for the same qualities when hosting.

What started out as a 300sf studio on Airbnb has turned into a lifestyle. I’ve hosted over 1000 guests across a variety of properties all over the Seattle area and find it very rewarding to have a roll in people’s lives whether they stay for a few days or a few months. Every visit is personal to me and I never get tired of hearing from guests or helping to create a memorable experience while they’re in town.

I've lived in Seattle for over 10 years and love it here! The rain doesn't bother me too much! There is always something fun to do around the city. When I'm not out enjoying the city, I go between being an Optician, Photographer, and the best Airbnb host I can be.
I'm from Washington, like to explore/travel, and love soccer.
I've traveled many times with AirBnb and love the community. Looking forward to hosting people in Seattle!

Hi There! 

Scott's lived in 5 states in the US, but has made Seattle home because of all that the city and surrounding area has to offer. Marcy grew up a hop skip and ferry ride away on Orcas Island.  We love the city because of the balance of community within the city and the close proximity to so many life impacting wild places and experiences.  Most of our time is spent exploring the mountains, forests, and nooks and crannies of the Pacific NW. Our favorite night is to enjoy one of the many good coffee shops Seattle has to offer and then unwinding at a local watering hole.   Scott works for REI building strategy for their experiences offerings that help individuals explore the outdoors and Marcy is a high school math teach. We'd love to help make your experience in Seattle as enjoyable as possible. We look forward to having you as guests to call this place home as well.

Airbnb gives me a chance to meet exceptional people and get to know them as fellow travelers. 

As a Massage Therapist who has her own business, I love to interact with those who come to Seattle and want a different experience than a cold and oftentimes, expensive, hotel stay.  

When I am not doing Massage Therapy at my studio, Healing Touch by Faith, I am working around the house with the various projects that provide those who stay with me a "Home-Away-From-Home" experience. 

When the Seattle weather allows, I love working outside or taking a drive to the local beach area.

The desire is to give guests an experience so they feel at home and to give them a feeling that they can relax in a way that hotels simply can not provide.

My motto for my God-given talent of Massage is, "When you are in pain, the world stops and I listen." It is the same for my guests staying with me; I want to provide a feeling that I listen and will accommodate their needs as an Airbnb Superhost.

Hey, I’m Shirley!
I am excited to be part of this community and to be able to help people feel right at home.
I love exploring the world, learning different cultures and discovering new places.
I am a fan of variety of sports, such as golfing, ski, swimming, snorkeling, diving. I work out every day that keeps me full of energy and strength.
Look forward to making wonderful friendships with people around the globe!
Just a couple traveling and eating!

I am 30 years old and my main goal in life is to travel the world! My friends would say that I am silly, outgoing, respectful, and dependable. I love meeting new people and making new friends. My favorite city in the world is a tie between Toronto, Canada and Dublin, Ireland although NYC and San Francisco are close 2nds. My favorite TV show is Doctor Who.... I want a tardis! My taste in music is very diverse. The only genre of music my playlists lack are country. I love all types of food! I'm a giant foodie! Thanks for checking out my profile and maybe I will see you soon! :)

"this is one corner… of one country, in one continent, on one planet that’s a corner of a galaxy that’s a corner of a universe that is forever growing and shrinking and creating and destroying, and never remaining the same for a single millisecond. And there is so much, so much to see"
-Doctor Who

Hi everyone, my name is don.  I have been a radio broadcaster real estate investor/broker for the last 25 years here in the Pacific Northwest. When I am not broadcasting, you can find me trail running, riding a bike, or teaching a spin class. I also love being a dad, a dog owner, and a builder of cool custom homes.  I can’t wait to share this one I just finished building.  If you have never been to Seattle, feel free to ask me anything.   I can’t wait to host you and your clan in your new home away from home here in Seattle. ~ don

Seattle Vacation Home provides professional quality furnished housing with a personal touch. We offer exceptional value to our visitors by providing high-end accommodations at a reasonable price. We treat our teammates with respect by working in a partnership model and offering above-market pay. We are thoughtful about our impact on our neighbors, our environment, and the city of Seattle.

From Lynne: My family and I are world travelers.  We've traveled to ~60 countries around the world... on all 7 continents!  While we enjoy a fancy hotel now and then, nothing beats the comforts of a real HOME away from home.  Having rented countless vacation homes during our time, we have copious notes of what we do and don't like.  This passion for travel has led us to build Seattle Vacation Home, a collection of more than 40 high-end homes in Seattle that are an example of all the best traits we have found in our vacation rentals.  Whether you are coming to Seattle for vacation, business, relocation, medical treatment, a cruise, a wedding or any other reasons, we promise you a fantastic stay with Seattle Vacation Home.
Placeholder
I'm a big foodie and avid traveler.  I like to learn about the history of places I visit and try new foods.  Music is my passion.  My hobbies are camping, hiking, lake days and exploring new places.

I am a born and bred Jersey girl who packed up and sold her newly purchased home to move to Seattle in January 2015 for a job opportunity.  Even though the job didn't work out it was a move that I have never regretted. Seattle absolutely captured my heart and that job lead me to opportunities here that I never thought possible. I love to travel with my boyfriend Ciaran, we hate being home bodies. More than likely you will find us; camping, hiking, & skiing through the PNW, exploring international destinations, sipping our way through the many wine regions of Washington State, or road tripping through our National Parks #vanlife. We have a 9 year old 15 pound long-haired dapple Dachshund named Charlie Brown. Charlie's favorite things are; cheese, carrots, belly rubs, barking unnecessarily, and lounging in the sun.   I am currently renting out the property to give me a little more financial freedom for our adventures and also to give anyone traveling to Seattle an affordable and comfortable way to explore the city.
Making your Seattle stay special since 2018!  We love to host everyone from all walks of life at our home in Seattle.  You will be welcome!

Hey everyone! My name is Susan, friends call me Sue or Suz! I'm from New Orleans, LA and now live in Seattle. I love visiting new places and eating all the food. :) I am easy-going and very open-minded. I love meeting new people and going on random adventures!!

Jose and I are extremely proud to be Superhosts in AirBnB community. We travel frequently and always stay with Airbnb hosts. From our experience we believe that we know quite well what guests need and what makes them feel right at home while traveling. Please check out our listings and  book with confidence--we will be honored if you "put our service to the test!"  Bon voyage!

I've been an Airbnb Superhost continuously for the last 4 years.  I want my guests to have the best possible experience while traveling and I take pride in offering clean, comfortable, safe, and quiet properties at a good value.

I crave authenticity, sunshine, and solid conversation. I live in beautiful Lake Chelan (Washington state) now and work from wherever. Always hunting for that favorite 'local spot' or activity. Thank goodness for friendly locals, Trip Advisor and Yelp. 

I'm low-key, polite, make friends wherever I go and pack a lot into my trips. When traveling, I aim for a good mix of R&R, culture, nature, active adventures, friendly people and good food. 

My fave spots so far? Love the culture of cities (let's talk London, Nashville, Sydney, Freiburg, Barcelona and NYC), yet love the serenity of the great outdoors. Other faves include the Dalmatian Islands (Croatia), Christmas markets in Germany / Switzerland, Australia (especially Jarvis Bay and Great Barrier Reef zone), Belize, Italy, Spain, Costa Rica, the whole state of California, and the Mexican Riviera (San Pancho, Sayulita, etc.). Oh and anywhere I can paddle board (SUP) or kayak is a place for me. And wine country never hurts!
From Seattle, Washington
Young professional living in Seattle. Global traveler with an appreciation for local street food, craft beers, and a wicked playlist!

I'm a local...... born and raised in Ballard and love the Pacific Northwest. My husband, Charlie, and I have three wonderful grown children and we enjoy  traveling, skiing, biking, wine tasting and the Seahawks! We love meeting people and are excited to share this beautiful villa and location with others.

My wife Arisa and I are a young couple living and working in Seattle. I'm in real estate and Arisa works at Microsoft. We love Seattle, we love finding all of the little, one-of-a-kind places that make the city unique. We met backpacking in Yosemite and and have never looked back. We love to cook, read and hike.

I'm originally from Kentucky, but I moved up to Boston for college and stuck around to work in biotech.  I moved to Seattle late 2016 and have been loving exploring everything in and out of the city! Outside of work, I run a lot, but mainly so I can eat! I love traveling - both alone and with groups of friends - and have most recently been spotted in cafes in Chiang Rai, Istanbul, Montreal, and Taipei.

As a guest, I'm very respectful and responsible; it is your place, after all!
As a host, I'll do my best to make your trip an awesome one!

We are from Washington State where we enjoy fishing, woodworking, camping and spending time with family and friends.  We love to travel near and far.  We love to hear what our guests enjoy about our home town of Seattle.

I own a business and love to travel, alone or with family and friends.   Our business is virtual so my staff and I travel all over the world and stay in all kinds of places - from resorts to hotels to AirBnB's to private homes.  I love to give dinner parties and planning trips are my FAVORITE activity of all!   I love Seattle and love to share it and all of its wonder.  I don't think it is worth doing if it is not FUN!

I am a retired nurse though still working at my small gardening business. I'm an artist, a gardener, a lover of the arts, and a long time Columbia City community resident. I have a cat, a contemplative meditation practice, and spend a fair amount of time engaged with groups working on important issues of our time like climate change, social/racial equity, etc. I've lived in my home and neighborhood for almost 30 years and take pride in my home and garden. It's a beautiful, fun space and I think will be a great setting for Airbnb guests to stay.
Fun, fun, fun yup that's me! I love people and I want to see the world.

Here at our household we are big fans of the outdoors. We especially love to go camping and enjoy our neighborhood beaches, gorgeous parks and postcard-worthy views. I have two beautiful kids and we are always up for an adventure, however, one of our favorite pastimes is to watch the hummingbirds, rainbows, sunrises & sunsets from this haven we call home. We've lived in our neighborhood for over 20 years and just love it here - and are delighted to host others who want to share this excitement and explore this amazing area.

Hi!  My name is Wendy.  I've previously hosted Airbnb guests but recently moved and am just starting up at my new place.  I've lived in Seattle for 9 years and would be happy to show you around if my schedule permits.  In my free time I am involved with a couple non-profits, I play softball, go to plays and musicals, sell used video games as a hobby and enjoy spending time with my friends and furry companions, Fabio & Zoe.  I am also an avid international traveler.

Hi, my name is Chris and welcome to my Airbnb property. I like to initially tell people I  have Cerebral Palsy which causes my speech to slur a bit just in case you speak to me.  I am honored you took the time to check out the space and read my bio! As a 28 year old Seattle native who’s first passion was film, my career path took me from the beautiful PNW to sunny Los Angeles. Currently, my focus lies on my Airbnb properties. With one flourishing in Eastlake, and soon Bozeman, Montana, I hope to expand my business to several desirable vacation destinations. My goal is to both enhance and enrich the guest’s experience by providing the charm of a Seattleite yet the convenience that comes with hotel stays. It’s the best of both worlds when you stay at Justin's & Chris’ Airbnb and it’s my mission to create this personable stay for you!

I moved to Seattle in 2008 from upstate New York.  My wife, Amy, was born  in Seattle and we decided to return "home" when we started our family.  We've chosen this area to raise our three children.  We enjoy the quirky urban lifestyle of Seattle plus the access to the outdoors, especially boating on the Puget Sound and skiing and hiking in the mountains.
I am a Florida native, moved to Seattle 39 years ago.  We have a long history of hosting foreign exchange students, and our family travels all over the world.  We love meeting new people.
I am a Seattle native with deep roots in the Pacific Northwest. I live with my husband and two children and am an Airbnb host. I enjoy reading, boating, playing piano, and adventures with my family.

Seattle urban dweller, traveller, and transit advocate.  Huge fan of many things both low and high brow in the worlds of food, art, and music.  

Like to relax and take in life as it's lived elsewhere rather than chase my tail sight seeing when on vacation.

We are 3 women who love travelling and meeting new people.  We purchased our first home!  We're hoping that you can enjoy our space and have fun in the area, just as we do.  We are long time residents of Seattle and would be willing to share any insights we have about the area if you'd like or can be completely hands-off to allow you to enjoy your stay and privacy.

Your hosts - Bernie, Marilyn, JoAnn

I'm a food, travel, and yoga lover who lives in Beacon Hill Seattle with my wonderful husband, daughter, and son. We love to work in our garden, walk around the neighborhood, and enjoy a glass of wine in the evenings. 

It's hard to choose a favorite travel destination since they all hold a special place in our hearts. Some of our favorite spots have been the Amalfi Coast, Thailand, and Jost van Dyke.

My 5 favorite destinations in Seattle:  Mt Baker to Seward park walk along Lake Washington, Jefferson Park in Beacon Hill, Volunteer Park in Capital Hill, Coleman Pool in Lincoln Park, and downtown near Pike Place Market.

I worked as a photographer at the University of Washington in Seattle for 14 years and love still-photography and shooting video. My husband has been a professional snowboarder for over 20 years, and together we've made over 20 snowboard videos that are enjoyed around the world. This has allowed us to travel the world filming snowboarding and meeting wonderful people. Our favorite place to travel to is Japan! Among the many things we love about Japan is their great bidet toilets with heated seats. We love them so much that we installed one in our own bathroom.

We treat other people's homes with the same care and consideration that we expect from others in our own home. We like to keep things clean and organized but comfortable. No shoes in our house, but a heap of blankets on the couch!
About me: I love getting my hands dirty in the garden, bicycling, traveling, listening to music, painting, visiting friends and family and of course snowboarding!

Kim and I live in northeast Seattle's Wedgwood neighborhood, a few miles north of Univ of Washington.  We are Washington natives and enjoy skiing, boating, and socializing.  We're active in our local church and enjoy flexible work schedules that allow us time for travel.

I grew up in the California Bay area and moved to Seattle in 1985. I was drawn to West Seattle because it reminded me of home.
I have 4 super talented kids ranging from 20- 34. We are all very close. 
My best friend, Tony loves brewing custom beer and reading in the treehouse on the back side of the property. 
I love connecting with people, sharing original recipes, coming up with ideas to make the world a better place. I like the finer things. As a home renovation designer/contractor and artist, I have spent the last 30 years beautifying 100's homes around Seattle. 
I am a real estate broker always helping people find/visualize their favorite place!
Likes good food, good books and good people.
Being a Seattleite for 10 years and still counting. I work in high tech industry and love to meet new people.
Dad/husband in a family of 4. Professional in the healthcare industry.
Proud Mexican living in Seattle.
Canadian dad and husband, working in Seattle.

Hi! I’m a retired nurse who loves traveling and finds Seattle at the top of my list.
Staying in Queen Anne here at the condominium offers safe fun  neighborhood entertainment it is walking distance to Fremont and historic Queen Anne Downtown.
Loves to travel and discover hidden restaurants

Mark and I are one of those couples who met on a dating site when they were quite new. An early success story! Mark crossed the Atlantic to America to join me and my 3 boys! Fifteen years later we are going strong and having fun with our adult children, two grand daughters, Eloise and Ivy, and baby Jackson.
We enjoy walking, hiking, gardening, travel and all that Seattle has to offer.
Mark is an artist (you can see some of his paintings in the guest cottage) and teaches students English from all over the world. I work as a dental hygienist and love my job because of the people I meet. 
Mark and I and the other 2 members of the family, Reg and Shorty, are committed to making your stay at our comfy cottage as enjoyable and relaxing as possible!
Cheers!
I love to travel,I’ve used Airbnb for most of my adult life and love it so much that I’m now sharing my home.

I’m a WA native and and have a passion for the outdoors. I love to climb, hike, and trail run all over the Cascades. I can also be a “homebody” and love to cozy up with a good book or show and be lazy. I’m pretty into good food, and love to cruise into downtown Seattle for the occasional fancy dinner or brunch. Happy to offer recommendations! 

I am a chemist by day at a local biotech company, so I’m pretty detail oriented and thoughtful which shows both as a guest and a host! 

I love meeting new people and introducing them to Seattle and the great things this area has to offer for travelers and adventurers alike.

Seattle/Arlington, City and country person. Love my horses, tennis, outdoor/indoor,  always happy.  Raw food preference, vegetables, organic when possible. Love to stop GMO foods altogether!   Enjoy being with people from all nations. Learning new things, keeping good friends. Sharing information with people who also like to learn and travel, local or abroad.  As a host, I am a very happy person who likes to make people welcome to my city. I can tell the guest about Seattle as I was born here, have lived here all my life.  
Love to provide at least one or more local coffees, fruits or flowers to welcome my quests. Provide a mostly quiet, calm home to relax in or celebrate special occasions in a beautiful city.  I completely respect complete privacy during your stay in my home or am happy to help and answer any questions you may have.
My favorite travel destination was Portugal.  I prefer positive books, movies, and music.
I like to fly but hope to see more of the USA  now, by car, as I am almost retired. 
Would not want to live without love one to another.
From Seattle, also an Airbnb host.

My family is Italian and I grew up in Portland, Maine, fishing off of the sides of lighthouses and lobstering with my fathers friends. I have lived all over the US in NYC, Chicago, Los Angeles and currently Seattle where I run a research lab and head a center that studies the 100 trillion bacteria that reside in our gut (the microbiome).

 I love to travel and have been all over the world. Some of my favorite places have been the Maldives, Rwanda, the Seychelles, Bora Bora and hiking Kilimanjaro.

Born and raised in the Pacific Northwest.

I am easy going and energetic. I love to travel, try new experiences, and meet new people. I am interested in trying new foods, listening to new music, and introducing myself to new cultures. There is nothing I won't try once.

I love to play sports, get outdoors, and stay active. Healthy and happy living!
I am a Bay Area native and my happy place is outside. I am always eager to exploring and discovering new places, people and ideas.

A resident of Seattle and Bellevue for over thirty years, I enjoy traveling both solo and with friends and family especially where there is good food and aesthetic beauty.   I'm a Financial Controller at a local biotech and during my off-time enjoy photography, cooking and working on home projects.  As a new Airbnb host, I welcome feedback on how to make my place a more perfect stay for you.

We live and work in West Seattle (school librarian and fire fighter) and love to travel as much as possible! We are also foodies and love the new restaurants popping up in our neighborhood. In the summertime, we can be found hiking and camping in the great Northwest or reading in the backyard!

Love to travel, eat, dance, play. I practice and teach yoga. Offering Reiki treatments and life coaching are also part of what I do. I love Seattle and the neighborhood I live in AND getting out as much as possible to explore the world. I speak some French in addition to English and hello/goodbye/thank you in a bunch of languages. :-)

I love hosting and meeting people from all over the US and the world!  It's almost as fun as traveling myself, which I also love!  I love to meet my guests when they are open to that, and I am also happy to leave people on their own when they prefer their privacy-
There are so many great restaurants in Seattle- if my guests want recommendations, I am happy to share!

I'm a 30 year Seattle resident with three children and three bonus children.  I love my city and hope you will too! I'm happy to share touring and restaurant tips!  Before children, I worked and lived in Prague, Czech Republic and Cambridge, England.  I love to travel and pretty much drop everything when the opportunity to travel presents itself to anywhere in the world.  My husband and co-host, Abdoulaye, is from Dakar, Senegal. He goes by Abu.  He speaks Wolof (Senegal!), French and some German if you would like to converse with him.  We really pride ourselves on offering you an EXCELLENT stay. Our hobbies are travelings, culture and the arts, history, hiking and exploring, and eating. I volunteer with Northwest Immigrants Rights Project, a non-profit close to my heart.
My wife and I are Choreographers and Directors of a Dance Company and School. We love the outdoors and traveling to new places. Family time is our favorite time.

Living in Seattle, I enjoy the mists, rains, and occasional sun of the Pacific Northwest. When not lost in the books, or in the coffee shops, I'm aimlessly exploring the boundaries of reason by co-hosting a podcast "Always Now and Yet Again". Where my friend and I go on a pointless quest of making a point about culture, technology, design and things in between.
Irish born. Love the outdoors and traveling.

I am in my early 40s and I work in UX Design and Research.  I am a Seattle native and love living in the Pacific Northwest!  I can be found hiking, paddle-boarding, yoga-ing, cooking, searching out craft cocktails, dancing to live music out on the town or packing for burning man.
Easy going queer living in Seattle. Love it out here! I also enjoy exploring new places and having a good time.
Married husband of two children ages 12 and 14

Hi! I am a Seattleite (15 years) who works in business development for a technology company. I love taking care of my Queen Anne home - built in 1926 - and sharing it with others during their visits to the PNW.

I grew in the PacNW and now live in the Montlake neighborhood with my wife and 6 year old son. My wife and I are both sales professionals in the tech industry and medical field. Living in the Northwest, I am amazed everyday at the beauty of this city. There are not many cities where you can hike, ski, boat all within minutes from each other. I love to enjoy the outdoors with my family and especially love being on the water. In the summer time you will always find me on the water either on our boat, fishing or water skiing. In the winter, you will find me in the mountains skiing with my son and snowboarding. 

I am also a foodie with a love for amazing food and good wine. Being in Seattle, we are very fortunate to have both. 

Above all, my first and real love is my family. We love spending time together and taking trips. My wife's family is back east in Philadelphia, when we are not seeing them we do love to take long weekend trips to the San Juan Islands or down to Napa Valley wine country. 

My hope along with my wife is that anyone that stays with us can appreciate and truly see what beauty this city has to offer and we hope that they get to experience a little of it while staying with us. We hope that it all starts with our home and sharing it with you.

We have been active superhosts on AirBNB for many years and love traveling and meeting people around the world. Our family loves adventure and all sorts of outdoor activities.  If you need recommendations on where to hike or things to do around town, please let us know.  We are also happy to make dinner and other suggestions to make your trip memorable.
I am an avid cyclist and skier. My husband grew up in Seattle and I moved here 15 years ago. I love the Pacific Northwest and we spend a lot of time in the outdoors with our GSD name Bella.

I'm an animator, creator, designer, film maker, and DJ. I like to work hard and play hard. I have lived in Seattle for two decades and am excited to recommend some places for you to visit as well as share my partner's and my nightclubs and restaurants with you. I work full time in the outdoor industry as well and will happily tell you about some of the Northwest's natural gems.
Seattle family
Creative professional that enjoys spontaneous adventures, great spaces,  and good food.

I was born in Seattle and this is my childhood home. Seattle has changed a lot over the last few decades and our neighborhood in particular has seen intense growth. We love our old house and our community and wanted to find a way to share that with visiting guests. We built our guest house in 2019. Since then we have hosted people from all over the world.

Due to our location we meet people visiting seattle for the first time, parents visiting UW students and people coming in for medical care. We love to travel on Airbnb and have great experiences so its great to host people in return, offering the same expected level of service. 

I am an avid gardener, reader, bike rider and food enthusiast. I know Seattle very well and can provide ideas for activities and restaurants in the area. 

I hope to host your stay in our beautiful city.
Colette
meticulous hot mess hospitality enthusiast,  i live to make your stay so awesome that you'll never wanna leave. Your satisfaction is my guarantee!

We both work in the medical field as physician assistants and enjoy living in the thriving neighborhood of Beacon Hill. With our two boys, we love exploring Seattle and all it’s surrounding natural beauty whether by kayaking, hiking, mountain biking or just playing at the park. We recently remodeled this space specifically for an Airbnb suite
Avid world traveler!

My name is Rachel and I am in the business of helping people from all walks of life 'realize' their real estate dreams, no matter how big or small! Whether it's helping a first time homebuyer or someone like you who may be looking for the perfect space for that much needed weekend getaway, I'm happy to hit the pavement to find the perfect place that fits your needs.  

The Swanky Sexy B Treehouse was my first custom built home and I definitely designed with my favorite things in mind. I wanted a warm and cozy place of solitude with a great kitchen for cooking, an open space for entertaining/dining with family and friends that also had LOTS & LOTS of natural light.  This home has provided all of these things and then some for myself and the many others who have stayed here in the past.  If this is the type of space and energy that makes you FEEL and brings you happiness, it brings me as much happiness to be able to share it with you...and that's real talk!

After booking, guests of the Sexy B Treehouse will receive a code to access the home.  Instructions for wifi, cable tv, dishwasher, etc will be inside waiting for you. Basics such a shampoo, body wash, towels, coffee, sugar, spices (of course) will be provided as well as an empty growler or two should you want to try out any of the local breweries.  Your stay is all about you enjoying your time. Although I'm just a short 5 minutes away, I'll only contact you if you request it or if I have the misfortune of receiving a complaint from one of your neighbors.

My life motto: 'If you put good out into the world, you'll get good in return.'  Let's be good to each other good people and here's to your 5 Star experience at the Swanky Sexy B Treehouse!
All about any adventure related to the water, wind and sun. Eager to host happy people who love life.

This is the time in my life I have been waiting for. After raising my wonderful children, ending a 25 marriage, and selling our family home I am free to travel our wonderful planet. With Airbnb’s springing up all over the world I will be able to afford first class accommodations. 

I am also a host and have the pleasure of hosting guests from many interesting places. It has been a lot of fun.

I have been hosting for more than 2 years now and enjoy having guests from not just the U.S. but all over the world. I have had guests from Europe, South America, Japan, Hong Kong, Taiwan, China, Korea, Thailand, Singapore, Vietnam, etc. Most (if not all) of the guests I have met are very friendly and they really like Seattle. I like to listen to inputs from my guests to improve the place and make it more enjoyable for my guests.

I have lived in the Pacific Northwest for over 25 years.  I love everything about Seattle, the great outdoor scene, four seasons and the perfect summer months.  

I strive to provide the absolute best hosting experience for my guests.

I grew up in Europe and moved to Seattle in 1989. I have been a resident of Queen Anne for over 25 years. I couldn't be more pleased with this fantastic neighbourhood and city. I am a retired architect and mother of two amazing grown children. During my professional practice I travel around the world, designed projects, met new people, and experienced different cultures.  I hope this description tells you a bit about who I am and what I enjoy most about Seattle!

My husband Matt and I married over 20 years ago and lived in several states across the country. We love experiencing new towns and cultures, enjoy meeting new people and spending time with friends, and we really love hosting in beautiful Seattle.  

Matt is a professor who works from our home office, so he is often available to assist with guest questions or needs.  I'm a Research Administrator in the South Lake Union neighborhood.  Two of our 3 children still live at home, but they are often out enjoying their busy teenage lives (lots of soccer!).

As guests we are quiet and respectful. We enjoy exploring and are quite active, so we tend to be out and about most of the time.  Julie in particular really appreciates home-cooked meals and loves being able to travel with a kitchen.
I'm a middle aged professional with a home in Seattle WA. I have a small dog named Peaches. She does not shed. I travel for pleasure.
I am a retired Montessori teacher, an avid traveler, a fan of Shakespeare, and enjoy gardening.  It has been a pleasure adding hosting AirBnB guests to my "hobbies".

My husband Bob and I live in a 1908 Craftsman home in Seattle.  We've been in the wine business for 30 years, having escaped the corporate world to squander our fortunes on good wine, food and travel.  As both AirBnB hosts and travelers, we understand hospitality. In the end, it's all about meeting great people. We look forward to meeting you.

Both my husband, Greg and I are Seattle natives and grew up in this beautiful city. We have two wonderful school aged children. I can also speak Cantonese and a little bit of Mandarin but cannot write in Chinese. We look forward to hosting you in our home!
Retired

Hi Seattlite here! 

I love sharing my city with people! Frequent traveler and a big fan of walking tours. Love travel as it really helps you learn more about the world

Just a dyslexic trying to provide clean affordable places to stay. So forgive my grammar, but always here to help. Seattle is an expensive place, but in that context, I try to price my places to be affordable. I’m not selling a luxury apartment, but rather a clean and ecologically friendly one that always  look just like the photos. :)

We are a family of four from Seattle.  We like urban travel and are looking forward to meeting new people from all over the world.  We speak multiple languages having spent a fair amount of time abroad.

Hi! I'm Giselle! I work in the technology industry and I am based in Seattle, WA with my husband and 2 daughters. I love to explore new places and try new cuisines.  

My family and I are transplants to Seattle. We came to Seattle 6 years ago from New York and we fell in love with the salty sea air, evergreen trees and decided to stay and make it our home! We love hosting groups at our home- creating a home away from home is our specialty!

Hola, a mi esposa y a mi nos gusta el folklore mexicano.  We have two beloved little ones- one biped and one quadruped.  

We like to travel, and we've had only good experiences as Airbnb guests. Andrea and I began hosting Summer 2018.

My motto is: "God, grant me the serenity to accept the things I cannot change, courage to change the things I can, and the wisdom to know the difference". Andrea's motto is, "Take care of yourself so you can take care of others”.

I'm the full service owner of this 5 star panoramic view home.  I always have time for my guests.  Ask me what you would like to do in Seattle and allow me to extend to you my many years of local knowledge.  There is so much to do in this beautiful city!

Upon booking I will provide you with my own personal recommendations for where to eat, what to see and where to go while in Seattle. Whoever stays here will truly appreciate the amenities and location.
Chicago | Seattle; host and traveler; passionate about hospitality, learning, and outdoor recreation.

Lived in Seattle for 8 years now after coming back to the Pacific North West from NYC. Love this city and I'm sure you will too. As much as possible I like spending time on the water; wake-boarding and surfing, skiing in the winter, and always looking for a  new craft-cocktail bar surrounded by friends. Looking forward to meeting new people by sharing my Townhouse with Seattle Travelers.
Working in sustainability consulting and enjoy getting out of the corporate hotel scene. Definitely not a morning person, though I stay pretty quiet at night!

I am a university professor. I like art, reading, hikes, movies, theater, music, photography and cooking.

I moved to Seattle 12 years ago. I love the vibrant, inclusive and civic-minded culture of the city. This most beautiful, clean and safe port-city surrounded by majestic mountains and tranquil lakes is now home.

Friends are a critical part of my life. I have traveled widely, like to see new places and make new friends.

My husband and I are both full-time working professionals living in the West Seattle North Admiral neighborhood. We enjoy active lifestyle and all the outdoor opportunities that Pacific Northwest has to offer, including mountain biking, paddle boarding, hiking. We have a garden and enjoy fresh produce from our backyard in summer. We also love traveling and exploring new places worldwide. We have recently completed a full remodel of our 1930s Tudor house part of which includes a daylight basement separate entrance studio suite.

Hi, I'm Sam, a professional drummer, percussionist, music teacher, and Airbnb Superhost.  For about 15 years I've been touring the world playing music.  I also love to travel for leisure as much as possible. 

Historic homes, design, good lighting, carpentry, landscape architecture... these are things I've fallen in love with as a homeowner.  I've poured years of love into this 1926 Craftsman and I love sharing it with guests.

I'm from Peru and I was living in Australia for nearly 8 years. I arrived to Seattle 2015. I enjoy experience different culture and discovering new places! 
I love cooking different kind of foods, I can prepare delicious Peruvian, Thai and sushi food!
I enjoy eating fresh and I start enjoying gardening.

I am originally from the island of Mauritius, and have lived in Washington state for the past 30 years. I understand the importance of arriving from afar to find a comfortable relaxing secure place to rest and vacation, having traveled around the world collecting personal ideas of making your stay as carefree as possible.  I look forward to hosting you in my rental home and will do my best to offer you a wonderful experience. Marjo
I love cooking and trying new foods, really I just love food! I'll be happy to tell you about my beautiful city and all the wonders it holds!

I am an architect, who took on the restauration of this house several years ago with the intent to preserve its history and complement it with a few modern touches. This house seats within a rich history of well-crafted houses and is surrounded by a bounty of lakes and rivers all situated in the  unique beauty of a 5000 square miles of a Natural Park: the Adirondacks.

Hi,

Welcome to Montlake House.  My wife  Rachael and I have been married for 15 years and have  lived here in Seattle for most of our lives.  We are both interior designers and love all eras of design.

Hello,

I'm French and I've lived in Seattle US for a few years. I'm a Software Engineer for one of the tech giants in the area. The house has 3 room. I live in one of them and Dan lives in the other as full time roommate. He is super chill and works as an art installer. We like AirB&B to be an experience beyond the hotel and want to meet new people from all over the world.

We eat organic and love to cook. We have a very green life style and always like to make it greener. If you stay with us you'll have to learn to compost ;)

Nicolas.
Melody
Loving life. Enjoy spending time with family and friends. Traveling is a passion. Seeking out new adventures around the globe.  Motto-Work hard. Play harder.

I'm not really a Captain of anything other than my soccer team.  I am on an unexpected voyage in life .  I decided  to get my house  ship shape and set a new course for Airbnb.    I've had rentals before both in Seattle and Montana, but not on Airbnb.  I look forward to making a  welcoming space for travelers of any distance and to making new friends.  I like to find out the things that people feel the most passionate about.

I am a mid 30s career traveler from seattle washington. 

I love visiting friends and family.   I usually travel with my wife.  She's in hotels and I am  an airline pilot so we know what it's like to deal with the general public and try our best to be gracious to all our hosts.  She and I leave your place clean for the next guest!

We are both light drinkers and noise is never a problem..

Most of our trips we just like to take our time to explore a new city!

i love living in Seattle.  i grew up in the mid-west but the Pacific North West has always felt like home.  i am a mom to 3 beautiful kids, love playing tennis, cooking, reading and being with friends and family.  i manage a few long-term rental properties as well as consult and manage AirBnB properties for those living in the Seattle area.
My husband and I are both Engineers. We love travelling around the world!
I enjoy hiking as much as possible in the PNW, drinking red wine, and raising my fur-child Charlie with my husband Geoff!

I love to run, bike and travel around this beautiful world. When we are not traveling, we look for fun adventures around town,  enjoy walking to coffee shops and leaving doughnut shop reviews. “Leave this Earth a little better than you found it”

I am an artist with a day job and a long-time resident of this neighborhood.  We   purchased this property in 2000 and have been fixing it up ever since. We hope to have lots of happy guests add many good memories to its 100 year history.

Hi, I’m Jeralyn. Welcome to our Home. I was born and raised in the Philippines. I’ve live here into the US since 2003. I started living in Fairfield Ca. I’ve moved here in Seattle wa. Since 2009. Then I found a job in one of the fishing boat up in Alaska owned by American seafoods company. The boat fishes, catches and processes fish in Bering sea, and destined to met my husband Jared.

I’m outgoing, friendly and meeting people all over the world.

I love cooking our special meal Philippines adobo. Doing fun activities with my kids like baby music class, indoor play and going to the beach and park. 

Can’t wait to meet you and share our home to you. Mabuhay!

Hi! We are a multiracial and multicultural couple hailing from 南京/New York and Padova/Chicago! We love traveling and meeting new people, and we are all about good food and coffee.
We have made Seattle our home and are excited to share it with you all.

We believe that ones appearance should not limit their experiences in life so we request that all guests in our home be respectful of others no matter what race, gender, religion, age or class they appear!

My husband, Ben, and I are a world travelers.  We like to run, bike, swim, and hike.  Our favorite pass time is to spend time with friends and enjoy life as much as possible. We'd like to welcome you to our little stay.
We are a very happy couple that love to travel when we can. We try to do everything  possible to give you a Memorable experience of your time in Seattle.

I work for a international health organization and love to travel. The lodging I choose is often a huge part of my travel experience so I wanted to design this space as a great entryway to and respite from all there is to engage with in Ballard, Fremont and greater Seattle.  I hope you enjoy it!
I'm from Seattle and love sharing my city and home with fellow travelers.

I'm a scientist, homebrewer and mom.  I've lived in Seattle for 25+ years and love the urban enviroment with ready access to nature.  I love all things outdoor including camping, hiking, backpacking, gardening, skiing, paddleboarding and biking.  We also have a house in Bend, Oregon and love spending time there doing both warm and cold weather outdoor activities.  Our family also thrives on travelling, and most recently visited the Yucatan peninsula.  I look forward to hosting you, and am committed to doing whatever it takes to make your trip a success!

We're committed to making you're stay fantastic.  You won't be disappointed.  

Thanks for taking a look!

I am a semi-retired teacher who loves that moment when the light of true understanding pops on in my students. It's a beautiful exciting moment. I love nature, rambling walks with no destination, and most of all, cooking. Creative concoctions, cooking shows, and kitchen chaos...honing my culinary skills is my happy place. You will likely find little samples of these kitchen escapades upon your arrival. I also love traveling, anywhere, anytime. Architecture, whether constructed by humans or formed in nature, I am fascinated by both.  I am also curious about how people go about their days and make adjustments based upon climate and landscapes. Enough about me, now I'd like to know a bit about you......
I am a retired registered nurse who has enjoyed creating a welcoming home and garden to share with friends and family.
My husband, Tito, and I enjoy music, art, good food and hanging out with friends and family. We’re musicians and play in a band together. We love living in Seattle.

I work at a nonprofit that develops and supports leaders for the nonprofit sector. My partner works with the teachers’ union after teaching fourth grade for several years. We have two kids, ages 5 and 2. Besides hanging out with our kids, we watch a lot of TV (Game of Thrones, Breaking Bad, Kimmy Schmidz, Jessica Jones, Golden Girls).

I am a visual artist and accidental developer. I try to remember to approach even the most mundane errands at home with the same sense of adventure I have when I travel.
I love my neighborhood, Pioneer Square, where I've lived and/or worked for over years. If you are my guest, I will happily share my favorite tips for quirky local adventures.

I work full-time as a Consumer Insights Manager, in Bellevue area. 
I am originally from Brazil and my husband from Germany, we've been married for 8 years, and have a 3 year old boy. We like to explore new places, experience new things and make new friends!
I am a professional working in Seattle for 6 years, have fallen in love with this city.

I am an artist who partners with my husband in rehabilitating older homes of Seattle.  Born and raised here,  Seattle and I grew up together.  Favorite destinations when traveling are museums and city parks.  My husband is a voracious reader of fiction,  though I'll tend to flip through a magazine and watch a movie. Our kids are becoming adults and we're happy to enter a new phase of freedom through their independence.
Long time Seattle native and avid traveler. I am more than happy to share my love of Seattle to you all :)

I am a West coast native, born in California, raised in Hawaii and the Pacific Northwest. My travels are for family, vacation, business or some combination of the above.

I've been using Airbnb for some time and greatly appreciate the hospitality the platform encourages.
Hey I’m Chris. German / Irish / American. Enjoy philosophy, physics, cooking, photography, wine dancing (poorly) and spending time with my nephew.

I moved to Seattle from Berkeley in 1987 and finally fell in love with Seattle when I began homeschooling my kids.  We homeschool for middle school and have a blast exploring the Northwest! 

I lived in the 'Freelard' (Fremont/Ballard) house until I was pregnant with my second child, it is a sweet place to live and I'm happy to share it and the neighborhood with you.  

I've enjoyed being a guest at some Airbnb's and know what guests want--a CLEAN, comfortable, safe place in a great location.  The great thing is that Airbnb provides both space and a neighborhood you just don't get in a hotel.

Hope you enjoy my place and don't hesitate to ask me questions.

My name is Carrie and I have been an avid traveler most of my life. I used to work in international education and am now raising my two little boys. I love the Greenwood neighborhood and Seattle and enjoy introducing others to my favorite places in the area. I love trying new foods, learning languages, and getting to know people from all over the world. I also really enjoy cooking, cycling, hiking, and snow skiing.

I'm a Pacific Northwest native and have lived in Seward Park for 28 years.  We love living in Seward Park surrounded by parks, the lake and mountain views along with the small town feel Columbia City brings.

Having lived in Singapore, France, Taiwan, London, Philadelphia, and Los Angeles, we now live in beautiful Seattle. In each city we live in, we love to discover restaurants, parks, and interesting neighborhoods (usually by bike). Arthur is a professor in housing finance, Jessica is a clinical case manager, and our baby Linden is a budding world traveller. 

We look forward to making travel accessible to all through Airbnb!
I am a mountain guide and photographer.

Hello, we live in Seattle with our miniture Golden Doodle Sheena.  We are avid travellers and love hosting vacation rental guests from across the world in our rentals in Seattle and Arizona.  We're helped out by local hosts in each location so that we can provide you high quality customer service around the clock either over the phone or in person.  We hope you enjoy staying in our home and safe travels!

Ask about our concierge services!  We can do anything from ordering a private chef to stocking your fridge during your visit.

I'm Bill, husband is Justin and son is Benjamin. We enjoy traveling extensively throughout the world, Europe and South America are our favorite places internationally. We have yet to visit a country that we don't want to stay longer in. We also really enjoy traveling throughout the United States and Canada, as it's incredibly diverse. Often our travels takes us to places where we can hike, run and mountain bike.

When not traveling we host an Airbnb in Seattle, called the Metal Box, it's a cute one bedroom mother-in-law unit. We enjoy meeting our guests and sharing Seattle and the Pacific Northwest with our visitors.

I was born in Hamburg, Germany and grew up in Portland, Oregon. After living on the East Coast and in France, Germany and Italy for 12+ years I returned to the lovely Northwest where I work as a full-time visual artist and jewelry designer.

Epicure, raconteur, bon vivant, hommes des artes et sciences, I am but a humble soul. (Does anyone really read these things?)
I live with my husband, two cats, and an adorable doodle named Zoya in the 'burbs.

I am a former high school teacher, of history and English. I've taught in public schools in Seattle, and in France and Italy in Kenya and Tanzania before that. Former yoga teacher and coach.  Now, my son has grown so I am travelling about and renting out my place during my trips to help cover expenses...

My family extends throughout the world, including Africa, Asia, New Zealand, Europe, California, Hawaii and our favorite location, Alaska.  Many of us are Seattle natives, with some Alaskans sprinkled in.  Seattle is beautiful, thanks to Puget Sound, the Olympic and Cascade mountains and all of the terrific scenery that is so close to access.  We love to share our city

We have always hosted friends and family from all over the world.  Travel encourages new ideas, the sharing of cultures and an increased appreciation for how interconnected we all are and how special our world is.  This is why we share our space, energy and friendship. 

Our family has built a dedicated unit that can offer a place for world travelers and neighborhood friends .  We are excited to extend the offer of friendship and hospitality to those we don’t yet know and give them an opportunity to see Seattle and beyond.

Our world will get stronger and healthier by learning and laughing with each other, developing relationships and understanding we all belong to one tribe.

Welcome to Eureka House. I enjoy building and improving houses. This house was a big project when we got it, and we're continuing with more improvements. My philosophy is that you never get it wrong because you never get it done. Life is an endless improvement project. We are geeks and named this house after one of our favorite SyFi  Channel TV shows called Eureka.

Dad, surfer, hiker, all around nice person. 

Favorite destinations: Sayulita, Hawaii, LA, SF, Austin, Provence, London, Hong Kong, Melbourne, Prague, Budapest, Amsterdam. Would like to get to Denmark, Poland, and Fiji before too long.

My approach as a guest and host is to leave things as I found them and to enjoy my space and let others enjoy theirs.

I am a long term resident of Seattle and it would be my honor to enable you to 'live like a local.' 

There is something to be said about the feeling where you feel like you are living in the city as opposed to visiting. I first got a taste of 'living like a local' with traveling overseas over 10 years ago, and thanks to the Airbnb 'phenomenon' I am now able to share that feeling with all my guests.

My goal is that every guest will enjoy a wonderful and unique travel experience!

Hello there! My wife, Jennie, and I are excited to share what we love about Seattle with you. I am a Washington native (grew up in Eastern WA) and have lived in Seattle for >15 years. Jennie is from VA and spent 9 years overseas living in Phnom Penh, Cambodia and Madrid, Spain with a year of travel in Europe, Central America, and SE Asia. Between the two of us we have a lot of experience both being guests and hosting so we hope we've thought of everything to make your stay great! If not, we are very open to feedback and will respond quickly to any queries you have. The room has a private keypad entrance so we can be hands-on or -off hosts, as you prefer.

A few more things about us - we both played rugby (but our bodies have told us to stop...) and currently enjoy crossfit for exercise. We have a four year old so if you have a kiddo we have lots of suggestions for fun things to do with the family.

Debbie's favorite travel memory: two weeks in Peru exploring the Amazon and climbing Rainbow Mountain

Jennie's favorite travel memory: fly fishing and cobra hunting in Thailand
I love to travel and would go almost anywhere at least once... every place has it’s good and bad and it’s up to the traveler to find them.
UW professor

We are retired Seattleites who are excited to share our home with you. We spend most of our time with our grand children and love taking road trip to Eastern Washington and Oregon. We love relaxing at the ocean and flying kites with the grandkids. Some other activities we enjoy include fishing, hiking, golfing, camping and hosting family and friends for a good old barbeque. We hope you enjoy your stay as we have worked hard to create an inviting space for you.

Living in Seattle and working full time at a busy tech job, but love to travel and meet new people whenever possible. Love music of all genres, trying new restaurants, and experiencing other cultures. Favorite destinations that I've been to: Prague, Lyon, Sydney, and Berlin.

Hi, I’m MightyHeidi
Joined in 2018  ·  Edit profile
I'm creative energy, always looking at life as a glass half full when its wine even better! I enjoy entertaining friends, family, and being an outstanding host has been my personal joy; l love sharing my city and advising fun spots to eat, local hikes, or secret beach spots. I Live to create-Interior Design -Retail Design-Jewelry Design to thneeds... (Dr. Seuss term "A fine-something-that all -people need" Retail is where my design knowledge was developed as a Visual Designer/ Creative Director for the Bon Marche/ Macy's Northwest for 20 years evolving into a Mannequin Designer and sales rep traveling 2 weeks out of the month at 5-star accommodations gave me the experience of what a seasoned traveler needs...Clean, Quiet, Peace, Positive Energy Good Wifi an honor bar with special touches.
