MightyHeidi

I love to travel. My little dog, who found us on a Mexican beach 4 years ago, often comes with. Together him, my partner Ermanno, and I have traveled all over. We enjoy meeting new people, being active, biking in all forms, learning new things, long walks, and nature.
Seattle local in love with the city. I love meeting new people and showing off the city:-)
Mom, grad student, world explorer, lover of dogs, horses, food, swimming, art, and music.
I am a New York City native who has lived in Seattle for the past 14 years. I teach at the University of Washington, love speciality coffee, and enjoy riding my electric bicycle!
interior designer + indoor plant shop owner living in seattle

I'm a journalist and I love to explore new cities and meet new people. I telecommute as an investigator during the day, so I spend a lot of time on my laptop. When I'm not writing, I like to make time for yoga, beaches, shopping, coffee and wine.

A citizen of the world and love to stay in other hosts' homes while travelling, I also enjoy sharing my homes to visiting guests. I have a great team that I trust to provide my guests with the best accommodation and services. Come over and welcome to your home away from home!

We moved to Seattle 9 years ago and continue our love for this city. We recently discovered West Seattle and fell in love with the area so decided to relocate from our previous home in Seattle. We have 4 grown children, none of them live at home. Amy works all day in healthcare and Ian is an adjunct professors at UW and does consulting. He is home most days and available should you need anything. We enjoy meeting new people but also respect people’s privacy. You guide how much if any, interaction you would like. We looking forward to making your stay wonderful !
I love music. I play violin, compose and perform locally. I love to improvise and draw on my studies of East Indian, gypsy jazz, blues, rock, classical and bluegrass.

Hi there! I'm Brandon- a Midwest native who has been living in Seattle over the past 5 years enjoying the best things the pacific northwest has to offer. I'm an Architect full time while I'm not running my Airbnb business and hope to host you! I hope you can appreciate the care I've put into my Airbnb spaces and for you to enjoy them while you travel :)
Love to travel. Will treat your home as if it were mine. Respectful of house rules and will keep it clean! Also a host! I love meeting people from different places! #hostesswiththemostess
I'm a teacher and a carpenter and travel back and forth between Seattle, WA and Black River Falls, WI a ton.

Hi everyone and welcome to my city! I have lived here most of my life except for some time spent studying and working abroad in Germany. I also lived for a time in Ellensburg, in central WA State and Bellingham near the Canadian border studying. My educational background is in anthropology and german language. I really enjoy meeting people from all parts of the world and cultures. I also love to travel when possible! When I was in Germany I lived in West Berlin with an exiled East German family and I did lots of trips to the GDR which was one of the best experiences of my life.  I gained a new knowledge of how my country is viewed by another part of the world and made incredible friends that I still have decades later. 
Now I help people buy and sell homes to help them make big changes in their lives. It is a very rewarding career. And hosting with AirBnB is a way to meet many new people which is the next best thing to travelling! 
Also I love fixing up old houses and sometimes old cars and boats! I am quite the tinkerer so if you need some help fixing something on your trip please ask, ha!
Looking forward to meeting you,
Bobby

Vacasa
Vacation Home Management

Vacasa unlocks the possibilities of how we enjoy vacation homes. We take care of managing our homeowners’ vacation houses so they can have peace of mind (and their home when they want to). And our guests book vacations confidently knowing they’re going to find exactly what they’re looking for without any surprises.

Each vacation home is always cared for by our professional local teams who implement our high cleanliness and maintenance values, while the hands-off tasks of vacation rental management--marketing, filing taxes, and maintaining a website--are handled by a specialized central support team. Our passion and focus remain true: to empower our homeowners, guests, and employees to invest in vacation.
A Seattle girl who loves to travel! I've been to 56 countries to date, although that will change soon enough!
Hi there!

I love to travel and when I do I want clean, comfortable, easy and safe accommodations.  I strive to provide the same for my guests and am also happy to make recommendations of places to go, places to eat, neighborhood favorites, public transit options and things not to miss.

Since the COVID-19 pandemic I am only accommodating 1 guest in each bedroom so that a guest is only sharing the bathroom with 1 other person.

Decide if you want a queen size or double bed. 
If the double bed will suit you book Queen Anne Gem Cozy. 
If you want the queen size bed book Queen Anne Gem Comfy.

I'm a Montana native, I love to eat tapas, and I'm a musician.  He's a California native, a musician, and loves to eat tapas.  We love riding bikes, and feel very fortunate to live in a city as beautiful as Seattle.
Hello! Welcome to Seattle. I like going on adventures year round. By day, I'm an engineer who loves tinkering and building things.

Geoff is a well traveled finance guy.  Bryn is an award winning science writer.  After 10 years in New York City, we now spend most of our time in the pacific northwest with our beloved pup, Piper.  We have strong ties to NYC, and spend as much time there as we can.  Piper would love to be a world traveler, but gets to go to a doggie dude ranch instead, while we travel.   We are art collectors, gardeners and foodies.  We particularly like connecting to local cultures through visits to food markets, funky shops and taking cooking lessons.  

We have traveled extensively through out Central and South America.  Homestays in Guatemala (where we practice our rusty Spanish), hiking Torres del Paine in Chile, hiking the Inca Trail in Peru and snorkeling with the Galapagos penguins are highlights.  We've spent considerable amounts of time in SouthEast Asia...love Cambodia.  

We are energetic.  But being in our 40's we consider ourselves mellow travelers who appreciate connecting with the energy of the places we visit rather than racing from museum to museum.  We particularly appreciate hotels and flats with well thought out spaces with a soothing vibe. 

We consider ourselves excellent house guests, as we are respectful, friendly, quiet and super neat.

I am a mom with a professional career who enjoys travelling and meeting new people from around the world. We are a trilingual family speaking English, French and Spanish. My favorite destination is the South of France. 

My motto is to live with compassion, see the good in others and avoid judging. It's also to find humor in all little absurdities of life.

Hi there, I'm Al.  I was born and raised in Seattle, WA, the sunny city...JK more like the rainy city  :)). 
My family and I, we like to travel around the world and also do some hosting as well in our hometown of Seattle.

I am a dancer, teacher, and choreographer living between San Francisco and Seattle. I travel a lot for work, performing on the sides of mountains, buildings, and structures all over the world (yep, that's right!). I adore my job but hate to leave my beautiful homes. . . so this is where YOU come in. Please enjoy it for me while I am gone!

Hi my name is Seth and I love to travel around the US and abroad.  I work as a real estate agent in Seattle.  I came here from my home town of Indianapolis and fell in love with the Seattle on vacation in 2011.  I packed my bags and moved from Indy as soon as I graduated college in 2012.  I still love living here, and I hope you'll have some of the same fun experiences I had!!!
We are couple 55+. When we travel, we are looking for an accomodation in quiet, nice place. We want our guests to find the same when they visit Seattle.

Welcome to the beautiful Ravenna/Maple Leaf/Green Lake  neighborhood! We have a cozy, modern , updated room to share ! 

I look forward to my guests having all the comforts of home!  My home as lots of ammenities, including beautiful landscaped yard,  gormet kitchen, very peaceful.. I look forward to you as a guest!
   Also, I have a sweet dog , Mindi, and two friendly cats..... Mimi and Mira ...

Sharebnb was founded in 2K16. We have over 400 different condos and private rooms in over 70 locations throughout the world.

Our company, Sharebnb, also has an F-B page where our newest listings and special deals on resorts, condos, business travel,  and private rooms are advertised. You can reach us on F-B at sharebnb.

Please like and share so you can help friends and family get a bigger BANG for their buck while traveling by booking their lodging with Sharebnb!

We also host a podcast called "Live. Let. Thrive." The hosts talk about getting started with short-term rentals, the sharing economy and much more!

Hello
My name is Kim and my husband and I love to travel with our kids. We are a very active family. We love to ski/snowboard, run marathons, swim and ride bikes!

I'm from Seattle, WA. I'm a public interest attorney and foodie. My husband, Steve, and I have been together for 15 years and have lived in Capitol Hill for most of this time. In 2011, we purchased a 1904 brick tudor in the historic Harvard-Belmont District. We've spent the last eight years remodeling the house. In June of 2019 we're excited to list our new guest suite on airbnb.
Seattle native who grew up in the Ballard neighborhood. I’m a family guy who enjoys working in the tech industry, caring for his four-legged kids, traveling and fun times with friends and family.

I've been in the vacation rental biz for about 9 years now. I love to host and show off seattle. My house are all top notch and are full most of the year. I have a site called house-in-seattle where I showcase my houses. 

I've lived in Seattle for over 10 years now know my way around. I'm looking forward meeting you. 

If my house is available on this site it means I'm itching to entertain so don't hesitate ;-)

chris

Coffee by day, wine by night.

Seattle native. Love travel, food, music, culture, exercise, new experiences and my dog!

Hi!  We met in the Florida keys in 2010 and have been together ever since.  We were finally able to relocate back to Seattle after building our cottage in 2017.  Jacob is a Seattleite, and loves the ocean and the rain.  Rebekah is from North Carolina, loves mountains and everything the Pacific Northwest has to offer.  We love any opportunity for travel and enjoy staying at other Airbnb’s so we are happy to be able to host others at ours!

Hi, I am Anu! I love to travel and explore new places and I've found that Airbnb is the best way to get the most authentic experience in any city. I will be offering my home in the heart of Seattle, for any visitors who would like to experience the city like a local.
Hooray!

I've lived in Seattle for over 25 years, most of that time in West Seattle. My wife and I love exploring the the city, especially all the new wine tasting rooms that have opened near SoDo. I enjoy cooking as well as trying new restaurants for inspiration in the kitchen.
 
 As a host, I believe in hospitality and making your stay as comfortable as possible. I respect your privacy, but we are always available if you have any questions, need assistance, or just want to chat.

I was born and raised in Alaska, but spent most of my 20's outside the US, living on four continents while I studied, researched, worked, backpacked, and founded a start-up.

I came to Seattle because I love the Pacific Northwest (I went to college at Western Washington University in Bellingham), and have family in the area. I like to walk up things, mostly mountains, but stairs are ok too.

I treat each day as an opportunity to find joy in the present while preparing for the future.

I enjoy hosting folks in my home, and want to make sure they enjoy their time here - check out my guidebook to Seattle!

I’m a classical pianist and I perform and teach College students and piano students of all ages. I also love travel and fitness, I work out 6 days a week.  I am very thrilled to be an  Airbnb host and will do my best to help you enjoy your stay in the beautiful Magnolia neighborhood of Seattle!
Semi retired . Recently inherited funds and renovated this beautiful suite for quiet travelers seeking a quiet place to stay. if that is not what you want participate please don't book my suite

We are a 30-something married couple, new parents to a baby girl, and are both teachers in local school districts. We have always had good experiences using Airbnb while living and traveling abroad, and are excited to be able to host guests in our new basement apartment! 

We love to meet new people and share a beer on the patio, but we're also fine if you prefer your space. We've both lived in Seattle on and off for over a decade and are happy to chat about the area, practice our rusty Spanish, give restaurant/sight-seeing recommendations, or just lend you a rain coat.

Hi there! My name is Jeff. I'm a Seattle-based entrepreneur, traveler and family man. When I'm not working hard on my HealthTech startup I love getting up into the mountains with my wife, my dog Rogue and my 2-year old son. 

My wife and I both work in Seattle in the tech industry now but we traveled quite a bit internationally before we started our family (she was in the Peace Corp in W. Africa, I've also worked in Africa and different parts of Latin America). We are both natives of the Pacific NW, which we still spend a lot of time exploring on weekends!

We love to travel and meet new people. We often travel with  friends and family.  We love books, gardens, outdoors, cycling, photography, yoga, hiking with our dogs, doing almost anything with either or both of our wonderful kids.
I am an experienced Domicile hostess and I have a passion for providing 5-star service to all of my guests. Let me help you with your Seattle rental needs or check us out at bookdomicile!

I'm a trained photographer who grew up in Seattle, and later moved to the east coast for 8 years. After 3 years in New England, and 5 in New York, I returned to Seattle to settle, and eventually started a small family.

I enjoy many aspects of what my hometown has to offer. Not least is the coffee and food culture, as I delight in all things gustatory, on both the cooking and eating sides. I also appreciate the arts, and am involved in Seattle's arts community.

I take great pleasure and pride in opening my home to visitors, and in helping to share this great city that I love.
Professional on the edge of retirement. Love living in Seattle, playing golf, dog walking, backgammon, baseball, and just being with family and friends.

Straight outta the PNW! Lived in Washington state my entire life, but spend my time off exploring the wild US. 

Food, outdoors, friends, laughing, exploration, beer, new experiences... it's all good in my world!

My name is Blair and I'm glad you are interested in this house.  I've lived in Seattle my entire life, and would be happy to help you plan your trip.  

The pandemic gave everyone complications - including us. Our entire team was strained, exhausted, and nervous. The business was shut down due to lockdown restrictions in early 2020 and finally reopened in June of 2021...We are so happy to finally welcome people back to the Emerald City!  

Please let me know if you have any questions.

-Blair

I am a retired Seattle Public School Principal who started 49 years ago as an instructional assistant.  I earned my teaching certificate and taught for several years while earning my master’s degree in administration. I served the rest of my career as a principal.  After retirement I couldn’t stay away from young people. I continued to substitute for the simple reason, I miss them and get energy from being around them.
I love to travel across the U.S, as well as cruising around the world. My most remembered travel is several years ago as a Fulbright scholar to Egypt and Zimbabwe. This was before both countries start having the difficult time they are having today.
I try to see movies recommended by my grands and the high school students I work with. Yes, sometimes I am shocked.  However, most of the time I am pleasantly surprised with their choices.
I love cooking and eating all types ethnic foods.  Here are a few things I cannot live without:
 (Website hidden by Airbnb) My family who live in Seattle. 
 (Website hidden by Airbnb) Working and advocating for young people in the Seattle Public Schools.
 (Website hidden by Airbnb) Dreaming of what's coming next with the energy and health to fulfill it all.
As a guest of my Airbnb you will have a clean, comfortable, well equipped, home. I will be available to the guest 24/7. The home has been recently fully remodeled and has new appliances.  Our property manager is an insured and bonded contractor, he is working with me to ensure all is well while you're visiting. Come enjoy and relax in a beautiful home.
Newly retired grandparents, Joe and Martha are looking forward to hosting visitors to their vibrant and wonderful city.

Born and bred in the Seattle area, I have lived outside the U.S. and traveled extensively first with my parents and brothers, and now with my husband Johnny. Johnny and I  like meeting people and learning from them about their homes.  Discovering Airbnb has made our travel experiences much richer!   We hope we can do the same for you!
I've lived all over the world and love to travel! When at home in Seattle, we enjoy meeting new people who come stay in our little Airbnb cottage.
Love to travel! Love meeting new people and finding out about the cool things they do in the world!
We’re avid travelers ourselves, and are excited to share the comfort of our home with those visiting Seattle.
I work from home a lot, so I'm around much of the time to help out if you need anything. I want to provide every guest with a tidy and clean space to enjoy while staying in the area.
Traveling engineer/ project manager. Away from home 300+ days a year for work and pleasure.

Hi, I've been living with my partner here in Seattle since 2005.  He and I built a new home with a private entrance studio and would like to rent it to world travelers like ourselves.   We are Season Ticket Mariners fans and enjoy the atmosphere of T Mobile Park, night and day.  I'm a full time artist.  Watercolor is my medium and I like to paint almost anything.   We like to cook and enjoy entertaining family and friends.  We'd like to offer advise when asked and would like you to have a relaxing and enjoyable stay.

I was born and raised in Seattle - Queen Anne in fact!  I loved it so much, my husband and I moved back to the hill 5 years ago!   

I am a lover of dogs, coffee, good food, and spending time with family and friends.

Hey! I'm Avtar. I was born and raised in San Francisco California. Currently living in Seattle, though my work takes me all over the place.  I work as a Management Consultant in the Health Industry, so work for hospitals and health insurance companies.  

I'm pretty low key and when looking for a place I am mostly concerned with the location, and the cleanliness of the apartment so when offering my own I always take this into account for my guests.  Other than that, feel free to contact me for more details.
"When you travel you risk being changed in ways you can't anticipate." (Barbara Grizzuti Harrison)

I am from China and have lived in the US for 13 years now. I have been fortunate to build up a group of close friends who believed in me. They say I am kind, loyal, reliable, and fun to be with. I cannot imagine life without my friends. They are the foundation on which I have built my life. I am a runner and like all outdoor activities. I love to travel when I can. I like to learn the culture in areas I travel to and about other people’s lives rather than visiting tourist attractions. As a host, I will provide any convenience I can to make your trip relaxing and enjoyable. 
我来自中国，现在在美国已经生活了13年。我很幸运地结交了一群信任我的好朋友。他们说我善良､忠诚､可靠，和我在一起很有趣。我无法想象没有我朋友的生活，他们是我生活中的基础。我是一个跑步爱好者，喜欢户外运动。我有时间的时候热爱去旅行。比起参观旅游景点，我更加喜欢去学习当地的文化，了解他们的生活。我作为房东，在我的房子住宿，我将尽我所能为您提供一切便利，使您的旅行轻松愉快。

Hi my name is Julie and a long time Seattle resident. 

I am a stay at home mom and decided to become a host after had many great experiences as a guest while traveling. 

Let me know if you have any questions about my place. I am always available to answer any questions!

I have lived in Seattle all of my life and wouldn't live anywhere else. I tried! After living/working abroad and seeing other countries, I realized our "Emerald City" is where I belong. I went to culinary school and love to share that passion with our guests. I currently work independently and stay at home with our two young children. 

We can't live without things to do which is everything the Pacific NW has to offer AND within easy reach! We can go clam-digging just outside our neighborhood or in 45 minutes find ourselves  skiing at Snoqualmie Pass. 

My husband David (a California transplant) has been a Seattleite for over  22 years and obviously loves it here! He has  been with the Seattle Fire Department for 19 years and cherishes what he does. We both  coach youth sports for the YMCA and WSSC and cherish spending time with our family. 
We believe the Pacific NW's best kept secret is:  It really doesn't rain as much as they say! Everything that surrounds you... the city, mountains and water are just absolutely transcending! Our summers here are bar-none with the most spectacular long days of sunlight.

Musician by trade. Born and raised in Las Vegas. Been living in Seattle for 5 years. I enjoy meeting new people and hearing their travel stories. I take hosting seriously, and strive to provide the best possible stay for all my guests.

We built Zeus Living so you can feel at home wherever opportunity takes you. Whether it’s for a month, a year, or sometime in between, you can count on a thoughtfully designed home and a comfortable, easy stay. Our technology helps us select homes you’ll love in ideal locations at a good value, while our expert team handles all the details. Based in San Francisco, and operating in the Bay Area, Los Angeles, New York City, Seattle, Boston, and Washington, D.C.


** 
PLEASE NOTE: Many of our homes are pet friendly, which you will see listed under "House Rules". If you do plan to bring your furry friend(s), we have a one-time non-refundable $500 pet fee and have a limit of 2 pets max. We have several dog breed restrictions. Most of our dog-friendly homes do not allow American Pit bulls, Rottweilers, Akitas, Cane Corsos, Presa Canarios, Bull Mastiffs, Staffordshire Terriers, Dobermans, German Shepherds, Boxers, Malamutes, Huskies, Dalmatians, Chow Chows, Fila Brasileiros, or Wolf hybrids. We encourage individuals with service animals or one of the breeds listed as restricted to contact us before booking.

My wife and I are both professionals (her in hospitality and I in advertising). We're from Seattle, have lived in San Diego, Savannah and most recently Manhattan before moving back to the PNW.  We love to travel, eat great food and experience new things. Quiet and polite non-smokers with a very well behaved and friendly dog named Homer.

We are an international couple, Henry from the US, and Naoko from Japan. In our previous lives, Henry practiced law and Naoko designed fashion in New York, where we met. Given our disparate backgrounds, travel has become an inherent part of how we live: we now split our time between Seattle and Buenos Aires (where our son was born), with an annual jaunt to Nagasaki. We've stayed in Airbnbs around the world, and likewise hosted guests from all over, and throughout, it's been a pleasure. We invite you to come stay in our Seattle and Buenos Aires homes . . . the door is always open! :)
私たちはｱﾒﾘｶ人と日本人の国際結婚ｶｯﾌﾟﾙです｡ﾌﾞｴﾉｽｱｲﾚｽに移住する前､2人ともﾆｭｰﾖｰｸでﾍﾝﾘｰは弁護士として､なおこはﾌｧｯｼｮﾝ業界にて働いていました｡移住した後､1年間は世界一周旅行へ出かけていました｡いろいろな場所へ旅行へ行きましたが､現在は人生の新たな旅｢家族｣を始めて数年が経ちました｡

I’ve lived in my house about twenty years. When I retired about three years ago, I decided to fix up the upstairs for a short term rental. I am just starting out (as of August 2021) and am excited to get started. I want to provide guests with a comfortable and fun place to stay. My neighbors’ parents have stayed here a few times while I have been working on getting it ready. They have been a delight and it has made me happy to share my home with them and provide a space they can enjoy with their children and grandchildren. 

I love the beauty of the Pacific Northwest, and when I am not working on the house, I spend time with friends and family and try to fit in some painting classes.

I'm currently the landlord of 5 units here in the Seattle area, 2 of which are Airbnb. I just started hosting in February of 2019 and I love it! My only regret is I wish I'd started sooner. I enjoy hosting and meeting travelers from all over and hope to continue right through retirement. I dream of visiting Italy, Rome & Spain some day and perhaps get to experience airbnb as a traveler for a change.
Alaskan, Architect, Aries, Arborist, Cook and Gardener. Love community.

I live in Seattle WA and I love it. I’ve been here 40 years now. I have grown children and together we enjoy natural beauty of this area, the mountains and the water.   We also enjoy all that the city has to offer, restaurants, theater, art and beer!
Able to contact ONLY via Airbnb message or text (much faster). NOT AVAILABLE FOR PHONE CALL most of time! Please only call me if emergency!

Seattle born but have lived in 8 states and 6 countries. My work in International Education has allowed me to visit many parts of the globe but I have many places I still hope to experience first hand someday. My better half, Greg, has lived in 9 states and 3 countries. He's a social worker who works with people exiting the criminal justice system. Our daughter has been living the PNW dream for her entire 6 years of life. We love our home and can't wait to share it with you! If you are staying in our house, that means we are off staying in someone else's, exploring new or old familiar places. Thanks for hosting us or being our guest!

Hello!! We are a fun loving couple that grew up in Seattle. We love our city and believe others will too once they get a taste of what Seattle has to offer. We enjoy doing outdoor activities such as boating, hiking, and biking.  We are sports fanatics, our favorite teams are the Seahawks and Mariners of course.

Five things we can't live without are: our dog Dougie, family, traveling, friends, and sports. Our most favorite traveling destinations are Greece and Thailand! We've traveled to many places and are a firm believer of don't knock if you haven't tried it. We believe that traveling enriches our mind and  have opened our eyes to a whole world we never knew. On the weekends, we like going to concerts and finding out different places to eat.

We want our guests to feel like they are at their own home during their stay with us. We are available to answer any questions at anytime of the day so feel free to ask us anything. We'll be glad to help out!!

Hello Beauty-full, 
I am a Pleasure R-evolutionary, Researcher, Performer, Blogger, Coach, Goddess & all-around Renaissance Woman...passionate about living in my Pleasure, Passion & Purpose...& inspiring others to do the same.

I Love Cabaret, Theatre, Films, Challenging myself, Personal Growth, marrying the Spiritual WITH the Material, Travel, Yoga, Dancing & so much more...

2 things that Scare me that I Deeply Desire & plan to do in 2015:
-Skydiving
-Hot Air Balloon Riding

Asking me to pick a favorite movie, is like asking me to pick a favorite man.  I appreciate so many men, for so many different reasons.  Top 5 Favorite Films (as of right now):
-Bull Durham
-Casablanca
-Moonstruck
-E.T.
-Dan in the Real Life

I Love my little Harlem Tower (Sacred Temple) & look forward to sharing it with...YOU.  I also look forward to traveling more & taking advantage of Airbnb, as YOUR potential guest.

I am Great-full to be a part of Aribnb's Global Community Vibe. 

Sometimes, I'm deep in Solitude regenerating.  Other times, I'm out on the town, creating, producing & thriving Fully.  Going for your Pleasure isn't always Pure Bliss.  Sometimes, it's Pure Hell...but it's ALL-WAYS worth the Risk.

My Motto:  Welcome to the Pleasure R-evolution, Penetrating the Resist-Stance, one Pleasurable step at a time.

What's yours? ;)

I believe that all of us are born to live happily. I am on a mission to live in that path. I love meeting people, cooking, reading and writing. It has been a dream to work in hospitality and this is the nearest I would say. People who travel are truly blessed in my opinion and they deserve a great experience.

We've had such great experiences with Airbnb while doing our own traveling that we decided to start hosting!  We love everything about living in Seattle (even the rainy season) so we're excited to now be able to share that with others.  

When we travel, we like to live like the locals do and want to share that same opportunity with the people who stay with us.

HI! My name is Elisabeth. My husband and I have lived in Seattle for nearly a decade and love our city! One of our favorite spots (a must if you are visiting Seattle for the first time) is Gasworks Park. We love it so much we got married there! We love to travel and have used Airbnbs around the world. We are excited to share our home with you and give you a landing pad in between discovering Pike's Place Market, speakeasies, and hiking the many trails the PNW has to offer!

I like to think about people and the future. My wife is a gardener who is always in the moment. Our son plays Iron Maiden on the ukulele. In our free time you can find us picnicking with cocktails, swimming in Lake Washington, scootering through old growth forests, biking on islands, listening to African Blues, watching a French New Wave, reading The New Yorker and The Atlantic, or daydreaming about living in a foreign land.

Kelly and I are California natives but have lived in Seattle since 2010! We met at university and have been married since 2014. We are both residential realtors and love to help people find their place in the world.. We have a golden retriever named Henry who thinks everyone is his best friend and a 1.5 year old son who sure keeps us busy. We love Seattle because of its endless amounts of good food, coffee and beautiful outdoor activities! We’d love to host you!

Hey all,

excited to part of the AirBnB community!
Friendly, father of 3 daughters ('93,'96,'02), adventurous engineer/scientist -- best vacations have all centered around getting out into the natural beauty, hiking, cycling, or xc skiing.

Hi there! 

My wife Robin and I are semi-retired empty nesters with both kids living on the East Coast! Together we love to travel and stay in our cabin in Eastern Washington. In our free time, we go fly fishing, hiking, experiment with new recipes, try out local restaurants, and watch Premier League soccer! Go Chelsea! 

Originally from New York and Alaska, we have been in Seattle for over 20 years now and can provide tons of local recommendations!

My name is Lindsay and I'm an urban planner who loves to meet people and travel the world. My favorite trip so far was traveling to the Galapagos Islands in Ecuador, South America with my mom and interacting with approachable animals and fearless birds. I have lived and worked in Seattle for over six years and have been impressed by the city's fast growth, its proximity to nature, and numerous outdoor recreation options in this region. I can't wait to meet you and show you what Seattle gets to offer!
Life long Seattle residents - we love to cook and eat.  Need help with planning your trip, just ask!

My name is Brian and I was an avid traveller. Coming back to Seattle, I decided to host an airbnb that would provide a comfortable, convenient and affordable experience for my fellow travelers! Can't wait to get a chance to host you!

Hi there! We are an active little family of 4 who thrives off adventure. 

We enjoy biking, hiking, kayaking, camping and traveling (especially to places that offer all of the above!) We consider ourselves easy going and easy to please. Love to meet folks and share stories. 

Fletcher is a carpenter/builder while Khristy is an artist. We are currently living between our home in Seattle and land on Orcas Island.

Fun, funny, responsible, creative, adventurous.  And now....retired!  Have lived in Seattle, New York City, Boston, Connecticut - and Scotland.  Eclectic in all regards.  Great sense of humor.  Mother to one daughter who is finishing college on the East Coast.  She kept us busier than anyone!   I have a background in education and  theater.  I enjoy a productive day and a relaxing evening.    Music, a healthy meal, writing poetry, reading New Yorker magazine or a book, research on the internet, a hot bath, company on the deck.
Trained by Airbnb Superhost and I'm looking forward to meeting as many future guests as possible.

I live in beautiful Seattle, WA and came from Colorado, so I love the outdoors. During the winter I enjoy snowboarding, skiing, snowshoeing, etc. and during the summer a love a good hike. Otherwise I enjoy traveling, business and spending time with friends and family.

I LOVE my city of Seattle and still embrace my Midwest heart being from Indiana. So grateful to travel and also host. I love to hear your stories and all the folks I’ve met thru Airbnb have been great and keep my hope in humanity alive!
Seattle adventurer by way of New York and Canada.

Hey there!
I'm Paema, and I like to travel with AirBnbs because it gives a more homey feel to travel. When our family is on the road, we like to offer our house to AirBnb guests as it is in a convenient location near Green Lake. I am an accountant and like efficiency, so I love the efficiency that AirBnb provides :-).
I like to go wherever life takes me.
Responsible, clean, professional. Loves travel, food, music, art, literature.

Hi, we’re Vacasa, North America’s largest vacation rental management company. Owners of vacation homes around the world trust us to deliver exceptional service throughout your entire vacation. Professional housekeepers clean and stock each home, and our customer care team is available around the clock—with a local property manager ready to show up and help out. We like to think we offer the best of both worlds: you can enjoy a one-of-a-kind vacation experience in a unique property, without compromising on service and convenience. Check out our listings, and get in touch if you have any questions. Your vacation is our full-time job, and we'd love to help you plan your perfect getaway.

Family-oriented professional.
Love to travel and visit new cities.
I am an avid traveler who enjoys running, trying the local cuisine, and learning new languages.

Hey I’m Theo. A down to earth northwest dude who’s into sports, music, and culture. I love to travel the globe, I’m an excellent cook, and I enjoy a good German or Belgian beer from time to time. My life mantra is “Go with the flow”. Peace and love y’all!

Hosts are both artists, Jim works with wood and Maria is a glass and mosiac artist. You will find Jims work in The Studio in the cabinets and the bed.  Maria made all the tile and set the mosaic floor.  They have lived in their house since 1980 and are very connected to the community.

We've lived in Queen Anne, Seattle for 4 years and love the neighborhood and the city. The food here rivals any city we have lived in and the art and culture of Seattle are on display wherever you go. We'd love to welcome you to our studio and share some of our favorite places to go!

A native born from the authentic land of evergreens , salmon and grunge — Seattle , WA.  

  ❤️ traveling - culture - art - metaphysics -outdoors - health food - fashion - chasing sunsets and rises ❤️

As a traveler , I tend to be flexible and free .  
As a host , I hope to assist you in any information in what Seattle has to offer .

Hello,   I have lived in Seattle for 8 years.  Belltown, Seattle is home.   I take pride in sharing this wonderful part of the world, and its unique and diverse culture.
 
As an avid traveler and having lived in Europe, South America, New York, Miami, Portland, OR, and Vancouver, BC,  I enjoy meeting people from all walks for life, learning and celebrating diverse cultures.  

My goal is to provide you with a memorable Seattle and Pacific Northwest experience.  You will enjoy a clean, comfortable, classic, modern, urban, authentic Pacific Northwest experience.  Be in the center of it all and walk everywhere.

I look forward to hosting you.  See you soon!

Carlos A.

I am the one most people refer to as "Jake of all trades but master of none. I enjoy spending most of the evenings at my studio and drinking...??? I mean, coffee and playing sitar late at night. I am also a day trader, a host, entrepreneur, curator, art advocator, IT guru, and of course, (Hidden by Airbnb) admin of the group that I created. I have degrees in Commerce, Electronic Engineering and recently completed my Master's in Art Education. I have traveled to many great cities in the world but am somehow stuck in Seattle. I don't particularly appreciate it when people criticize me, but I enjoy criticizing others. Come on, we all do.......:) What else do you want to know about me? Text me or stop by at my studio.
I am a Seattle native and own a home near Green Lake.
Currently living in Seattle. Proud owner of two fluffy loving kitties.

My husband Lee and I have lived in our 1926 Greek Mediterranean-style house for almost 20 years.   We've done a lot to it during that time, the latest being a complete remodel of our first/ground floor including the addition of bathroom and kitchen.  You'll probably see us working around the yard which we tend to do a lot!  

We have two kids - our son is a Junior at the San Francisco Conservatory of Music and our daughter is a Junior at Roosevelt High School; and we have a new puppy whose name is Stella and she is a mini Labradoodle.  

We really enjoy hosting and meeting people from all over the world!  We only started our Airbnb a little over a year ago, and we've already had people visiting from Indonesia, China, and all over the US.
Languages spoken: English, German, and Persian

I’m originally from the UK (still have a bit of the accent) but have spent several years living in Asia and the US. I’ve now settled in the Pacific Northwest with my husband Jathan (who grew up here) and our 3 dogs: @MrFitzybear

Myself and Jathan both have years of experience in the hospitality/customer relations industries, we’ve hosted visiting friends and family several times and now we want to put all that practice into creating an amazing experience for you at our first Airbnb.

We’re all really excited you’re considering staying with us on your trip to Seattle, whether it’s your first time or you’re a frequent-flier, if there is anything we can do to make your visit more enjoyable all you need do is ask.

Thanks for reading.
Alex
Husband, traveler, friend. Likes good books, good people and good food.

Hi there! My Mantra: be good, do better, help others, always.

I'm a fairly active woman and love being outdoors. When I'm not working I love to explore the cities amazing restaurants and bars. I am into the local music scene and enjoy playing games.
A 5-star AirBnB superhost and guest, working in tech and traveling for business and leisure.
Hi, My name is Amina. I’ve lived in Seattle for over 20 years. I love to travel, see new places, cultures and meet new people.

My husband and I have lived in Seattle since 2015. We absolutely love the Pacific Northwest, and are avid hikers, backpackers, and snowshoers. We also enjoy hearing music, playing music, dancing, and traveling. Between the two of us, we speak some Spanish, German, French, and Japanese. We have 4 grown sons and very much enjoy having kids. We also love dogs, but my husband is allergic to cats. We have owned our own home for many years and understand how to be respectful guests. We also host our own Air Bnb, "Happy Seattle."

# STR-OPLI (Phone number hidden by Airbnb) Hi there.  
We've lived in the Pritchard Beach neighborhood for 22 years and love the neighborhood more each year.  Amy is a theatre actor and professor of Shakespeare at the Universtiy of Washington and Hans is a general contractor in Seattle building new residential homes, micro houses and interesting spaces for forward-thinking clients.  We enjoy a large community of friends and spend a good deal of our time breaking bread with them.  This house was owned by our dear friends until recently (Hans built them a new house!) and we purchased it to have an extra place for our family, friends, travelers as well as a possible future home for Hans' family.  

As frequent Airbnbers ourselves (most often in Manzanita OR) we've always wanted to create a space of our own to share in this way.  Our post-kids-in-the-house lives will certainly include running an inn or B&B of some sort; we love nothing more than hosting friends and strangers and spreading love in our community during these complex and fraught times.

We believe our space will be a restful hideaway and during the sunny months our backyard will bring you an excellent place to soak up the vitamin D.

We are a safe space and welcome all.

I am very excited to manage the lovely short term rental house. I am dedicated to this business. I spent more than a year to prepare the beautiful dream apartment. I'm looking forward to work with you to offer a convenient and best stay in Seattle.  My hobbies are photographing, decorating, designing, painting, cooking, swimming, hiking etc. I love to share my good experience and talk to people. I enjoy managing my 2BD/2BT large luxurious and comfortable home for my guests. So I would always design and stage the home for each guests.  I alway look for beautiful home goods to add to the home, I hope to make every guest feel at home. Thanks for checking out my home, welcome!

Salutations! I am Amanda. I've lived in Washington State most of my life and love it here so much. It does rain a lot here though, so I do dream of moving somewhere tropical and sunny someday. I have a border collie named Bugs who loves to go on hikes with me. I work in the restaurant industry so I do usually get home pretty late. I'm pretty quiet - sometimes I'll play music in the mornings, but am very conscientious of sharing space with other people. I also enjoy hosting people and showing my hospitality :D

I am a Canadian younge professional who works in Seattle, US. My friends describe me as super friendly, easy going, cool :), fun to be around, and down to earth. I love to travel and have visited plenty of countries so far... I can't wait to either be hosted by you or host you  nicely in Seattle :)

As a full-time world traveler, I never stay in 5 stars hotels. Instead, I always stay with Air bnb. I have met many many hosts around the globe and I am grateful that they are genuinely nice to me and I have learned a lot from them. An engineer by training. A father of 3 lovely young kids. Work in high tech industry. Love to travel. Enthusiast architecture and interior design. Enjoy hosting in Airbnb community. 

Appreciate and understand the need for traveler and will do our best to fulfill your needs.
Mayumi and I live in Sapporo Japan where she teaches psychology at the University of Hokkaido. We love Whistler and the location of our Whistler townhouse and visit as often as we can.

My husband and I love to travel and host. We live in Seattle in one of the older neighborhoods close to the UW. Our Tudor house was built in 1929 but completely updated in 2018. We love to walk in the nearby Arboretum and along the shores of Lake Washington and Union Bay. We also enjoy hiking in the Cascade and Olympic mountains.
Goth DJ, queer, friendly. Call me Rota.
Outdoorsy, likes being in nature and water activities. Enjoys restaurants and supporting local businesses.

Visit us and see all of our homes at Air Concierge Vacation Homes 

Our goal is to ensure guests experience first-class service while staying in our homes, whether it's a 5 bedroom beachfront home or a bungalow in the city.  These homes are owned by some wonderful, hard-working folks who have opened their homes and spaces to us and thus to you. 

You may also receive communication from those on our staff through this account including Daniel, Rhiannon, Gabriela, Fallon, Anna, Oscar, Claire or Christopher.

Live life happy. Otherwise what's the point.
I love to travel and I've been fortunate to travel quite a bit for my last job in international development.  I enjoy playing soccer and trying out new food.

My husband Dave and I enjoy building, gardening and cooking meals with our adult children or hanging out playing guitar in the back yard.   We always stay in Airbnb types of accommodations when we travel, and just finished building our own to host.  We spent a year creating a space that would be everything we dreamed of as guests.  We are excited to join the Airbnb community!
on a journey, with my heart leading the way.
Hi there! I grew up in Sumatra and moved to Seattle! I look forward to hosting you in my place!

Seattle born and raised. Work, study, design! Always looking forward to meeting new people and hearing new stories.

Super host status changed only because our home is available for 30-night booking minimum! I am still a very super host.
Seattle native, aerospace engineer, love traveling, positive vibes and all the great things in life!

I am an avid traveler, fun but responsible. I have lived in Seattle my whole life so I know it like the back of my hand. Ask me anything! I will tell you what’s worth it or not! I live in a very close suburb now and I work in the city. I am also a mum now!
Active outdoorsy workaholic who spends half his time traveling.

I’m originally from Paris (France) and relocated to Seattle with my wife in 2015. We have two young children and love going out to parks, exploring local restaurants and discovering other activities Seattle has to offer.

We travel a lot but often to the same places to visit family and friends; from California to Paris, Corsica, Boston, Los Angeles and North Carolina. For our next trip we’d like to go Vietnam or Thailand. Between my wife and I, we speak four languages (English, French, Spanish and Yoruba) and have lived in five different countries on three different continents.

We love to use Airbnb when traveling because of the convenience and feeling of being home that hotels can’t compare to; as hosts, we want to make every stay a great experience. We also love to meet people from all over the world.

Before booking with us, make sure to read the reviews we have and feel free to contact me if you have any question about our listing!

Hope to see you soon!

I am originally from Cleveland, OH but now call Seattle, WA home after a somewhat nomadic existence as both a consultant and an officer in the US Army. I love to play outside with my family and friends --this includes my black lab, Hawk. I live by the golden rule and believe that success starts with assuming goodwill.
I love traveling and also love to meet people, listen to their stories and bring joy to their trip in Seattle

Hi there - 

We are the Blues! We are both CA natives, and moved up to Seattle for school and work. We love the PNW - the outdoors are at our fingertips here!

Laura works at the Seattle Children's Research Institute, supporting principal investigators at the Center for Developmental Biology and Regenerative Medicine. Josh is an architect designing educational architecture for schools throughout Seattle and the surrounding areas. When we're not working, we're either hiking, going to the movies, or hanging with our church community. 

We also LOVE to travel! Post graduation, Laura traveled for eleven months on a trip called the World Race, visiting a different country each month, doing various volunteer/service/mission work in each place. In that year we visited four continents, working in orphanages, teaching English, working in churches, clearing land, and connecting with communities all over the world! It certainly fueled a longing to explore, venture to new places, and experience new communities. But it has also grown an appreciation for a sense of "home" and comfort. Laura has visited 44 countries so far, and her dream would be to visit them all! 

We got married in April 2018, and spent our honeymoon in Chile - specifically the Patagonia region. When traveling, we're on the look out for the tastiest food spots, live music, best views, and any sort of fun, cultural events unique to that place. We hope to venture to many new places together. However, our newest adventure is hosting our very own Airbnb in partnership with the company, Loftium! 

We look forward to hosting you!

Cheers,
Laura and Josh

New England Native.  Seattle for 25+ years all in the Queen Anne/Downtown area.  I'd love to have you stay at my AirBnB - my favorite part of running one, is the varied people from all over the world I get to meet.  I am dedicated to timely and open communication and eager to help with anything I can do to make your time in Seattle or living in the second half of my duplex more enjoyable or convenient.  The pride of my place is my garden, but I'm still working on it, perhaps another season and I'll have it as stunning as I desire.  Make yourself at home, enjoy the greenery all around in the midst of the hustle and bustle of Seattle.

As an Airbnb guest since 2014, I am mindful that the places I stay are often your own homes and treat them as I would want guests to treat my own home. I may be out at the crack of dawn to go for a run or come in late after an event, but am quiet, clean and respectful of your place.  In 2019,  I began hosting, opening a guest space in my home of 30 years.

 I am an outdoorsy, active, nearly-retired oncology RN. I love "puttering" around my garden and a sunny morning on the back porch with my cat at my side is something I dearly look forward to (living in Seattle, sunny mornings are special!).
We’re long-time West Seattle residents and are happy to make recommendations on things to do in the neighborhood!
Fun, friendly,and helpful.

My wife Jeanne and I met in Seattle 15 years ago and have called West Seattle home since 2013.  We love to travel, work in DIY house & garden projects, and share a good meal with friends and family.  You can often find us working obsessively on a puzzle at our dining room table or playing with our dog in the back yard.

Building a backyard cottage has been a dream of our since we met and we are thrilled to share this space that we love with others.

Father and daughter hosts are Seattle Natives with a taste for the world. We love LA, NY, MIA and all in between, but Seattle is our city. We are small business owners and thought Airbnb would be an interesting new venture at a less stressful pace.  We are very casual after business hours :) and very social.  We enjoy meeting people from different cultures and love to entertain.


Prez:  I have been blessed with opportunities to travel many places (or at least many places to us), love new experiences and seeing historic land marks. We take pride in our city's beauty, rich culture and past good or bad.

I've worked for myself most of my life and love being creative . I enjoy graphic design, acting rapping, video production, editing, directing, ballin' and shot callin' (a little urban humor) LOL. I truly want to do everything. I was a volunteer fire fighter with the Seattle Fire Department, EMT and certified life guard. ( I told you I want to do everything)

I have a lot of day activity and nightlife connections with the transportation company I manage, if you want to do a little exploring- we've got the hook up.  We like to let our guests determine if they want some private personal time while using our space or want the works with sight seeing suggestions and even the option of tagging along with us for some fun. (Warning it can get a little crazy with us, especially once the party bus gets rolling, lol ). It is very common to see buses coming or going from our property at various hours of the day and night.  You can book airport / train / bus pick ups and drop (EMAIL HIDDEN) please enter airbnb as the referral to receive a discount.

We are open to any and all guests as along as everyone is respectful and polite.  Your race, sexual preference or religion is respected as long as you extend the same respect. Our space has its own keyless entry so you're welcome to come and go as you please without worrying about disturbing the rest of the house. 

I hope to have you stay with us...check out our reviews and book a night!

PS: THIS IS NOT A 5 STAR HOTEL, WHAT IS IN THE PHOTOS IS IN THE HOUSE. 

Prez & 'Keia

We are an active family of 3 and enjoy traveling extensively all over the world to experience different cultures, food, meeting people and adventuring. We love being outdoors in the beautiful Pacific Northwest.

I recently moved to Seattle and fell in love with the city! I enjoy trying a whole bunch of different kinds of foods and finding local hole in the walls, so I'm always open to exchanging recommendations.

My husband and I have recently returned to the US from Asia. We've visited 12 countries in the last two years and eaten ALL the dumplings. Now it's time for some good old-fashioned Americana. Top thing we can't live without: our small but mighty french bulldog, Ham.

I feel lucky to live in Seattle, getting to enjoy much of what makes it so special: I row competitively, hike in the nearby mountains, enjoy the farmers' markets, and long urban walks in Seattle's great neighborhoods. 

It is my pleasure to provide a luxurious and special Airbnb stay in the entirely separate, private, and sparkling new 2 bedroom guesthouse on our property in the lovely Laurelhurst neighborhood of Seattle. Architect-designed and custom built, it has luxurious amenities with high-end finishes, furnishings, and original art. My family and I live in the separate and adjacent house on the property. Your privacy and space is respected.

I'm a Seattle native and love sharing my hometown with others! My husband was born and raised in Chicago, so you'll see a map of both Seattle and Chicago in the apartment we host. We love the outdoors, play beach volleyball regularly at Golden Gardens (just across the water from where we live!) and love skiing/snowboarding in the winter. We are also big foodies who love exploring Seattle's restaurant scene.

We are Cristina and Tom – we moved recently from Europe to Seattle. We love meeting people who have a passion for travel and look forward to sharing all that we love about Seattle (and our favorite neighborhood, West Seattle). 

We like new foods, strong coffee and artisanal beer, meeting people, sharing a laugh, and exploring new places especially on foot. We would like to make your experience in Seattle as memorable as possible. Looking forward to meeting you soon!

I'm a Midwesterner at heart, with a love for the South, living the dream in the PNW.  After living in Chicago and Atlanta, we moved back here to my husband's hometown 8 years ago. With our 3 young boys, we love adventuring through Seattle and the great outdoors that surrounds it.   We are passionate about community, culture and being outdoors.

I am Chris, a foundation to finish carpenter and resident of The Pacific Northwest for over half my life. I have a over 20 years of Construction, Real Estate, and Project Management experience. A resident of The Pacific Northwest for over 20 years, I have been lucky to call West Seattle home for 15 years. Constantine's Cottage is named after my young son. Here, we invite you to feel at home in this immaculate and private 2 bedroom, 1 bath oasis of calm - just 10 miles from the airport, 15 minutes to downtown, and yet, West Seattle feels like a world away with its quiet comforts and laid back vibe. Some local attractions include Alki Beach, the West Seattle Water Taxi,  Lincoln Park, The Westwood Village Mall, The Alaska Junction and many others. If there is something specific you are seeking, just ask! The home is close to Public transit, and there is free unmetered street parking. The cottage has been recently updated with chic modern comforts and tranquility in mind. With every amenity provided, you are sure to enjoy your stay.

We like to travel as a family.   We travel often and have been traveling to 5 continents.  We understand travellers needs on their journey.  We love to host and meet travelers from near and far.   We hope you will have a restful moment while you are in Seattle.

Hey! I'm Alec. I'm a native of the Pacific Northwest, and while I love it here, I also love to travel. I try to explore the world as much as possible, and when I'm at home, I spend long hours on my bike exploring the areas surrounding Seattle. My girlfriend Ellicott and I have lived in Seattle for 5 years and just recently finished a giant remodel that included the creation of the downstairs unit that we list on Airbnb. We're excited to show off our city to visitors, and eager to get recommendations from guests about places to visit elsewhere in the world.

I have lived on North Beacon hill for over 30 years. My partner, Tim, grew up in Seattle. We are both interested in the arts, meditation and gardening. We love Beacon Hill and share that enthusiasm with our guests.
Hi I’m Zack! I'm a regular Airbnb traveler and I host at my home in Seattle.
Type B personality but gives type A results. Fastidious yet flexible. That's an executive summary.
I’m a grandmother of 3 grandchildren, wife. I love to travel, waterski,and enjoy meeting people of all sorts of life.
I am an Architect and Salsa dancer who has always loved to travel. I have two young children and work from home. I love hosting people and learning about their travel adventures.

Born and raised in California, I recently moved to Washington for a job, at Airbnb actually!

Airbnb's mission "Belong Anywhere", and it's something I truly believe in. I've traveled all around the world, and always stay in Airbnbs wherever I go. My goal as a host is for you to feel at home in my listing, and in Seattle.

Hey! 

Thanks for checking out our profile! Originally from the Midwest, we sold everything we owned, loaded up a Uhaul trailer, and drove west to start a new adventure in Seattle. Wanting to write our own story, we were in search of something completely different from our hometowns in Wisconsin. The PNW felt like a great fit and off we went!

#Boeingbunker is the product of a vision inspired by Dave's interest in aviation (Dave is an aspiring pilot) and Martha's obsession with all things decorating (colors, texture, and patterns ... oh my!). With investment of our own sweat equity, #boeingbunker came to life over a six month period. In its beginning stages, we felt like it was such a big risk. Thanks to our guests and their invaluable feedback, #boeingbunker has been far more successful than we could have imagined. 

We've grown to love the PNW and can't wait to share our home with you!

Cheers,
Dave and Martha
Grew up in Rome but lived the last 20 years in Seattle and Silicon Valley working in tech industry. Parents originally from Abruzzo as well as grandparents.

I'm a high school teacher and father of two. We like to travel during school breaks and hope that being an Airbnb host will offset some of our travel expenses. We love our house and our neighborhood and think you will too.

I am a Seattle native and can't wait to share my city with you.  I am in my 40's and work in tech.  My husband and I split our time between Seattle and our vacation home in the mountains.  We are always available to ensure you have a great stay.  I enjoy skiing, cooking, reading, relaxing with friends and of course travel!

I grew up in Singapore and am currently building software for a start-up company. I like learning about new technologies and exploring how technology can be designed to improve the lives of people. The internet's cool, I spend a lot of time on it. I play the guitar for fun. Superhero movies? Big fan.

My partner and I have been lucky to buy our dream home, and we would love to share it with you. We are in the fitness and marketing industry. Born and raised in the seattle area with tons of advice for things to do. Look forward to having you at our home!
We thrive on customer service experience! Please allow us to be the best hosts for your next vacation :)

Hi I'm Matt! I live in the beautiful Seattle, WA with my wife Courtney, our son Weston, daughter Blake, newborn girl Noa and our dog Penny. I work in downtown Seattle for Amazon Web Services and my wife Courtney is a photographer and stay at home mom.
We are easy going fun loving, and we love all things adventure and outdoors, however we never pass up a good movie or game night either. We like to consider ourselves healthy eaters but pizza and cold cereal are our weakness.
Our life motto is to be kind and respectful no matter what! So if you stay in our home or host us, you can always expect that from us.
From Somerset, England but currently live in Seattle, USA. I'm a conservation biologist who loves to travel.

Hi we are a couple of fun loving guys who have a super cute condo in West Seattle with beautiful view and a balcony that we love to sit and eat breakfast lunch and dinner at. We have 2 spacious rooms with tons of pillows and blankets to keep you comfortable. This is the perfect place and perfect location for you to truly take in All Seattle has to offer!

I am a semi retired long time travel agent. I am also a companion to women with dementia. And the mother of two really fabulous adult daughters, and the grandmother of Juniper and Hazel, the loves of my life. I live in Seattle and I love it here. I have been living and working in Seattle for over 35 years (not to date myself!).

I'm a Merchant Mariner currently living in the beautiful city of Seattle. I enjoy hiking, road biking, skiing, and traveling. I regularly travel back home to Iowa to work on my walnut tree farm. I'm very respectful to all my hosts and try to leave the space cleaner than when I found it. I look forward to meeting you and having a good stay.

I worked in a medical laboratory in research for over 40 years. Now I am retired. 
Jon and I are a couple and look forward to hosting you in this cottage. 
Jon is an avid runner (he’s run the Boston Marathon 4 times) and is happy to answer questions and suggest running routes if that’s your interest. If you can keep up with him, you could join him, he often goes on early morning runs in the area. Colleen runs/walks at a much more leisurely pace. Ask Colleen about restaurants and suggestions for activities.

Hello and an early welcome to Seattle! My name is Sherry and I’m a long-time Superhost in this vibrant city :)

My passion lies in interior design and hospitality, and it gives me great joy turning our beautiful homes into the perfect urban vacation spot. Our homes feature stylish interiors, hotel-grade plush beds with crisp white linens and thoughtful amenities to make your stay a perfect one. 

Please feel free to shoot me a message if you have any questions - my team and I look forward to hosting you! \ (^__^)/

My husband and I have traveled the globe for work and leisure. We love the Pacific Northwest for its evergreen trees, mild four seasons and numerous bodies of water. And also for its countless wonderful restaurants, friendly people and good coffee. We are foodies and are constantly in search of the next restaurant.

When we are not eating we enjoy taking walks or runs in Lincoln Park by the Sound or kayaking on Seattle's many waterways.
 
We hope you enjoy your stay!

My wife, Daphne, and I live in Seattle. She is an artist originally from Munich, Germany. I am a lawyer hailing from the great northwest. Our newest addition is our beautiful daughter, Penelope. We love traveling, and after so many recommendations from our friends, we're making the leap to Airbnb. We're looking forward to visiting fantastic new cities and to meeting amazing people everywhere we go.

We’ve lived in our house for over 30 yrs and we love our neighborhood!
We created our space to share with family and friends that are far flung around the country, and figured AirBnB was a good fit for filling in the “down time”.
Dave is a partially retired contractor. I’m still helping people buy and sell homes in the Seattle area. 
We aim to make you feel welcome!

Hello! We are Yui and Ray, your hosts at The Residence at 12333. Our goal in offering The Residence is to provide a modern, comfortable and clean haven to come home to while visiting Seattle. Almost everything is new, including the furniture and bedding. We have owned this townhouse since it was built, and it has always been a pet-free, smoke-free home.

Lane and Lloyd are friends that have lived in the PNW for a collective 20 years and counting. Both are craft beer enthusiasts who frequent many of the world-class breweries Seattle has to offer. When they're not at a brewery, you are most likely to find Lloyd on a golf course or Lane on the water, fly fishing. They are always excited to meet new people and show them the best Seattle has to offer.

Hello! I’m a local Seattle resident that moved here from Alaska. I went to school in Texas and love to travel. I love staying at AirBnB’s when I travel and am excited to host other travelers. 
As a guest, I am very clean and respectful of the homes I’ve stayed in and will look forward to my future travels and accommodations! If you would like to know more about me, shoot me a message.

I live in Seattle with my husband Don of 40+ years and currently with our two grown sons.  We love to travel the world and meet people from different cultures.  Our property is an ongoing labor of love for the artistic and tropical!  My husband and son created the unique Banana Bungalow and surrounding landscaped garden and fountains.  We look forward to sharing our space with you.  I speak Danish (although a bit rusty) and Don has limited German abilities.
I love this area and know all the ins and outs and secret restaurants.I'm happy to help you navigate and have the best experience possible.
Love to travel.  Love my city.  Happy to welcome you to the tiny house.  Know the Seattle and surrounding area very well,  am happy to share info.
I live in Seattle, married with two adorable kids, and my wife and I co-pastor a Church in Seattle called Open Home.

Traveling is my passion. I have been to 27 countries and can't wait to add to the list! I love meeting new people, being introduced to new food and culture and having friends in various countries. I have stayed in many Airbnbs while traveling in the US and internationally. It's a much richer experience.

I'm a professional female working in tech, originally from Canada, who used to live in NYC in Brooklyn but now lives in Seattle. I like to hike, bike, do yoga and swim when I'm not working. I'm a vegetarian. I travel frequently for work, family and because I love it. I am self-sufficient. I like staying in quiet, CLEAN accommodations with good internet, privacy, sunlight, coffee and a firm but non-lumpy bed.
I love to travel, meet new interesting people and explore!
Filmmaker in Seattle!

I'm Realtor working the Seattle Metro market and have called Seattle home since finishing college. I have a little adopted Frenchie named Louie. I love the mix of neighborhoods in the city and how close we are to amazing outdoor spaces.  I truly want you to have a great experience staying in my downtown apartment. Happy to help if you have any questions!
Hello!! My name is Fanus Megos  I live in Seattle Washington!!

We are a team of fun people who enjoy the honor of hosting people from all over the world who want to come see our beautiful city, rich in culture, diversity, entertainment, activities, hiking, water sports, food, and unique places of interest like MoPOP and the Space Needle.
Just a couple of married folks trying to keep our home rented out for the best financial option at this time. We welcome all folks to enjoy our Clean, Quiet, Comfy home for there getaway stays.

World traveler. Worked with and hosted and trained international and US high school students to live abroad. Coached swimming in Holland. Germany, Italy, Sicily and the US. Last trip sailing the islands of Croatia in 2018.

Retired from development work and have worked as nanny for various  families in Seattle.
I have two adult children and 2 grandchildren
