I’m a Pacific NW native. I have lived in the Seattle area for over 20 years. I have been hosting guest since 2017. I enjoy hosting and showing guests my beautiful city! When I am not hosting, I like to travel, go on foodie adventures, and being active in the great outdoors!
Im a single mother and my son is 3yrs old.. We enjoy life and love traveling.

I have lived and made my home in Seattle for nearly 25 years. My Classic Seattle Neighborhood Apartment is my way of sharing my beautiful home with you.

As an Airbnb host, I feel my job is making you feel as comfortable as possible in your home away from home. I always give the apartment a thorough cleaning before you arrive. I like to leave small gifts that make you feel welcome and safe. I will try to contact you via the Airbnb app to see if you have any concerns.

I love to answer questions about my neighborhood. Many people like to know about local restaurants, grocery stores, or parks. I can also make suggestions about transportation options or give you simple driving directions.

I'll check in with you again before you leave. I want to make sure all your needs are met, and I want to hear your suggestions on how to do things better. I'm only successful if you are happy.

Thank you for considering a stay at my apartment. I hope to hear from you soon!

“We are your home in the heart of it all.” 

SoBe is a national hospitality company providing luxury accommodations for short term business and leisure travel in core urban destinations and highly traveled cities nationwide. It's focus on high-end accommodations, customer service, and an easy customer friendly experience has made it a leader in the fast growing hotel alternative space.

52 year old.  Owner/ operator freelance camera.  

Love to travel and ride my dirt bike.

Michelle leads climate and sustainability policy for the City of Seattle and Mike is an architect. We have two children (14 and 17) and love Seattle and the Pacific Northwest. When we aren't working, in school, or engaged in youth sports (lots of soccer!), we enjoy cooking, discovering new favorite restaurants, seeing live music, camping, hiking, skiing, and connecting with friends and family. 

We are happy to offer tips and recommendations to help you experience all Seattle and the Pacific Northwest has to offer.

Hello, my name is Mariana, I am originally from Buenos Aires, Argentina but currently living in Seattle. I work as an architect at a non profit, our projects range from affordable housing and senior housing to childcare centers. I love traveling and discovering different foods and cultures from around the world. I hope you will share with me your favorite restaurant in your city!

I'm truthfully trying to be the best host I can. Originally from California, I've been settled in Seattle since 2015. I like working out, video games, reading, technology, and anything to do with the ocean.  I default to giving my guests a quiet, private experience. If you want to talk & hang out we totally can though!

I enjoy traveling (of course!), nice shops/cafes/restaurants, and a relaxed lifestyle.

I love experiencing day to day local life in different cities and connecting with people across cultures. I really enjoy hosting, and will do my best to provide you with a great place to stay!

I'm an easy going professional who likes to get out and enjoy the city. I moved to Seattle in 2001.  I enjoy live music, good food and wine, travel, the arts, and exploring. I'm well versed in attractions you'd want to check out, what restaurants are great if you are a foodie or if you're not, and what art exhibits will impress. 

I'm happy to give guidance about what you might be interested in seeing, doing, experiencing, if you'd like it. If you'd prefer to be left to your own devices, I respect that.  There are lots of different travel styles and what's important is that you are traveling.

I'm an educated professional but I prefer to be defined by the things I'm passionate about. Truth be told, I wish I traveled more and worked less. 

What I love about Air BnB is getting to meet people from the US and abroad and share the love I have for Seattle with them.
Resident physician who enjoys traveling, reading, and the outdoors.
Travel. Family. Friends... and A Good Gin & Tonic.
I love traveling. I have lived in Michigan, Texas, Vietnam, Japan and is now living in Seattle.
I love to put together custom lists of things to see based on visitor interests. Having lived in Seattle for the past 20 years, I have plenty of great local places to recommend!

We come from a large family. We love sports, cowboy movies and good home cooking to relax. We are very friendly, yet quiet folks that like to meet people.
We are thankful to have and share our family brick home with others, it is very clean, and have spacious common areas everyone is welcome to use.

Home
[Hom] noun
The residence of an individual or family; a place of refuge; the person or place you want to return to over and over

Whats up HomeSlice?1?

Too often in the current world do travelers arrive to a hotel and conclude that their choice was that of a rushed decision, an impersonal transaction, one that was made hastily that leaves them feeling like they want to forget it. At HomeSlice, we live for the arrival of a guest, who leaves as family. Our natural, collected approach of applying generous genuine interest in every guest's experience, makes every journey, our journey. At HomeSlice, we create an ideal world, where everything is where you need it to be, even if for a night. With HomeSlice you are in good company, we it handle it all, so you can take that vacation you deserve. We offer luxury vacation rental management, design and acquisition services.
63 years old.  Physician.  Travel extensively.
I'm an Architect and Inn-keeper so I have lots of experience with design and hospitality.

Hello,

I am a young professional living in Seattle. I love traveling. 
Please don't hesitate to get in touch with me for more information, I speak English, Russian.

I typically try to cram a lot in a day, and like to stay busy. From Salsa dancing to racing cyclocross bikes, my interests are all over the place. I also love to travel and explore new places. One of my favorite all time trips was to Turkey and Greece.

I’m a semi-retired former executive search consultant who loves all things travel related! Originally from Atlanta, I’ve also had the luxury of living in other major cities (including San Francisco, Philadelphia, Chicago and Munich). Performing arts, reading and biking are other passions. I have very close family relationships (even though my siblings are scattered across the U.S. and one of my daughters lives abroad) and my beautiful grandsons bring me nothing but pure joy!

Hi, my name is Elizabeth. I am a musician, ceramic artist, teacher, mother, and nature lover. I began my musical career as a Suzuki violin teacher and continued for thirty years. Pottery has always been a  passion, along with my music.  I appreciate travel, my friends and family, community, yoga, wonderful food and wine and have made my home in Seattle for decades. I enjoy sharing the beauty of the Northwest, creativity, and progressive culture.

Buddhist, attorney, poet, healer/light & energy worker, shaman, rune & tarot reader, foodie, travel writer, spiritual student of life living to the fullest in Columbia City neighborhood of Seattle.  Life is lived in the present, let's enjoy every moment, flavor and gratitude filled interaction.

Hi there! I love to host travelers and welcome them to my home in the beautiful Pacific Northwest.  It may sound cheesy, but it's been my dream to get a space that I'm able to open up and share w/ others on Airbnb for many years now--and I'm so glad I finally was able to find a unit in a gorgeous historic building in my dream location, in my favorite city on earth: Seattle.  I grew up an hour south of Seattle in a little town called Puyallup, and treasured when friends and relatives would fly in from out of town and we'd get to show them around the city.  I'd love guiding them around the sites, touring the unique neighborhoods, and introducing them to our vibrant food, art, and music scenes.  I'm so happy to have the opportunity to continue that childhood tradition, and to keep sharing a slice of the PNW life w/  those from near and far.  Enjoy your stay!

I have been hosting on Airbnb with my husband since 2011 and find so much joy in it. I also love history, culture, and science which came from watching my Dad’s love for those things. So it was special when my husband Eric & I got an opportunity to work with my Dad combining these loves fully restoring a historic craftsman home on our street. We hope you enjoy the love and creative work we’ve put into make a home away from home for your travels!

I am a birth doula, Dancing For Birth Instructor and Licensed Massage Therapist. I love dancing, outdoor sport, art and oil painting.  Another of my passions is traveling to new places around the world and get to know other people and their cultures. I am more of an individual tourist and many of my travels are planned spontaneously on the go. 
Born in Poland, I lived in Germany for 13 years before settling down 20 years ago with my husband and two children in Bellevue.
I found about Airbnb from my friends who are also hosts here in Seattle area. They enjoy very much hosting Airbnb guests , so I decided to become host myself.

My husband and I are Seattle natives who still live in our hometown. I do lots of volunteer work for environmental and sustainability causes. I have one child and one grandchild, and enjoy photography, gardening, theatre and film.
I love my hometown Seattle and every thing we have to offer.  Sharing beautiful spaces with others is everything.

we currently live in Seattle. Previously we traveled around the world, and are interested to host other travelers. We enjoy hosting guests from diverse backgrounds and experiences which we believe enriches our human experience.
Our mission is to provide a great experience for guests so they make lovely memories during their stay with us!

My husband and I moved to Seattle two years ago; we enjoyed it so much we bought a home here. Now we host on Airbnb so we can share our love for the community with others! 
We're all about "living like a tourist" in our own backyard - we seek out fun things to do and places to explore that are local and unique. 
We also enjoy hiking with our dog, kayaking and sailing, as well as cooking and gardening.

Welcome to Maple Leaf neighborhood in my beloved Seattle, also known as the Emerald City.  

My commitment to my guests is to make your stay as relaxing and memorable as possible. 

Everything you could possibly need is within your grasp.  

Walking around the neighborhood is an adventure, so bring some comfortable walking shoes and plan on getting some exercise.  Taking in the many coffee shops, cafes, and boutiques in between you will see that Seattle has adapted to Covid-19 with outdoor seating at most restaurants or Take-Out ordering. If you ever have any questions, I am always a text away with an answer and a smile!

When I am not helping my clients in the apartment, I am helping people find their way in the world of real estate as a full-time Realtor.  It brings me great joy & fulfillment when I support my clients as they search to buy a new dream home or prepare their beloved family home to Sell to a new family. 

Whatever the reason in every season, I am committed to being of service & helping my clients with their real estate needs.

I enjoy meeting people and hearing what makes them tick. I love to travel,  study architecture, art, design, food, fashion, wine, and culture. 

Having a passion for helping find homeless animals their Furever Homes, know that a percentage of your fee is donated to local Animal Shelters & Rescue organizations across the US and internationally; the animals thank you!  

In my spare time, I am seen walking my two rescue pups, Charli & Bolty, in our beautiful Maple Leaf neighborhood, Maple Leaf park, or around Greenlake park! 

Last and certainly not least, I have a passion for volunteering with Habitat 4 Humanity! I love to learn new skills and I enjoy building homes for families in need; helping put a roof over a family's heads is one of the most rewarding experiences I have had and I highly recommend it! 

My philosophy is that life is one big Adventure novel made up of lots of little exciting chapters! 

We live and we learn… 

Everyone needs a home (while on the road) where they feel safe, they can hang their hat, relax & regroup for their next adventure!

Welcome to my home & world filled with rescue animals, flower gardens, and GF muffins/cookies (which I love to bake & deliver outside your front door). 

Thank you for being our guest,
Alex, Charli & Bolty

How do I describe myself?

I like downhill skiing and saltwater fishing, scuba diving, and am learning to be a pilot.  I am self employed, divorced, and have two college age daughters.  

If you are reading this, it is probably because I am booking a trip for one of my hobbies.

Cheers!

I am a communications and intercultural specialist.  I spend a lot of time traveling for work and know what I appreciate in terms of accommodation and especially location.  My husband and I have been running a small boutique hotel in Columbia City for 8 years.   The neighborhood is special...close to rapid transit and close to the lake.  I never learned how to cook, so I love all the restaurants within 3 blocks of our place.    90% of the businesses here are locally-owned like ours and we love knowing everyone and our guests quickly becoming part of the community.  I grew up in Seattle and know the city very well and love helping guests and newcomers get the most out of their stay.  If I was asked about my life motto....I never want to look back and say..."Why didn't I?"

Happy, family oriented, clean, organized, responsible, thoughtful, trustworthy, fun, adventurous, active, reasonable. Love to travel and explore cities. Love to run, hike, ski, and rollerblade. I am raising our family with my delightful husband.
Steven and Claudia
My wife and I are both retirees and enjoy spending time with our grown children and grandchildren.  I have lived in Seattle since the 60's and enjoy gardening and tinkering around the house.

Living in Seattle and enjoying life with my family! My goal when hosting is to make sure you enjoy your stay and when staying at someone elses home, I try to leave it as it was.

I've lived in Wallingford for 14 years and it's one of the best neighborhoods in Seattle. My location for the Airbnb is extremely convenient for restaurants coffee shops and transportation to other parts of Seattle.

North Seattle writer & educator family -- We love family, dogs, & baseball (esp. Chi Cubs). Our household is LGBT- and disabled-supportive and kid- and pet-friendly.

Hi! We are Esther & Nick - professional Aussie couple who love to travel. We have visited all inhabited continents, had some amazing Airbnb experiences and made many lifelong friends in the process. We've now settled in Seattle and are hosting our own dedicated guests suites.

Hi there! We are Joanne and Jonathan. 

Even though we originally grew up in Singapore, we are proud to call Seattle our current home. Seattle has such a special meaning for us since this is where we met, got engaged and tied the knot! Hi! I've lived in Seattle long enough that I'm officially a native. We love our West Seattle neighborhood and the surrounding nature. My wife, daughter and I are excited to be able to both stay at Airbnb properties and also share our guest home with visitors to Seattle. Hi! I am from Seattle, Washington, love to travel, take pictures, climb, go running and go shopping.  Married and have two sons! Hi there! I'm Devon and I'm a flight attendant for a major airline, so I travel for a living. I prefer to stay in AirBnBs when I travel for leisure due to how much time I spend at hotels for work. I moved to Seattle from NY and couple years ago and have been cohosting with Loftium ever since.

Mother & daughter duo! We love our historic Seattle home, cozy spaces, comfy beds and making people feel welcome!   We look forward to hosting you in the historic University District of Seattle.

My name is Mike and my partner's name is Leon. We are from Seattle. We like to travel mostly for recreation and leisure. We enjoy entertaining friends at home a lot. We both love trying new cuisine and new travel destinations. Architecture and design is our hobby and passion. We have worked to make our home our refuge and appreciate it when someone takes the time to enhance their surroundings. We love good wine, especially when it's a find for under $20 a bottle. In the summer, we like going to outdoor concerts at the wineries in Woodinville or at the zoo. It's a special thing about Seattle that we love. When we travel, we like to try to find and experience the things that a local would enjoy. Not your typical tourists so we tend to ask those types of questions of hosts.

I enjoy meeting new people from all over the world. I enjoy reading a good book and playing scrabble! In Seattle, we are HUGE on recycling, drinking water, exercising and biking to work, or using public transportation for commuting to work. I am a non-smoker and do not enjoy the smell of cigarette smoke, or picking up cigarette butts along the properties. Hence, please do not smoke on the properties or near the properties. Thank you for your cooperation!

Why take a chance picking & choosing between so many individual hosts when you can enjoy the highest-quality guest experience from one consistent host -- Blueground. We are a global real estate tech company offering +3500 fully-equipped & furnished apartments for a month, a year or longer across 15 cities and 3 continents. Centrally-based in vibrant neighborhoods, each home is tech-powered & furnished by our expert Interior Design teams. Enjoy at-home amenities like high-speed WiFi, a fully-stocked kitchen, smart TV, premium bedding/towels, quality toiletries, and depending on the apartment choice -- artisan coffee, bluetooth speakers & select building amenities such as pools, gyms & outdoor spaces. From meal, wine & grocery delivery to laundry & dry-cleaning right to your door, our guests can choose from a number of service benefits. Each apartment is safe & professionally sanitized.

During your stay
Driven by a mission to help you show up & start living, Blueground is proud to host thousands of guests around the world in the following cities: New York, Los Angeles, San Francisco, Boston, Chicago, Washington D.C., Seattle, Denver, Austin, Dubai, Istanbul, Paris, London, Vienna and Athens. Upon arrival, you’ll either be greeted personally by a Blueground team member or given self check-in instructions. The entire apartment is yours to enjoy; and for additional support, our Client Experience team is available via phone, email & our Guest App through which you can schedule additional cleanings, request fresh towels/linens, submit maintenance requests, and view neighborhood recommendations. We’ll share all details upon confirmation of your stay.

I love to travel and I love to host! I’m kind and respectful. 

If you stay in my place, you will have an awesome, clean, quiet, and comfortable stay. I can provide helpful local recommendations (if you like), or leave you alone to enjoy your privacy. 

If I stay in your place, I will treat it as my own. I clean up after myself, am courteous to neighbors, and always park between the lines. :)

My boyfriend and I are looking to host our apartment for the first time while we're out of town for three months. This is our first listing, so we won't have any previous reviews for hosting, but we promise to do our best to make sure you have a great stay. : )

Like you, we love to go to different, exciting and beautiful places but we wanted to have an affordable accommodation where we can be safe, sound, secure and at the same time have the comforts of our home, if not better. 
 
We opened our homes 13 years ago to Airbnb and have been a 13th Level Airbnb Superhost. But, before that, we hosted international students pursuing their degrees in the US. We worked with a local homestay agency which partnered with the Everett Community College (EVCC). As part of the process, the homestay agency checks 
our recent criminal background since we are taking care of young international students ranging from ages 8-21 years old.  We have hosted children of CEO’s, lawyers, doctors, dentists, businessmen, and even professors from Banda Aceh in Indonesia who come here for an exchange partnership with EVCC!

Our  mottoes  in life are:
“If you were blessed with opening your eyes today, you have the opportunity to  positively affect the energy and growth of people around you” (Thanks to Yolanda Hadid) and  "Buy yourself and your children the experience of travel".  

We have traveled to 87 countries but our favorite places to vacation regularly  are Hawaii, Philippines, Japan and Mexico. Also, we love to go back to places where we have visited and spend more time are: Caribbean (Cuba and Puerto Rico), Great Britain, Belgium, Iceland, the Baltic countries, Scandinavian countries and Southeast Asia. 

We believe that no matter what differences we have, we still wanted the same thing - to be loved, to belong and to be appreciated. 

Aloha and Mahalo! Mabuhay!
Thank you very much.

Hello! My name is Laura and I live in Seattle with my husband, Tahoma, and our four-year-old daughter, Corinne. I work as an independent consultant, as well as managing our rental properties. Tahoma puts on 5, 10 and 15K running & walking events in the greater Seattle area (search Magnuson Series for upcoming events). Tahoma and I are born and raised in the Pacific Northwest and absolutely love it here! We are very passionate about the environment and Tahoma runs a non-profit, EarthRuns, which encourages the planting of native species throughout Seattle. We are thrilled to be able to share this beautiful area that we love with others by hosting our backyard Tiny House and our 10-bedroom Chalet on Airbnb. We look forward to meeting you!

French American couple living in NYC - love to travel!  You'll discover the places we've been from the many guidebooks on the bookshelves.  Our new favorite destination so far is Costa Rica.  We moved from Manhattan to Brooklyn a year ago and never looked back - we're obsessed with the friendly, up and coming vibe of this stunning part of New York City.  

Our apartment is just 1 block from the Q, R, and B train.  The next stop on the Q train is Canal Street for Soho Shopping (10-15 min away).  

Our building is at the foot of Fort Greene, with its stunning park, Saturday greenmarket, and world class restaurant scene.  We will arm you with local recommendations for some of the best meals you could have in NYC - from New Italian, farm to table,  and even an outstanding South African hot spot, all walking distance.

I was born in Madaba, Jordan, and immigrated with my family to the United States when I was a very young child. I grew up in Seattle, and hold B.A. and M.A. degrees from the University of Washington. I have lived and traveled extensively throughout the Middle East, North Africa, Iran, and Europe.

The history of the Zawaideh clan is fascinating. My lineage can be traced back to the earliest roots of man in Yemen. My ancestors were among the first settled tribes to migrate from that area, moving northeast to what is now southern Iraq and later to what are now the modern countries of Jordan and Syria. 

You can read more about my family history in our Welcome Book during your stay. I come from a culture of hospitality and exploration, and I hope you will get a taste of that during your stay at the Caravan-Serai Inn.

I live in Seward Park in Seattle with my husband Steve Hanson. I am a real estate broker and run a small real estate company, Orvis & Orvis Real Estate. My husband is a tech writer and  photographer. Dana and I have lived in Seattle for over 10 years. We enjoy exploring the PNW and hosting travelers.  We have two young daughters and it is a delight to experience the world through their eyes.

Hi! My name is Crystal and I management Airbnb’s. Before doing this full time I was selling beer for a living. It wasn’t an easy job but someone had to do it.

I've been hosting guests and helping others host their homes for several years. Please let me know what you need during your stay and I would be happy to help. I also have a full team behind me that can assist you with your questions or request.

I have lived in the Bay Area for over 15 years and thoroughly enjoy all of the great ethnic cuisines at our fingertips. We are a couple originally from France and we have been living in the Seattle Area since 2019.  We love to travel whenever we have a chance, we tried the "digital nomad" life and we want to go even further by traveling full time for 3 months this winter in South of America (Colombia and Brazil are in the program). 

As traveler, we use airbnb a lot when traveling because we think it is part of what is making our trip unique. The place or the host have usually something special that we cannot find in hotels. What is fun is that now, we have the opportunity to be in the hosting side :) We really enjoy the idea that our little home might bring some happiness to guests from everywhere. 

Hope you will find something special here. 
Christophe & Dorette.

It was quite random that we ended up finding our place in the Seward Park Neighborhood of Seattle and we couldn't be happier here.  Four years ago we remodeled our house, added a level and created  our basement apartment which we look forward to welcoming guests to enjoy.  

This is amazing neighborhood - just two blocks to the lake and Seward Park.  One spring and early summer evenings you will see the Great Blue Heron returning from the lake to feed their chicks nested in the rookery that is just across the street from where you will be staying.    It is very common to see our resident Eagles hunting or teaching their young ones to fly. 

We live in the main house with our adorable 3 year old puppy Remy, and our 2 year old tripod rescue, Sunny

We work from home.   My philosophy as a host is that we will leave you to enjoy your stay but are here for you if you have any questions or need anything during your stay.

I love to bake and sometimes will leave a sweet treat from our kitchen to welcome you.
Newly-minted empty-nesters, enjoying our active lifestyle in and around LA (and now Seattle), with occasional trips abroad.
(Phone number hidden by Airbnb)

Heya my name's Jeff! I've been living and working in Seattle for 10 years now and just bought my first home here! Some of my favorite things around Seattle include hitting up the roller rink, going to local live music, frequenting the local dive bar for some pool or karaoke, going out for a fancy cocktails, riding my bike around town late at night, longboarding, disc golfing, and hanging out with friends in the park. I also try to save some time for all my artsy hobbies which include film photography, making indie games, writing, reading, painting, 3d printing, and whatever other things I randomly get obsessed with.

I am a complete homebody. I love to cook for my young family and throw dinner parties. When I discovered airbnb I could finally add travel to the list of things I enjoy. 
Originally from India, I am happy to call Seattle home for the past 12 years. I am still discovering new places and in total awe of the city. Glad to host and share the beauty & charm of Queen Anne.
We love to travel and to see new, beautiful places! We are passionate about local spots, good food and fun places to hang out. We like to take our pup, Arlo, everywhere we can.

World travelling Gypsy soul and happiest with a tinge of jet fuel tickling my nose and some fabulous outfits stowed in my steamer trunk.  Mother to a topsy turvy 12 year old boy and his Doodle menace sidekicks Chewbacca and Bella Diablo. Hi i'm Andy, and I live in Seattle Washington with my wife Christina. I'm a designer by day, and enjoy making thing in my workshop, and spending time with my wife Christina and our two cats.

Born and raised in Vancouver, BC, I'm a huge fan of the Pacific Northwest and all it has to offer. I spent 20 years as a co-owner and operator in the restaurant business. Raised in Memphis, Tennessee then 10 years in Austin, Texas lead me to Seattle 30 years ago.  I was extremely fortunate to find this home on Phinney Ridge for sale.  At that time the house had had very few updates since it was built in 1916 and needed a lot of work.  I love to host.  I've had many dinner parties and good times here.  I bring my southern hospitality attitude into my everyday life.  Most recently I spend my time consulting for bakery cafes and bookkeeping for various small businesses. I also owned a bed and breakfast for 10 years in a small mountain resort town here in Washington (Leavenworth). My business partner and I added a commercial kitchen and turned it into an Inn offering dining and lodging. I love to sail, ride motorcycles and camp out in my Westfalia Van.
I live in Seattle but I'm nomad at heart.  Full-time biologist / biotech engineer, part-time tiny home builder.

I love where I live!  I also enjoy exploring other areas of the Pacific Northwest and beyond. Where do I like to stay?  I can go from a modern big city experience to a funky eclectic cabin on the water or in the woods.   I have a love for interior design and the overall aesthetics of living spaces.  Attention to small details can make me swoon!  Meeting new people from all walks of life is a huge perk.  Enriching opportunities in both travel and hosting are one of the reasons I love using Airbnb.

Life Motto:  Too much of a good thing can be wonderful (Mae West).

Hospitality is second nature to me. I feel gratitude and delight whenever I am able to facilitate other people having a good time or give that gift to another person. I believe that people thrive in safe & fun communities, and that's what I want my AirBnB experience to be all about as a host and as a guest.

I have translators available for Spanish, Chinese and Korean if that is your preferred language.  Please let me know!
I work in the healthcare field and love to travel when I have spare time. Originally from Seattle

My favorite things would be trying new foods, photography, traveling, and spending time with our cats. Traveling and getting to experience new things is always a special and memorable experience.

My partner Kat and I have made it our mission to try as many restaurants as possible wherever we are. Need a recommendation? Want to share your favorite restaurant? Let us know!

My name is Grace and I’m fun, extrovert and easy going! I’m enthusiastic about food and travelling. I also enjoy meeting new people and familiarizing myself with other cultures. This is, essentially, why I’ve decided to become an Airbnb host.

Vivian is a very active person. She loves travelling, meeting new people, and trying authentic local food. She has been to more than 15 countries so far and she loves to explore more in the world. Currently she lives in Seattle working as a product manager.

I’m an artist and a mother who loves to travel for work and fun. I’m all about art all the time so you will probably see my travel is art related. I prefer Airbnb’s to hotels because they are less corporate and I’m supporting local people while I’m in town.

My career has taken me to many places around the world. Most recently I relocated to Seattle from London UK. I hope your stay in my house will do that and bring the best memories of what this beautiful paradise know as Seattle is all about!     

Luckily I found an amazing place to live by Capitol Hill, a vibrant area near fantastic restaurants, shops and bars, close to downtown and yet surprisingly quiet and safe. 

My house comprises three units: 2 studios that I airbnb and a main apartment where I live. The studios have independent access, providing 24hr access with a superb level of privacy and comfort.

I'm very relaxed, fun and easy going should you want meet me to give you advice on the area, grab coffee/drink or simply say hi.  

Have a pleasant stay and do not hesitate to contact me for anything you need.

Renato

We work in e-commerce and media - our work often takes us traveling for business, and we love meeting other travelers while on a trip or hosting, and really enjoy discovering local customs in eating and drinking. Local history, design, and vintage homes (architecture and interior design) are interests of ours.

Hosteeva was born out of our passion for travel and a need to revolutionize how vacation rentals should be managed. We are Hyeryeong, Nate, and Guri. We are working professionals with some extra room in our house. Nate works from home most days and Hyeryeong works 3 days a week at a nearby hospital. When we're not working, we are exploring the city with our dog Guri, playing board games, or streaming something.
Experienced traveler and host, I look forward to welcoming you.
We give away hundreds of pounds of free veggies grown in our front yard urban garden, named MidBeaconFarm. Excited to share our little slice of heaven in the middle of Seattle.
Hi! I love to travel and to meet new people. I look forward to welcoming you to my place in Seattle :)

My husband and I are excited to share our property with you.  We are active seniors and love to bike...I love to hike and backpack as well.  We hosted an airbnb on Vashon where we lived until two years ago.  Now we are in the 3rd oldest house standing in Seattle...a beautiful Victorian built in 1886 !  We  rent the basement apartment out as an air bnb...we loved hosting before and look forward to doing so in the city!  We also occasionally rent out our own apartment which is on the first floor of this lovely Victorian!  Seattle is such a vibrant city and we love to share it with others!  Come visit!

I am a Seattle native, born and raised in the city. I love Seattle and I enjoy sharing good recommendations with people new to the city! I travel frequently and almost always stay in Airbnb’s. 
Some of my favorite things to do in Seattle: 
-Spending time close to Lake Union
-Going out to get delicious food 
-Taking walks through many of the city’s great parks!

I've been a Seattle resident for 22 years -- originally from the East Coast. My hobbies include collecting just about anything vintage including Ethnic Art,  Americana, and MCM home furnishings.    I also enjoy wine tasting parties with friends and travelling in Europe.

We have lived in Seattle for  20 years. I am an artist, business owner, mom and wife.  I love Seattle and have lived in many different neighborhoods. I can give you suggestions for just about any activity you would like to explore. My family loves to travel and we almost always use airbnb and have had great experiences. We like to get to know a new place in a non tourist way, and hope to help our guests do the same thing in Seattle.
We're a family of five who likes to spend time outside.

Moe was  born and raised in Lebanon, studied in Ukraine and England and worked here as programmer until he start his real-estate venture. Oksana was born in Ukraine, she loves history since she is History graduate she teach history and wrote a monography.
 We are avid travelers, love traveling anywhere. Always looking for new adventures - Ukraine, Italy, Russia, China, Malaysia, Lebanon, Turkey... Moe likes soccer, Oksana likes horseback riding; both are not bad swimmers.

I have spent most of my life in Seattle except for 12 years in Portland as a child and 10 years in Alaska in my 20s. I love the Pacific Northwest and I'm proud to call this my home. Hello!

I'm a motion graphic designer, videographer and photographer.  When I'm not creating I enjoy traveling and exploring new places with my puppy Addie.

Welcome to our little blue cottage! We're Hillary and Stefan and we can't wait to host you!

We love exploring new cultures and new places and meeting new people. And we're so excited to finally be able to host fellow adventurers in our own home.

We love coffee, dogs and the outdoors, so yeah we feel pretty at home here in the great PNW.

Hey there! 
My name is Ariaan Cardenas and I am a young short term rental specialist here on Airbnb.

We often get travelers who are regulars and come back month after month just because they love our homes.

I would consider myself to be very easy going, I get along with almost anyone and enjoy traveling to new places. I mostly stay in AirBnB when I'm traveling for fun and definitely appreciate interacting with my host. I love to get out and explore as much as possible.
Seattle based artist, musician and other things that seem interesting at the time

Hello! My name is Mike and have been in Seattle since 1996. I like to practice yoga daily and be in the mountains hiking and backpacking. If you have any questions about my Airbnb in Ballard, please don’t hesitate to contact me.

I taught dentistry at a college for 14 years since 2006. Enjoying the full-time real estate hospitality business now. Finishing up my doctorate. Love to host responsible, professional, and easy-going guests.
Texas native now calling Seattle home! Love traveling and love hosting

I am a mixologist, volleyball player and love traveling, cooking and exercising. For the last 20 years, I've lived in New York & Seattle. I know my way around both so I am happy to recommend a great restaurant, bar, rooftop, broadway show, and much more!

I am an urban designer and planner, relocated from NYC to Seattle. My husband and I frequently travel (and Airbnb) together! 

I love the outdoors, exploring local restaurants and bars, and getting to know new places.

Hello!

I'm a long-term Seattle resident. There is plenty I can tell you about whilst staying in Capitol Hill. I love sharing the experience of residing in this fabulous city and cozy home.

I will always try to meet your expectation and even go beyond the expectation of your stay. If you have suggestions for me, please let me know!

Some great features I have are due to the inspirations of other guests that stayed with me and had interesting ideas. So please don't hesitate to let me know your thoughts. Feel free to communicate with me!

Kate

I've lived in Seattle since 2009 and I'm always happy to share my appreciation for this beautiful, creative city.
I work as a videographer/photographer, and my husband  is a public artist. We are always looking for a new DIY project to tackle.

Aside from 8 years living in Hawai'i teaching middle school math, I've spent my life rooted in Seattle (born and raised) and find that there are still new things to explore all the time! 

I love to travel, hike, meet new people and try new foods. Some of my favorite places I've been include Tahiti, Brazil, Israel, and Thailand, but at the end of every trip, I always do look forward to coming HOME. I try to curate a space that feels like a home away from home for any guest. 

I'm interested in always learning and gaining new knowledge. Part of this, comes from meeting new people from different walks of life.
Quiet, fun loving person who loves to make the most out of the day.  Born and raised in Seattle, WA I have a huge desire to get out and see alot of the world and its wonders.

We are a designer/builder couple living in beautiful Seattle WA. We list our hand built home on our families small urban farm near Lake Washington. We are both artists and love to create beautiful spaces.
Love expanding and creating.  We have a small farm on the Columbia River that takes up a lot of that expansion and creation, but travel is a great companion to inspire new ideas.
Grow up in Indonesian with multicultural background, I always love to meet new people.

Hello and welcome! Zach and Katie here. Born and raised in the PNW, married at 19, started a family 5 years later, and now we have three minis running around us everywhere we go. They are a joy and a gift, and we can't wait to show them the world! For now, we take them camping and hiking as often as possible - the mountains and trees here have a way of captivating our attention constantly. 

Zach is a youth pastor for middle school and high school students,  and Katie is an outdoor elopement photographer. We opened our first Airbnb in June of 2021 in Capitol Hill and truly have loved  hosting. It's been so much fun to provide a space for travelers to rest and explore. When setting it up, it was important to us to provide all the necessities; we know what it's like to book a place w/o the basics, and we wanted our guests to have all they needed for the sake of ease and a seamless trip.

Our apartment is in a building that's over 100 years old, so there are various quirks (small bathroom, and sometimes a stiff door lock), but what it lacks in modern updates, we hope the comfort of the space and the hospitality makes up for. If you have any questions during your stay, please don't hesitate to message or call us!
Travel enthusiast. A wife, mother, and daugher. Welcome to Queen Ann Hill of Seattle!
Hello! Feel free to send a message on Airbnb if you need any help.

Young architect working in the city. You'll catch me in the Capitol Hill and Belltown areas here in Seattle and I've been out of town for a while so relearning the new parts of this city is still exciting for me! And if I'm not at the gym, having a movie wine and cooking night at home, hiking with my dog is one of my favorite things to do in the area.

Our Chef Team loves showing both visitors and locals the abundant and unique production and artisans of the Northwest. We've designed educational and delicious tours and classes that take place in Pike Place Market to show off our seasonal food and artisanal vendors.
I'm a pilot currently living in Seattle. Prior to that I was flying planes in Southeast Asia for a year and West Africa for two years.  I love to travel!

I was born and raised in a small town in Alaska, but since then have been moving around quite a bit.  I went to school in Philadelphia, lived in DC, San Francisco, Houston and Seattle, and have been commuting to KC for work for the last year.

I love to travel, and am excited to share my home to allow others to travel to Kansas City.  I'd love to make your visit as memorable as possible - please let me know anything I can do to make your stay memorable.

Seattle-based dad of two and high tech professional. Graduated from University of Michigan and MIT. When traveling to big cities for work or vacation, prefer to get a more authentic experience by being in a residential neighborhood.

I love to travel, meet new people, bike, watch movies, read and anything to do with the water.  I'm a considerate, quiet guest.  I treat other people's belongings and home the way that I would treat my own.
I love adventures, big and small.

Hi! My name is Olivia Lee. I was born and raised in Korea and moved to US in 2008, after working as a pharmacist in large hospitals for 5 years. Before coming to Seattle, I lived in sunny San Diego and now I enjoy the green Seattle with drizzling rain for almost 10 years. Surprisingly, I prefer Seattle weather over San Diego!

I love art and interior design, which led me to start an AirBnB business in the lovely Fremont area (especially food!). I hope you enjoy the space I decorated and would like to hear what you think. I'm looking forward to seeing you!
Welcome to Seattle and thank you for your interest in our beautiful home. We are sure you will enjoy it as much as we do, as well as this amazing city.

Originally from England I have been travelling the world for 50 years and really appreciate affordable, unique stays and great hospitality. I have always found that staying at locally owned, smaller places is the very best way to enjoy any town. I co-host Lakeridge Gardens with my wife Dah, from southern Thailand-(who I met while travelling!).
We share the house with our two lovely indoor/outdoor young cats & both work full-time (including on weekends). While our space is a newer listing; we are certainly not newbies when it comes to travel & hospitality and as such plan to make your stay a very memorable one. As a Seattle native for the pst 30+ years I am also very well versed and very well connected to to the town. I worked in the entertainment (music, festivals and bicycle event production) for many years and we are quite the local foodies. Our location & suite is just superb for year round stays; we have the best beaches & parks in the city right at your doorstep. We are updating our local attraction  in our local guide book weekly with great "inside" tips for our guests.  I tend to lean more towards  authentic, family run food choices that offer good value and proven good food . Do not hesitate to ask for any recommendations during your stay
I don't spend too much time at my accommodations when I'm traveling, but when I do I'm pretty clean and just use it to sleep / wind down.
I'm a homeowner, landlord, & accountant living in Seattle.  I'm really just down to earth / easy going and giving Airbnb a try.  Thanks.

As a flight attendant/pilot couple, we are no strangers to travel! We love animals and have a farm on Maui, complete with dogs, goats, and sheep! 

We are both very clean and respectful people.  When we travel, we treat every residence as if it were our own — the way we hope all guests do in return!

Homeowner for 46 years in this historic neighborhood. Retired from Seattle School District as Librarian, French and Latin teacher. Worked with bilingual English learners for last 15 years before retirement. 
Currently working on becoming a silversmith and jeweler and still do sewing, knitting and handweaving. Have traveled extensively in France and Italy and now go to Mexico for jewelry classes and cultural visits, specifically Oaxaca, where many Seattlites go in the winter!
Hi, I’m Mary Anne. I’m an artist and therapist and I call Seattle home. I love traveling and hosting and look forward to hearing from you!
We are a group of 4 hosts who have joined forces to create Betterstay. We have a simple mission - to provide a 5-star experience. We look forward to hosting you!

My name is Bri and I’m from the Metro Detroit area! I’m an avid traveler and have stayed throughout Spain, Argentina, Brazil, Costa Rica, and the States! 
As a host, I want to provide a five star experience and simplify traveling with kids. You’re invited to stay at Casa Lolita   and live your best PNW adventure!

We are a little family happy to share our home with others in order to provide a unique experience and also help make ends meet!  I'm a teacher who loves her job but lives for summer, when we're usually camping and exploring new corners of the world.  My husband is a master of the odd job! Sunset Flat is our offering to the traveler community: safe, warm, inviting, clean, peaceful, and with everything you need for your vacation or business travel.  When we travel, we love to have a home base to relax, rejuvenate, and of course, cook good food and drink good wine.  We hope our home can offer the same to you!

I'm a software engineer. I travel and work a lot. I enjoy hiking, video games, bicycling, motorcycles, local beers, and a good cup of coffee or tea. I listen to electronic, industrial and rock music.

I'm originally from Madrid, Spain but I've been to every continent except Africa, Antartica and Australia. I've lived in the US for most of the my life in the northeast and now in the northwest.

I speak English and Spanish Fluently, I know a little bit of French and I'm trying to learn German and Polish on the side.

To have me as a guest:
- I'll generally be exploring your city, so I won't be around much. 
- If I'm in the room/apt I'll be resting, working remotely or looking for things to do before I head out.
- I'll be quiet and try not to bother you much.
- I don't ask for much, besides that the place is clean, safe and livable.

To have me as a host:
- I try to stay out of your way, but I'll be available electronically if something happens.
- I can recommend you places to eat, hang out, see, how to get there, etc
Real Estate Services

Hi there ~ This is Van and my boyfriend John. We have been living and working in Seattle for 6 years now and Seattle is by far our most favorite city in the US. In our free time, we love to travel, cook, dine out, hike, watch Netfix and play board games. We are easy going and very interested in exploring new places, meeting new people, and learning about new cultures.

We have been Airbnb guests and hosts for over 8 years, and really love the Airbnb experience! Seattle is particularly gorgeous in the summer with so many things to see and do. We look forward to the opportunity to making your Seattle stay extra delightful. :)
Pacific northwesterner and wanna-be world traveler.

We're from the Pacific Northwest and love learning new languages, traveling, and making friends with people from all over the world...

We love being hosts in the beautiful city of Seattle and hope our home helps you enjoy it to its fullest!
Loves travel

Hi we’re Kim and Chuck who love Alki! We’ve lived here over 30 years. We’ve just opened our Airbnb - steps from Alki Beach! Clean, modern, newly remodeled, cool and comfortable, with Alki beach decor. I’ve been in the travel business 39 years, Chuck has been in the building business 40 years. Together we hope you’ll like the results in our Alki Beach Getaway! We’ve got everything you need to feel welcome and at home…and live like a local while you’re here! Park your car and walk to restaurants and shops. Rent a bike, scooter, kayak, or paddleboard. Head downtown, or on a ferry. Or grab your book, a provided beach towel, and relax at the beach across the street!

We are a fun-loving couple with a passion for travel and the outdoors. We try to get the MOST out of every place we are lucky enough to visit and love meeting new people from all over the world.

We live bi-coastal spending most of our time in our Ballard, Seattle, USA home with split time in our Pennsylvania hometown + wherever the wind takes us. Wes is a whitewater kayaker and both of us are outdoor adventure lovers. We love to play both Airbnb host and guest! Great to meet ya!
Live in Seattle greater area. I am passionate to connect with people from different backgrounds and cultures. I love traveling, history, and technology.
Hello! My name is Raeanne and my husband, Marche, and I are so excited to rent out our newly converted garage into a cottage! We hope you'll love it,  just as much as we do!

Originally from Idaho, my husband and I came to Seattle 35 years ago and raised our 3 children here in West Seattle. Currently empty nesters with space to share.  Although interactions with guests will be limited, we want all your needs met and look forward to being your hosts.

Hi! I’m Jerald and I grew up in Seattle. My super partner Amy and I personally run our three homes because we enjoy interacting with our guests, and seeing them fall in love with the PNW while having a beautiful place to relax. We work to travel, and travel to eat! I love giving food and tourist recommendations to our guests, let me know if you need some ideas!
My family and I live in Seattle where we love to walk, play in the water, and enjoy delicious food!

We're a couple of laid-back, former Peace Corps sweethearts. Now, we both teach for Seattle-area Community Colleges, spend time with our young son and our little dog at Greenlake, ride our bikes all over our beautiful city and beyond, and continue to travel whenever we can.  We're happy to meet visitors and help out with recommendations of tourist attractions, restaurants, bike routes, etc.!
Enthusiastic traveller
I love hosting people and give opportunity for my guests to experience Seattle at affordable price
Respectful of other people and their places.  I like to have fun and know those around me do as well.  I dance.

Hello!
My name is Patrick. Both my partner, Ryan and I grew up in seattle. We love this city and are so excited to share it with you.

We will always try to meet your expectation and even go beyond the expectation of your stay. If you have suggestions for us, please let us know!

Some great features we have are due to the inspirations of other guests that stayed with us and had interesting ideas. So please don't hesitate to let us know your thoughts. Feel free to communicate with us!

Ryan and Patrick

I'm Linda! 

We are part time Seattlites & Californains! As a photographer I travel a ton and have a great cohosting team in Seattle :)

Hello, my name is Neil and I look forward to hosting you. I am a Seattle native that recently graduated from the University of Washington. I've been hosting for over a year now and have been fortunate enough to meet people like you who have come to Seattle for business, family and vacation.

I am currently working as a researcher at Seattle Children's Hospital while finishing up a few courses before I apply to medical school. Although I am busy most of the day, I hope you enjoy your time here.  I can give you recommendations, tell you about my experiences with airbnb, or serve you a really nice cup of tea. 

I am looking for guests that are friendly and self-sufficient. I always try to make myself available but with my busy schedule I also ask for your patience and understanding.

My family and I live near the Green Lake with our two rescue kitties—Cricket & Junebug. We love this area so much that we’d like to share this area with you through our Airbnb stay. We’re available for questions as needed and can be your resources for great food options around the town or advice on what to expect if you’re about to start your new life/job/internship in Seattle (I've been working for Amazon for the past 7 years).
I’m a research scientist from Seattle who does Alzheimer’s research.

I have visited around 80 cities across 40 countries all over the world, mostly solo. I like to explore new places by walking around until my legs give up. I am very curious about what makes us different and what brings us together. As a guest, I am quiet and easy-going.  I don't smoke.  I usually don't stay up past mid-night.  I like to cook occasionally and I like a comfortable bed in a quiet room. I enjoy interacting with the host and others, as long as I’m not imposing! I use Airbnb partly because getting to know people adds to the richness of the experience of traveling and discovering the world.

We're a family of four + pampered dog and a feisty cat. 
We are two city slickers who met while skydiving in northern California, settling roots in North Beach/Ballard of Seattle in 2005.  We are an active family that would love to introduce you the bountiful wonders of Seattle and beyond.

Hello,
I live in West Seattle Wa. with my husband Robert.  We recently decided to let our apartment out as an Airbnb..a new adventure and way of meeting people from all walks of life. We continue to travel and explore new places, taking bikes, kayaks and backpacks as we go. I have been a landscape designer and gardener for much of my life, I love the natural world, its a constant source of wonder and joy!
Hello! My husband and I live in Seattle and love to travel. After years of renting our apartment to long-term renters, we're excited to join airbnb as hosts.

I live in the Seattle area and own Emerald Vista Properties, LLC, a women-owned small business. I'm so excited to share my condo in Westlake with the Airbnb community from around the country and the world. Welcome to your home away from home!

I am a grandmother of 2 boys that I take care of every now and then at my son's house.  I started hosting inspired by my daughter who has been to 50+ countries preferring Airbnb to other options. I've lived in Seattle for over 20 years and can  recommend on restaurants, bars and activities that I source from my 30something kids.

My dog Emerald & I split my time between Seattle & Boise where I work as a real estate agent in both cities, but my colorful bungalow in West Seattle is our home sweet home. I’m passionate about exploring the outdoors and the world beyond. I'd love to help you get the most out of your Seattle experience while I'm off seeing new places. You'll get a cozy, convenient place to use as a jumping off point for your adventures, and I'm happy to share city tips and recommendations for my favorite things to do - just ask! And of course, if you fall in love with the Emerald City while you’re here, I would be honored to help you find a place to call your own here.

Hi! I'm a parent, author, and hobby farmer living in Seattle's Ballard neighborhood with my family. I'm married to Dan, who works in the travel industry, and we have two awesome kids. Our roots go way back in the Pacific Northwest, but before settling in Seattle for good, we lived as far away as Amsterdam and Australia. We love our friendly, colorful, epicurean, walkable, bikeable, open-hearted neighborhood--and the truly spectacular region we're lucky to call home. Traveling the world with our kids, we've always looked for farm stays, fresh eggs, backyard goats, blooming gardens, and other features that keep us close to the refreshing magic of the natural world. In fact, it was an Airbnb host in Oregon (Sweet Springs Family Farm) who inspired us to add bunnies to our homestead, and an Airbnb host in France (Aux Fenêtres du Château) serving bitty brown speckled eggs at breakfast who kindled our interest in keeping a flock of quail at home in Seattle. We have always enjoyed hosting Airbnb guests over the years in our primary residence (Hummingbird House in Ballard) whenever we've taken off on family adventures. In summer 2021, after 9 precious years with our kids growing up side by side, our beloved next-door neighbors moved away. They sold their beautiful home to us, so we could expand our farm and begin hosting guests full-time. We look forward to welcoming you to Peach Street Farm, Seattle's first urban farmstay, where you can relax and explore at your own pace.

Hello! I grew up in Texas and moved to the Pacific Northwest in 2002 after selling my business in San Antonio.  With my love for nature, I find this area of the world to be refreshing and inspiring.

I have been renting out homes on Airbnb since 2014 to support myself and my cat, Mr. Puggles. I love designing and creating homes for guest to enjoy while they embark on their travels.

I enjoy hiking and exploring the Pacific Northwest.  I also love to read, garden and paint!  I am passionate about being the healthiest version of myself and helping others attain better health through clean foods, being outdoors, and qigong.

I host on Airbnb because I love meeting new people from all over the world and sharing comfortable homes where you can create lasting memories during your stay. I will do my absolute best to make your stay a stellar one and welcome you like an old friend.

Laidback and experienced traveler/host. Having travelled and stayed in many Airbnb's I know how hard it can be when being away from home feels inconvenient. Our space is designed to be as accommodating as possible to make your stay comfortable and carefree..

I love to travel, meet new people, and learn new things. I'm a full time Project Manager but I am also a Vlogger (The Divorcee Diaries on YouTube). I’m born and raised in Seattle and am happy to share any suggestions about the city and where you can find the best eateries and sites!
Florist in Seattle. Love getaways out of the city.
Pacific Northwest Host providing excellent customer service.

Hi! We are new to Airbnb as hosts but have been guests on many occasions! Our wonderful experiences have lead us on this path to host an Airbnb of our own.  We love to travel and have lived in many different cities but Seattle is by far our favorite. We want you all to have a very comfortable experience in our Airbnb and have an amazing time exploring our favorite city.
Married with two adult children living across the country from each other so lots of travel for me!

I live in Seattle and have raised three beautiful children here in the city of water as we call it. My family and I enjoy skiing, water sports, boating and all that the beautiful Pacific Northwest has to offer. We feel blessed to have the water minutes away from our home. I enjoy horse back in the area with my horse and cookouts in the motorhome with friends and family.
Mama to a beautiful girl and handsome boy. I love to travel, spend time with my husband, and shopping.

I am a mama & acupuncturist living in Seattle WA. Our family enjoys world travel, exploring nature, archeological sites, connecting with friends new and old, and artful living. We look forward to meeting you!

Hi! We’re Evolve, the hospitality team that helps you rest easy when you rent a private, professionally cleaned home from us.

We've moved 10 times in 6 years and lived all over the world. From Sri Lanka and Pakistan, to bouncing around the West Coast, life hasn't been boring. My husband Daniel is an experienced rock climber and mountaineer and would be happy to provide suggestions for your outdoor adventures in the PNW. My name is Jamie and my husband Ken and our 3 kids live about 20 minutes outside Seattle.  Ken and I met at the University of Washington almost 20 years ago.  I have been a stay-at-home mom for almost twelve years while also managing our 2 Seattle rental houses.  About 2 years ago I became a certified personal trainer and currently coach Orangetheory classes in Bothell.  After many years of thinking about turning one of our rentals into a short term rental, we finally made the jump.  We hope you enjoy the Ballard Basecamp and all Seattle has to offer.

I am a software developer in the city. I love to travel, hike, hang out with my and meet new people. Among my many hobbies, I enjoy seeking out the best happy hour spots, following the latest fashion trends and planning my next trip. Ask me for bar and restaurant recommendations!

Farmer-in-training. Beeswax candle maker. Can be found cooking, hiking, fermenting everything I can get my hands on, reading and writing sci-fi, cozied up with queer community, and loving on my sweet partner and kitty. 

Ask me about shellfishing and seaweed foraging, easy-to-medium hike recommendations, and to tour our garden!

Hi, I'm Maria. I've lived everywhere but am currently based in Seattle. I love punk music, spicy food, travel, and making leather and fabric wearables. I love learning about different cultures and hope to see as much of the world as I can. I'm very friendly and respectful of shared spaces.

We have lived in Seattle for 18 years and love our city. We especially enjoy Pritchard Beach's wetlands, Kubota Garden's paths, majestic Mt Rainier's views, Seward Park's forests, and of course Alki Beach's sand. We have two kids that enjoy meeting our guests and learning about the world.

Hello! I am an Ohio native who has been a big city person ever since I left. I now live in Seattle by way of Washington DC, NYC, Chicago, and Philadelphia. I own a beautiful home in Seattle and love sharing it with others when I am out of town for work or vacation.

I'm a Seattle native and enjoy hosting in the Pacific Northwest as well as traveling myself. I've enjoyed staying with hosts around the world and look forward to welcoming guests from all nationalities, genders, races, religions, and orientations. Happy to share recommendations for anyone exploring Seattle.

Barrett is originally from Portland, Maine, and Kristen is from Cleveland, Ohio. We have lived on the east coast for the last 30+ years and we are new to Seattle but loving every minute of it! Usually a full time motorcycle traveler. I was on a world motorcycle trip when covid started last year. Decided to take a break for a while here in Seattle.

During your stay

Hi, I'm Michelle! I love to travel and cook. I've met some amazing hosts in Airbnb who are now my friends. I enjoy what I am doing, hosting people from all around the world that share the same joy - traveling. I am looking forward to hosting you and make your stay easy and pleasant.

Hello, I am a 30-year-old male that loves to travel. I live and work in Seattle but and use Airbnb whenever possible. I am a huge advocate of Airbnb and supporting local communities.

Welcome to our two-bedroom Townhouse with cozy backyard in Northgate area of Seattle.  This place has everything that you would need for a short stay or you can stay as long as you need. Great amenities in the house, high speed internet, complete kitchen and laundry in the unit.  It is home away from home.

Located few minutes away from Northgate mall.  It is about 20-25 minutes driving to the SeaTac airport and about 20 – 25 minutes to Paine field airport in Everett.  5 minutes’ drive or 20 min walk to the Link Rail station coming in October 2021

It is also great for business travelers, family reunions. Within 10-12 minutes to downtown Seattle, major grocery stores

My wife and I bought our dream mountain lodge instead of a place in the city!  We spend weekends there when not booked, and otherwise stay in Greenlake, a great neighborhood in Seattle.  We love cycling, cooking and anytime we can get out in the fresh mountain air that surrounds Seattle!

Don't believe the hype.  Seattle is a beautiful city that stays green and lush year-round from the rain that haunts its reputation.  People spend as much time outdoors here as indoors, and my favorite spots include the Ballard Locks, Lake Washington, Lake Union, and (suburban, but beautiful) Bellevue Park.

I'm Claudia, originally from Mexico City. I am an entrepreneur and mom of two beautiful angels! I am committed to hardly work to leave a better place for my kids. I am grateful everyday for the wonderful family I have!

Vacasa
Vacation Home Management

Vacasa unlocks the possibilities of how we enjoy vacation homes. We take care of managing our homeowners’ vacation houses so they can have peace of mind (and their home when they want to). And our guests book vacations confidently knowing they’re going to find exactly what they’re looking for without any surprises.

Each vacation home is always cared for by our professional local teams who implement our high cleanliness and maintenance values, while the hands-off tasks of vacation rental management--marketing, filing taxes, and maintaining a website--are handled by a specialized central support team. Our passion and focus remain true: to empower our homeowners, guests, and employees to invest in vacation.

Walk to Seattle University, or hop on the streetcar and head downtown. Views stretch from the skyline to the Puget Sound. Collaborate in the on-site co-working space before gathering with friends or colleagues on the rooftop lounge for happy hour. Other amenities include a fitness center, entertainment lounge, and laundry service.

*We design each space so you know what to expect, and while we stay true to our style, layout and furnishings may vary by unit.

*Luxury Hotel Management Meets Vacation Rentals*

Recreation is a boutique vacation rental management company that exists to create outstanding experiences for our guests & our property owners.

With a background in luxury hotel management, we operate high-quality accommodations for travelers looking to experience more than just a place to sleep. Recreation’s mission is to provide outstanding experiences through the unique elements of each destination.
​
Going beyond the typical hotel or vacation rental, Recreation pulls together the best service elements from what you'd expect in a luxury hotel, pairing it with locally focused experiences, thoughtful amenities and exceptional service.

We are passionate believers in the power of great hospitality experiences to bring people together.

Whether you’re traveling for work, exploring a new destination, or returning to a treasured location, Recreation has crafted a better vacation rental experience for you.

Vacasa
Vacation Home Management

Vacasa unlocks the possibilities of how we enjoy vacation homes. We take care of managing our homeowners’ vacation houses so they can have peace of mind (and their home when they want to). And our guests book vacations confidently knowing they’re going to find exactly what they’re looking for without any surprises.

Each vacation home is always cared for by our professional local teams who implement our high cleanliness and maintenance values, while the hands-off tasks of vacation rental management--marketing, filing taxes, and maintaining a website--are handled by a specialized central support team. Our passion and focus remain true: to empower our homeowners, guests, and employees to invest in vacation.

Hello! I am a Seattle native, musician, songwriter, and producer. Seattle's musical heritage is remarkable, and I'm proud to have been a part of it for over two decades. My husband Sky and I bought a unique, but run-down corner property in White Center in 2017. We fell in love with it because of it's proximity to a natural area, directly next to us on two sides, and teeming with wildlife. Our goal was to renovate the attached one bedroom mother-in-law and to build new construction for a one bedroom in the garage underneath. We have currently accomplished one of these goals, the brand new one bedroom that used be a garage, and are beyond excited to finally share it with you!  We did the majority of the work ourselves, (thanks, Youtube and Pinterest!), with the help of professionals, of course, for the important stuff.  It's been an arduous road, but we are delighted with the result and confident you will be too!

Captain Joy Nelson will lead your Joyfull Adventure. She has a wide range of experiences to safely pilot and navigate you on your trip. You're in the hands of a retired professional captain who had a master license for vessels up to 100 tons.

 As a registered nurse, Captain Nelson can handle any medical emergencies. She was a certified PADI scuba diver for years, and guests who are scuba certified will enjoy her boat for underwater tours of Puget Sound and the dive sites of the San Juan Islands. Captain Nelson is also a licensed ordained minister and can perform wedding ceremonies in the lovely garden atop the boat.

 Captain Nelson is known as a gracious host and gourmet cook. She has high energy and an infectious laugh. When you're on board with her, you'll feel right at home! 

 Your comfort on board is of prime importance. Please contact Captain Nelson with any questions you may have, and to arrange your ideal Northwest boating vacation!

I immediately fell in love with Seattle when I moved up here in 2003. The emerald city is an ideal mixer of city and nature. I can have them all within hours of drive or ferry. Till today, I still like to make new turns on my way to places, just to discover new spots and see new views. 

As a listing manager, I currently manage a short term rental business and work as an educator at a middle school. I'm a dream builder and love sharing with people the interesting places and unique experiences. I also enjoy helping people to transit and settle in this most desirable city.

Hello Travlers, 
Health and Safety are  our number one priority. We hire a professional commercial COVID CLEAN. We are proud to say, we require Airline Covid free test to keep you and future guest safe.  ALKI BEACH resturants serve or take to go, grocery open and coffee shops are open, nail  & hair salons, open. We are open in a private quiet setting free of crowds. Our home is sanitized with bleach and lysol then aired out. We sanitize door knobs, tv controls, floors,  and all bedding including pillows are washed in hot water. 
NO SMOKING: No smoking, vapping or any type of drugs are allowed unless prescribed. We and Airbnb have a Zero tolerance. 
If you are sick it is best to cancel your travel plans until your well. 
Welcome to Seattle's best and most desirable neighborhood. We are 10 to 15 min to the Airport and downtown Seattle. Ultra clean & location is prime! We book respectful clients who communicate well & respect our home. 

READ: 
STRICT REGISTERED GUEST ONLY, DON'T SNEAK PEOPLE OR PETS IN.  THE HOME IS ONLY SET UP FOR THE AMOUNT OF PEOPLE REGISTERED.  Men, Woman and Children must be registered through Airbnb. Maximum Capaicity are 5. 
COVID GUEST RESPONSIBILITIES:
GARBAGE MUST BE  RECYCLED  AND THROWN BY YOU AND  YOUR GUEST TO PREVENT CROSS CONTAMINATION. WE WILL NOT PICK UP OR THROW TRASH. 

STRICT NO PET POLICY 
Please don't try to sneak your pets in. We never want guest who are allergic to have a reaction.  We love pets but, we can not accept them due to other guest who have allergies. 

VACATION OR BUSINESS:
Your on Vacation or here for Business we are here if you need but, your Privacy and R and R  are utmost important. Our Family are Native to Seattle born and raised.  We love everything  about Seattle and all it has to offer. We also do business in Seattle at The Famous Pike Place Market  since 1968 and in the Real Estate Market for over 50 years. 

TRANSPORTATION:
Tansportation 2 Blocks to Metro Bus ride  to downtown Seattle or take a Water Taxi. You will discover Pike Place Market, The Space Needle, Museums, the Waterfront  os closed. 

ALKI BEACH COMMUNITY
Our Amazing Beach Home sits 3 houses away from the beach and boardwalk.The excitment is hete but,  set back so you don't hear all the noise. We have  everything to offer such as Internet Local Coffee Houses, Resturants, Bike Rental, Bars, Coastal Shops, Historical Light House Point and other sights. We love the natural surroundings here on Alki Beach seeing amazing views,Birds, Sea Otters, Eagles, and the amazing Sunsets of the Mountains and City views.Sleepless in Seattle, filmed here on Alki Beach & The Pike Place Market. (If you haven't seen the movie watch it)

FAMILY ORIENTED:
We are family oriented, love to share and recommend amazing places you must see. We respect your privacy, appreciate and book respectful clients only. 

STRICT NO EXTRA GUEST WITHOUT REGISTERING 
NO extra guest are allowed this includes children. Due to AIRBNB policies, liability and insurance. Anyone in the home must be registered. Guest that visit must register and you must inform us that you will have guest. ID IS REQUIRED FOR ALL ADULTS. NO Loud Parties are allowed. Max guest to visit are 4 but, if more we must be informed and approve your request. 

COMMUNICATION GOES BOTH WAYS:
We expect open communication and dialogue. Reviews are reciprocal we expect to have a review, We will write one on our experience with you. So please expect to write a review. 

Cheers to a Great Life and as they say," Lifes a Beach"
